title: Israelis Decide to Continue Talks With Egypt on Treaty
description: JERUSALEM, Dec. 31  The Israeli Government decided today to continue its peacetreaty talks with Egypt, and Prime Minister Menachem Begin suggested the negotiations could resume within the week or the next week.

title: New Quarters of Badillo Are a Credit to His Office
description: The desirable City Hall office that belonged to David W. Brown is going to Mr. Brown's title of Deputy Mayor for Policy. The office, which has glass doors ands vaulted ceiling, is twice the size of Mr, Badillo's former office, which was down a back passageway from the Mayor's, Mr, Badillo's new space is at the end of the main hallway of City Hall.

title: Rockland Seeks Way to Restrict Nuclear Wastes
description: NEW CITY, N.Y., Dec. 29  Following reports that radioactive wastes and materials from atomic reactor plants in the Northeast were being shipped regularly through Rockland County to processing areas in the South and West, the county's officials are considering following the lead of New York City in severely limiting such shipments.

title: Radio
description: 7 A.M.Noon, WNYCFM. Trio Sonata No. 1, Bach; Violin Concerto, Pisendel; Symphony No. 80, Haydn; Nocturne in E flat for Piano, Violin and Cello, Schubert; Othello: Fucco di gioia, Verdi; Romeo and Juliet, Prokofiev.

title: U.S. and Philippines Reach Accord On Aid and Use of Military Bases
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The United States and the Philippines announced agreement today on a new arrangement that will provide the Philippines with as much as $500 million in military and economic aid over the next five years in return for the Manila Government's allowing the Americans continued unhampered use of military bases there.

title: An Author of Books Is Not Entitled To News Protection, a Justice Says
description: The author of a book is not a journalist and is not entitled to a journalist's protections under the New York State shield law and the Constitution of the United States, a State Supreme Court justice in Brooklyn has ruled.

title: U.S. EMBASSY IN IRAN ADVISES DEPARTURE OF ALL DEPENDENTS
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Monday, Jan. 1 The United States Ambassador to Iran, citing the growing fuel shortage and the conditions prevailing in the major cities, recommended yesterday that the dependents of Americans working here leave temporarily.

title: John McG. Dalenz
description: John McG. Dalenz, senior vice president of the investment firm of Calvin Bullock Ltd., 1 Wall Street,. died Friday in Greenwich Hospital, Greenwich, Conn., at the age of 73. He lived in Riverside, Conn.

title: ProU.S. Mood Is a Revolution For the Chinese
description: PEKING, Dec. 31  In the past, China tried to copy the Soviet Union, but that was mistaken and now we must learn from America, a Chinese university student remarked today.

title: Win One for the Quitter
description: FOXBORO, MASS. QUIETLY, perhaps facetiously, perhaps not, the password for the New England Patriots had been Win One for The Quitter. Their coach, Chuck Fairbanks, had announced his intention to desert them in order to take command of football at the University of Colorado following the Patriots' last playoff game  a 3114 loss to the Houston Oilers yesterday that provoked a few hundred Patriot loyalists, many in redwhiteandblue stocking caps, to gather noisily near the entrance the Patriot locker room.

title: Letter, On Insurance Fraud
description: To the Editor:

title: Washin on Watch
description: WASHINGTON UNHERALDED and almost unnoticed, the most important signs of a new regulatory approach appeared recently when the Environmental Protection Agency formally proposed adopting the bubble concept for controlling air pollution. This concept is so named because it would view a factory as existing within a bubble and would regulate only the total pollution emerging from the top of the bubble. Industry would be left free to do whatever it wanted within the bubble.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: How many major league baseball players have won the triple crown (best batting average most home runs and most runs batted in)?

title: ANTIQUES
description: Auction fever has swept the world in recent seasons, and it promises to intensify dramatically in the year ahead. Spurred by a score of major sales in the last few years, many more art holdings have been flushed from private hands and institutions by the propertyhungry art auction houses.

title: OTC List: Some 1978 Standouts
description: Although the New York Stock Exchange is the most visible of all the nation's securities markets and nearly always dominates investor attention, the overthecounter market also provides some spectacular antics in shares of the nation's lesserknown companies that do not qualify for a Big Board listing.

title: CHINA URGES TAIWAN TO INITIATE TRADING WITH THE MAINLAND
description: PEKING, Dec. 31  China appealed to Taiwan tonight to begin trade with the mainland and allow direct postal service, shipping and personal visits as a first step toward eventual reunification of the Nationalistheld island with the rest of the country.

title: Senator Sparkman, Retiring, Urges Fresh Look at Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31 (AP)  The retiring chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee said today that Americans might have overrated the Soviet Union's strengths and, consequently, demanded tougher policies than necessary toward Moscow.

title: Staubach to Play, Landry Predicts
description: DALLAS, Dec. 31  Roger Staubach should be healthy enough to start at quarterback for the Dallas Cowboys in next Sunday's National Football Conference championship game, Coach Tom Landry said today.

title: U.S. and Taiwan Flags Lowered As Ties Are Symbolically Ended
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The United States symbolically ended all official relations with the Chinese Nationalist Government on Taiwan today, but nor, mal official business will continue to be carried on by the embassies in Washington and Taipei for two more months.

title: Muskie Questions Plans On Deficit of $30 Billion
description: WASHINGTON Dec. 31 (UPI)  Senator Edmund S. Muskie said today that the Administration's determination to hold the budget deficit for the fiscal year 1980 to $30 billion could lead to economic results we would not like.

title: Moscow Rings In the New Year at 40 Below Zero
description: MOSCOW, Dec. 31  It was so cold here on New Year's Eve that the trees sparkled with icy frost, weathermen advised parents to keep small children inside, and the nose of a Man who took a 10minute walk suddenly turned white with frostbite.

title: Israel Is a Target of Shah's Foes
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Dec. 31  The Israeli mission in Teheran, unlike all the others, flies no flag over its compound and no identification plates can be found on its iron gates or anywhere on the high gray walls that encircle it.

title: Obituary 6 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY DE TELEPHONED TO 353900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; PLASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6591800 CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: A Queens Bus Driver Is Wounded Resisting Two WouldBe Robbers
description: Two wouldbe robbers shot and seriously wounded a bus driver early yesterday in Queens when he resisted their demands for money, authorities said.

title: The Young Pessimists
description: Bert Williams used to tell a story about a man on a lonely road at night who suddenly saw a ghost come out of the forest and begin to follow him. The man walked faster and the ghost increased his pace. Then the man broke into a run with the ghost right on his heels. Mile after mile, faster and faster, they went until at last the man dropped at the side of the road exhausted. The ghost perched beside him on a large rock and boomed, That was quite a run we had. Yes, gasped the man, and as soon as I get my breath we're going have another one.

title: Francis Harding Horan, 78, Dies; Former Liggett & Myers Counsel
description: Francis Harding Horan, a lawyer and retired general counsel for the Liggett & Myers Tobacco Company, died yesterday at St. Clare's Hospital in Manhattan, after a brief illness. He was 78 years old and lived at 179 East 70th Streetand in Cornwall Hollow, Conn.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: ROGER WILLIAMS JR.

title: Reform Seeps Into India's Views On Caste, Family and Education
description: LOTUN, India  Three highcaste Hindus ambushed a young untouchable as he walked along a mud lane in this primitive village late one evening and beat him badly. because his wife had dared draw water from their well.

title: Islanders, Hot on Ice, Put Off by Snowfall
description: The National Hockey League game between the New York Islanders and the Chicago Black Hawks was postponed yesterday when O'Hare International Airport in Chicago was closed by a snowstorm.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: ESTHER HORAN BICKFORD

title: Veterans Administration Facing Pension and Education Disputes
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The Veterans Administration is at the center of a diverse, range of controversies, four years after the Vietnam War and two years after a Vietnam veteran became head of the agency and its $20billionayear medical, education, housing and welfare programs.

title: Chess:
description: For the first time since 1975, Diane Savereide's grip on the United States Women's Championship relaxed slightly, permitting Rachel Crotto to share the top honors. In the 23d tourney, held at Nazareth College in Rochester, each scored 72.

title: Thomas Brimer, at 78; Founder of Good Humor.
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Dec. 31 (AP)  Thomas J. Brimer, who with his two brothers founded the Good Humor Ice Cream Corporation of America, died Friday after a long illness. Mr. Brimer was 78 years old.

title: Mrs. Vanderbilt Takes Umbrage
description: Nobody likes to pay rent. That truism explains the popularity of rent control in general, and the problems of Louise Vanderbilt in particular. Mrs. Vanderbilt, an heiress of the wealthy clan, is due to be evicted from her two luxury apartments in Newport, R.I., for nonpayment of rent. She claims that the new owner of the mansion in which the apartments are located is gouging her, and demands that the city enact retroactive rent control to protect her and other tenants. Her anger is real; her demand for rent control, misguided.

title: U.S. Reappraises Persian Gulf Policies
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The United States is reappraising its policy toward the Persian Gulf and the Middle East as a result of the upheaval in Iran, with senior White House officials arguing that the turbulence is part of a much wider strategic crisis affecting the southern tier of nations that border on the Soviet Union.

title: Algeria After Boumediene
description: With the death of Houari Boumediene, Algeria's ruler for the past 13 years, that nation has lost an able, determined and prestigious leader.

title: Carey's Friends, Some Aides See His SwearingIn
description: ALBANY, Dec. 31  Governor Carey made the official transition between his first and second terms in office tonight at a private swearingin ceremony at the Executive Mansion here.

title: Colleges, Facing Decline, Advised to Lure Students
description: To survive the sharp enrollment declines projected for the next decade, colleges are being advised by the American Council on Education to start developing strategies to entice more, students to their campuses.

title: Al Jarreau Sings, Hisses, Whines In Mimicking Entire Jazz Band
description: Al Jarreau sings as if he had ants in his pants. As his hands finger an imaginary saxophone or bass, his voice squirms up and down octaves, now crying like a bird, now belching like a distant foghorn. From Louis Armstrong to Betty Carter, the greatest jazz singers have always emulated horns, but Mr. Jarreau goes much further and mimics an entire band, whining like a guitar and even hissing like a drummer'g highhat. Such virtuosity can strike you dumb. On the other hand, such hyperactivity can rack your nerves. In either case, Mr. Jarreau fascinates.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, JANUARY 1, 1979

title: Both the Aged And the Young Help Neediest
description: Giving to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund has become an honored tradition that is passed along from generation to generation in many families in the metropolitan area.

title: Meyer Triumphs In State Net Final
description: GLEN COVE, L.I., Dec. 31  Ricky Meyer of Great Neck defeated secondseeded John Hayes of Cos Cob, Cann., 62, 75, today and won the New York State men's indoor tennis championship at the Cove Racquet Club.

title: Bids for Canadian Pulp Units
description: TORONTO, Dec. 31  A series of dramatic corporate takeover moves has thrown the Canadian for stproducts business into turmoil and has focused the attention of government officials, investors and the public at large on one of Canada's oldest and most important industries.

title: Outdoors: Ignored Sea Duck Is in Fact Good Game
description: WHEN waterfowl seasons are agreed upon for the East Coast each year, there is always a special season for sea ducks  scoters, eiders and old squaws  that begins earlier and lasts later than that for most other ducks. To the man who likes to hunt them, this bonus is only one of two. For, despite the long season and a liberal daily bag limit (seven), relatively few East Coast gunners go after these strong, hardy and challenging birds, leaving the devotee pretty much to himself.

title: Father Helps Save Wife; Fire Kills Him, 2 Children
description: A 33yearold lawyer and his two young daughters were killed in a fire in their Nassau County home yesterday morning, just moments after the lawyer had helped his wife escape from a window.

title: Jazz: Sun Ra, Cecil Taylor Open Series at Space
description: Sun Ra and his troupe of musicians, singers, and dancers and the Cecil Taylor Unit filled the 920seat Symphony Space at 95th Street and Broadway for two shows Saturday night. It was an impressive showing for a brand of jazz that was widely attacked as antievolutionary or sheer noise a decade ago, and a promising start for a new series of jazz events at the Space. a converted movie theater.

title: ABROAD AT HOME Who Lost Iran?
description: BOSTON, Dec. 31  The accelerating events in Iran dispose forever of the notion that only religious fanatics and political radicals have opposed the Shah. It is clear now that farmers, shopkeepers, the middle class in large numbers want him out. The opposition looks more and more like a majority of Iranians.

title: The Region
description: FAIRVIEW, N.J. (UPI)  A fire, apparently started by a short circuit in bus, swept through an Orange and Black Company busline garage in this Bergen County town Saturday night, destroying 13 buses and the repair shop, fire officials said. There were no injuries in the blaze.

title: Many Towns Cutting Services to Hold Taxes Down
description: ISLIP, L.I., Dec. 30  The Town of Islip enjoys the distinction of being the only one of Suffolk County's 10 towns to hold the line on taxes as the. 1979 budget year begins. But when spring comes, Islip residents who keep their boats in town marinas will find that their fees have more than doubled.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BELLRINGER A varied lineup of artists and performers will be on stage at tonight's holiday marathon program of music, film, poetry, juggling and comedy, with proceeds going to the Poetry Project series of St. Mark's Church in the Bowery and to the Save St. Mark's Campaign, in the wake ofthat historic structure's damage by fire. Among those appearing will be John Cage, Kenneth Koch, Meredith Monk, Allen Ginsberg, John Giorno, Andy de Groat and Dancers, the Mettawee Theater Company, John Ashbery, the Talking Band, Ted Berrigan, Joan Jonas, Jackie Curtis and others.

title: Cheapest Utility Fuel? Can't Decide, Court Says
description: ALBANY, Dec. 31  Two years after the opening of hearings on the comparative costs of nuclear versus coalfired electric generating stations, an administrative law judge of the State Public Service Commission has concluded that it is impossible to answer in general terms the question of which is cheaper.

title: Sports World Specials
description: Now that President Carter has decided to recognize Peking at the expense of Taiwan, will Little League ball follow suit and end its association with the Taiwanese team, a twotime world champion?

title: 5 in Massachussetts Are Killed As a Fire Sweeps Frame Home
description: EAST LONGMEADOW, Mass., Dec. 31 (AP)  A fire in a frame house today took the lives of five people today, including Springfield restaurateur, his wife, two of their children and an elderly woman.

title: Boy, 6, Finds Abandoned Infant In Grocery Bag in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 31 (AP)  A 6yearold boy found a 3hourold baby in a paper grocery bag today, a hospital spokesman said.

title: Holtz's Heart Is at Ohio State
description: HONOLULU, Dec. 31 (UPI) Lou Holtz, head football coach at the University of Arkansas and former coach of the New York Jets, said today that he would stay at Arkansas as long as the people want me there, but he indicated that his heart was at Ohio State.

title: Purcell Captures Under21 Net Title
description: NASHVILLE, Tenn., Dec. 31 (AP) Topseeded Mel Purcell defeated Chip Tolleson, 63, 63, today to win the singles title in the United States under21 indoor tennis championships.

title: SCIENTIFIC JOURNALS MAY FACE CLOSINGS
description: The Internal Revenue Service intends to revoke the taxexempt status of the publishers of a number of scientific and medical journals, according to an editorial being published today in the Journal of the American Medical Association.

title: ESSAY
description: WASHINGTON  A desire to improve my abysmal prediction percentage has caused me to delay the sixth annual office pool until after the publication of the prophecies of what the National Enquirer calls the top ten psychics.

title: The City
description: Memorial services were held yesterday at Broadway Presbyterian Church for Bruce Jay. Wells, the 19yearold University pf Denver student who was shot through the head last Thursday night while en route to a basketball tournament at City College. The police believe he was killed because he could offer his assailant only two dollars.

title: At a Truck Stop, Dollars Roll
description: BLOOMSBURY, N.J.  It's Friday night, and the 200seat restaurant is filling up rapidly with couples and singles of all ages. They show an overwhelming preference for. trucker's steak  a chewy cut of chuck smothered in cold, thick gravy. The jukebox blurts out such favorites as Yodelin Wheels, Hot Load Blues and Trucker's Nightmare.

title: Holiday Closings
description: Banks, businesses, securities markets, commodities exchanges, government offices and most retail establishments in the United States, Canada and Europe will be closed today in observance of New Year's Day. Most businesses and markets will reopen tomorrow'.

title: Big 3 Lose in Basketball
description: Which is the nation's No.1 college basketball team?

title: Television
description: Afternoon

title: Notes on People
description: Can it be that Holden Caulfield is 60 years old? Incredibly, it can. Today, in fact  a perfect day for thoughts about the ferociously private J. (for Jerome) D. (for David) Salinger as he pasSes a milestone. Not that there's much news. Mr. Salinger still stays to himself in Cornish, N.H., though sometimes he can be spotted dropping by the Nugget Theater in Hanover, or picking up his mail in nearby Windsor, Vt., or, as he was last Labor Day, watching a local softball game. After such tidbits, the pickings get slim.

title: Bridge:
description: Nobody, unfortunately, keeps track of competitive bridge records with the same enthusiasm that some treasure baseball records. But there are several players from the New York metropolitan area with strong claims in different categories.

title: Eugene E. Ellis Jr., 62; Paper Company Officer
description: Eugene E. Ellis Jr., a retired vice president of International Paper Company and a developer of new techniques in the domestic forest products industry, died Thursday at his home in Mobile, Ala. after a long illness. Mr. Ellis was 62 years old.

title: Blizzard Snarls Travel in Europe
description: PARIS, Dec. 31 (Reuters)  Thousands of travelers were stranded and snowbound across much of Europe today in the biggest New Year's Eve blizzard in decades. At least four persons died as snowstorms paralyzed trains, disrupted shipping, brought chaos to highways and closed airports.

title: McHargue Sets Jockey Earnings Record
description: ARCADIA, Calif., Dec. 31 (AP) Darrel McHargue broke the singleyear earnings record for a jockey today by riding three winners at Santa Anita on the final day of 1978. His winners included a long shot, Sweet Little Lady, in the $54,800 Las Flores Handicap.

title: Deaths
description: MARTINDALEWight, of Montclair, NJ, formerly of Glen Ridge, NJ on Dec 30, 1978, husband of the late Elizabeth Brown Martindale, father of Wight Martindale, Jr., brother of Mrs Roger N. Steelman, Harry T. and Ross Martindale, grandfather of Heidi E.. Kara A. and Wight Martindale, Ill. Graveside services will be held at Bloomfield Cemetery, Bloomfield NJ on Wednesday morning at 11 o'clock. Those who wish to send flowers are requested to make contributions Instead to Lehigh University, Bethlehem, Pa.

title: 2 Tankers in Trouble Off Iberia; One Carrying 30 Million Gallons
description: LONDON, Dec. 31 (AP)  Two tankers, one carrying nearly 30 million gallons of crude Oil, were reported in trouble tonight in separate incidents in the Atlantic Ocean off the coasts of Spain and Portugal.

title: Tracing Any Kennedy Conspirator Is Given Little Chance by Officials
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The chances of identifying and prosecuting conspirators in the murder of President John F. Kennedy, 15 years after the assassination, appeared remote, several Federal law enforcement officials said today.

title: Sporting Gear
description: Too cold to jog outdoors these wintry days? Try the Jogger Plus, an exercise system utilizing that old fad the trampoline. This particular trampoline offers far less bounce than those with which you may have had experience, so that you aren't sent flying as you take that morning workout. It is also compact  2 feet by 2 feet, not counting the padded frame, making it just large enough to allow you to run in place while holding on to a vertical bar 53 inches long. There are also fittings, made of steel tubing and rubber cable, for stretching exercises, pushups, shoulder stands and so forth. Order directly from the manufacturer, the Sidlinger Products Company, Box 401806, Garland, Tex. 75040, (214) 4943488. The price is $199, though freight costs, payable upon delivery, bring the total to approximately $219.

title: Rangers Lose, 65, On Four Late Goals
description: When the Madison Square Garden fans yelled One, two, three, four, five. We want six! early in the final period of last night's game between the Atlanta Flames and New York, they meant six Ranger goals. Instead the Flames took the cue and scored four consecutive goals to beat the Rangers, 65.

title: Dils Passes Stanford to Victory
description: HOUSTON, Dec. 31 (AP)  Steve Dils, the nation's leading college quarterback, threw three touchdowns passes over a 4minute30second span of the third quarter tonight to rally Stanford from a 220 deficit to a 2522 victory over 11thranked Georgia in the Bluebonnet Bowl.

title: New Acts Against Israel Planned by Palestinians
description: BEIRUT. Lebanon, Dec 31  A principal leader of the Palestinian guerrilla movement has announced a new program combining stronger military action against Israel with more intensive diplomatic moves in an effort to insure Palestinian unity.

title: Sports Today
description: Cotton Bowl, Houston vs. Notre Dame, at Dallas. (TelevisionChannel 2, 2 P.M.)

title: What It Means to Be the No. 1 Team
description: NEW ORLEANS, Dec. 31  Penn State and Alabama will meet tomorrow in the Sugar Bowl for what has been called a dream game to determine the college football championship. But some of the rewards for past winners of this title have turned out to be nothing like what those involved dreamed of while reaching for that crown. And other rewards turned out not to be rewards at all.

title: Big Improvements Cited In City's Law Department
description: TO survive and prosper, partners at the large law firms on Wall Street and Park Avenue must do two things: seek out new clients and recruit new lawyers.

title: O.E.C.D. Says Oil Rise Imperils Inflation Fight
description: PARIS, Dec. 29  The 14.5 percent oil price increase planned by the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries for 1979 threatens to wipe out what little further progress the West is likely to make in its flagging battle against Inflation, according to new calculations by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: Kraus Sings Ernesto in Don Pasquale at the Met
description: Alfredo Kraus, absent from the Metropolitan Opera roster for the last six years, returned to the company Saturday. night to sing Ernesto in the new production of Don Pasquale. Actually, Mr. Kraus's first appearance was scheduled for this Thursday's performance of the opera, but Nicolai Gedda's indisposition brought him to the cast earlier than planned.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TOMORROW, Jan. 2

title: DEATH
description: JILERHarry, suddenly on Dec 31, 1978 In Palm Beach, Fla., beloved husband of Elsa, dear brother of Milton, William, Pegg Tolins, Lilian Savage, Helen Belinkie and of the late George, also survived by nephews and nieces. Funeral arrangements incomplete.

title: The Washington Star Drops Today's Issue, But Averts a Closing
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  Lastminute agreement between management and labor averted possible closing of The Washington Star but did not come in time to keep the financially ailing paper from scrapping its Monday issue.

title: Sale of TaxDelinquent Homes in Akron Faces Upset
description: AKRON, Ohio, Dec. 31  When Summit County was faced with a $3 million welfare debt, officials decided to auction off about 650 properties whose owners had not paid taxes for at least 10 years.

title: Racing Year Ends, Only to Start Again
description: Moments after ringing out the old year at Aqueduct yesterday, New York's tireless horseplayers began making resolutions for the new season that starts today.

title: O.K., Let's Try It Again
description: WHAT ho! A New Year's resolution. Why not? Oh, sure, it's presumptuous. How can a sportswriter who can't run, throw, hit, hit with power, audibilize, rotate into a zone, slamdunk or climb out of the low five figures be qualified to propose New Year's resolutions for people who can do those things and more?

title: Vikings Trounced After 1010 Halftime Tie
description: LOS ANGELES, Dec. 11  The Los Angeles Rams took a big step today toward their longunrealized goal  the Super Bowl  with a 3410 victory over the Minesota Vikings.

title: U.S.C. Still Hoping for No. 1
description: It is only a slim chance, but for the University of Southern California any hope for a national championship is better than none.

title: Deaths
description: BARNHARDTAlice, beloved sister of Bernice, loving aunt of Beryl and Gerald, greataunt of Amy and Jason. Services were held Sunday, Dec 31, 1978.

title: Not by God Alone
description: DENVER  I am finishing one of those semesters which makes me think I should leave teaching. I know at least 783 people would line up for my job teaching English and women's studies at my openadmissions, urban college. As I have no particular inclination to go into either sales or the business world, my prospects would indeed be limited. So just imagine how emotionally wornout and pessimistic I must be to even think of quitting.

title: Pope Picks Friend as New Cracow Prelate
description: WARSAW, Dec. 31  Each week for years, a tall, lean, asceticlooking priest arrived at the home of the ailing uncle of a leading Cracow Catholic editor to comfort the aging invalid and say a mass in his apartment.

title: Books of the Times A Dogged Churchman
description: Freshly graduated from Princeton College in 1928, the Rev. Eugene Carson Blake took a teaching post at a Christian mission school in India. To solve the problem of transporting himself from the school to the nearest city, Lahore. now a part of Pakistan, he by- passed the standard bicycle and located a motorcycle. His maiden voyage aboard the machine produced a mishap, but he mended his cuts and bruises and lived to ride another day.

title: Saudis, Edgy on Iran, Wooing Egypt Back to Fold
description: CAIRO, Dec. 31  The growing instability in Iran appears to be putting pressure on Saudi Arabia to help end Egypt's isolation from Arab countries that are opposed to its peace talks with Israel.

title: Johnny Majors Scouts Sugar Bowl
description: NEW ORLEANS DOWN in the Southeastern Conference we have had more than our share of what could be called the Year of the Bear.

title: FILM MAKER IN WAR OVER A DALLAS LAW
description: DALLAS, Dec. 31  Attorneys for the city of Dallas and the United Artists Corporation are to begin the new year with battle in an old war, this time over the science fiction film Invasion of the Body Snatchers.

title: Alex Van Riper Married to Peter C. Bulkley
description: Alexandra Jay Van Riper, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Austin Van Riper of Bronxville, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Peter Cameron Bulkley, son of Mrs. Marilyn Bulkley of Irvine, Calif., and Roger Charles Bulkley of New Canaan, Conn.

title: A Reminder to Elderly About Rail HalfFares
description: The halffare program for elderly and handicapped riders on the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's commuter lines will be effective 24 hours a day rather than on nonrushhour trains only, startina today.

title: FOOD
description: The food we eat in 1979 may be rich in vitamins and minerals but to be truly nourishing it must also be fortified with status (the minimum daily requirement for which has not yet been determined).

title: In Columbus, Tears and Relief
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Dec. 31  The house at 1711 Cardiff Road in the Upper Arlington section of Columbus was locked and shuttered this morning. This has been Woody Hayes's home for the last 25 years, an old frame structure whose green and white paint is peeling in large nieces from the sides.

title: International
description: Digest BUSINESS

title: FASHION
description: After a number of years during which fashion was perceived as having made tremendous progress in the direction of freedom, comfort and style, the forward thrust was aborted in the collections presented for spring.

title: Icelandic Boys Match Wits And Win Hearts and Games
description: From the observation deck high atop the World Trade Center, a cluster of boys looked down on the petrified forest of corporate spires bristling across Lower Manhattan. The skyline view was awesome, and they were impressed, but there were no gasps, no gushes of enthusiasm.

title: WildCard Oilers Upset Patriots
description: FOXBORO, Mass., Dec. 31  During the third quarter of Houston's 3114 American Conference playoff victory over New England today, the Schaefer Stadium announcer asked someone in the stands to stop blowing a whistle. It's causing problems on the field, the announcer advised.

title: 3 Agencies Replacing Panel on Civil Service
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  The 96yearold Civil Service Commission passes into history tonight. Under a Presidential reorganization plan it will be replaced in 1979 by three new agencies.

title: SOCIAL LIFE
description: It's going to be a very mixedup year, the absolute pits for the insecure. The rules for fashion may have relaxed, but the rules for what's going to be done, and what isn't going to be done, have practically disappeared.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L.I., Dec. 31  Michelle Weiss of Tenafly, N.J., eliminated firstseeded Rosalyn Fairbank of South Africa, 63, 75, today and gained the girls' 18yearsandunder division final of the international junior tennis tournament at the Port Washington Tennis Academy.

title: A Jones Aide Says Move to Soviet Was Imminent Before the Deaths
description: MEMPHIS  The People's Temple commune in Jonestown, Guyana, had turned so miserable that the Rev. Jim Jones was preparing to move it through Cuba to the Soviet Union just before the mass suicides and murders in November, according to a former aide.

title: U.S. SAYS IRAN MOVE IS NOT EVACUATION
description: WASHINGTON, Dec. 31  With the situation in Iran deteriorating almost daily, the United States today urged the dependents of all Americans there to leave. But in an effort to reduce the political impact on the embattled regime of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, the Carter Administration refused to call the move an evacuation.

title: NBC Buys a Series Continuing Here to Eternity
description: NBCTV has purchased its first new series for next September, one that is to be an extension of From Here to Eternity, the World War II novel by the late James Jones.

title: Albany Session Is Due to Stress State Economy

title: Misgivings About the Volunteer Army
description: After years of stiff-upper-lip denials, the nation's military leaders are beginning to express their concerns about the allvolunteer Army. This week, the Army will begin experimenting with a new educational bonus scheme designed to attract collegeoriented recruits. Moreover, the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff has even raised the possibility of a return some day to the military draft or some other form of universalservice. The strength, quality and cost of the volunteer forces are all sources of worry, but the most critical problem is how to mobilize the reinforcements that might have to be rushed to Europe in the event of a war crisis.

title: Long Beach, Calif: The Selling of a 2d City
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., Jan. 1  The Queen Mary didn't do it, the Grand Prix didn't do it, and the Spruce Goose laid an egg. Now, promoters here have another plan to put Long Beach back on the map: They want to build the world's highest building.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 1  Israeli troops tonight quickly stopped an attempt by militants of Gush Emunim to create a Jewish civilian foothold on yet another hilltop in the occupied West Bank in defiance of the Government.

title: SHAH NOW WILLING TO TAKE VACATION
description: TEHERAN, Iran; Jan. 1  Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi made his first public appearance in two months today to dramatize that he was in no hurry to leave the country, but he expressed a desire to take a vacation once a new civilian government was firmly in power.

title: Books: Lilli Palmer Bows With Her First Novel
description: LILLI PALMER established her: self as an independent sort early in her career. Miss Palmer, extremely pleasing to look at, does not rely upon her looks, one col- umnist wrote in 1938, three years after

title: Text of Carey Address at SecondTerm Inauguration
description: Today I extend to the people of New York State a welcome to the inauguration not only of a Governor, but of the new era of opportunity in the history of the greatest state in the nation.

title: SHUTDOWN AVERTED AT PAPER IN CAPITAL
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 1  The Washington Star reached an agreement with its printers union tonight on the issue of job layoffs and averted the threatened permanent closing of the 125-year-old afternoon daily.

title: Francine Blau Wed To Lawrence Kahn
description: Francine Dee Blau, daughter of Dr. Harold Blau of Hollis, Queens, and Sylvia Blau of Far Rockaway, Queens, was married yesterday to Lawrence Max Kahn, son of Mr. and Mrs. Max L. Kahn of Scarsdale, N.Y. Acting Village Justice Miriam Cedarbaum of Scarsdale performed the ceremony at the Kahn home.

description: TOKYO, Jan. 1  Japan's powerful Mitsui Group, deeply alarmed by events in Iran, is preparing to delay the start of operations at a giant petrochemical complex at Bandar Shapur on the Persian Gulf, according to Asahi Shimbun, the Japanese newspapers

title: New Zealand on Alert As U.F.O. Is Reported
description: AUCKLAND, New Zealand, Jan. 1 (AP)  The Royal New Zealand Air Force put a Skyhawk jet fighter on special standby alert today after a television news team filmed what it said was an unidentified flying object. Aviation authorities reported the U.F.O. was apparently tracked by radar as well.

description: If, on a nighttime drive a thousand miles or so from New York City, you have fiddled with the radio dial and have come upon the familiar sounds of WCBS or WNBC or WABC, you were probably a beneficiary of clearchannel broadcasting.

title: Klein to Propose Tax Cut of 25% Over Five Years
description: Calling the case for changes in property taxes in Suffolk County the most compelling of any area in the country, County Executive John V. N. Klein will today propose a local law that would reduce county taxes by 25 percent over fiveyear period.

title: Warriors Defeat Sonics On 3d Period Surge, 11097

Parish and Phil Smith of the Warrior; combined for 16 points in that period.

title: Soviets Said to Return .Cult Funds
description: The Soviet Embassy in Guyana has acknowledged that it received money from the People's Temple, according to an Associated Press dispatch from Georgetpwn, and says that it turned the money over to the Guyanese Government.

title: Women's Patrol Maintains a. Midday Watch in Borough Park
description: The walkietalkie crackles a5 the car prowls the deserted midday street.. Unit three to base, says the radio operator in a low voice. Unit three to base do you read me?

description: A Couple of Political Losers Miss Winner's Big Moment
