title: College Football: Points From Big, and Bigger
description: THE internal struggle that has been developing within the National Collegiate Athletic Association for several years. involving Division 1 football schools, will enter another round in the annual convention at San Francisco Jan. 810. More rich-get-richer proposals are on the agenda. I believe recent restructuring legislation will do irreparable damage to the athletic programs at many institutions and shatter a number of longstanding conference alignments, and now there are proposals for more of the same.

title: Willie Miler: The Rain From Vietnam
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 6  it is 10 years now since Willie Miller was slogging through the Vietnam rice paddies in the war the nation wants to forget. He would like to forget it, too. But he can't. His nightmares won't let him. Neither will strangers who discover he was awarded the Silver Star. the Soldier's Medal and the Purple Heart during his two-and-ahalf years there. And neither will his Los Angeles Rams teammates. None of them naa to go to Vietnam, so they often ask him what it was like. I tell em the truth, he says. But death isn't beautiful. When it gets gory, they drop the subject. And yet, if it were not for his Army duty there, Willie Miller doubts that he would be a wide receiver for the Rams, who oppose the Dallas Cowboys here tomorrow for the National Conference championship.

title: Four Saved in Fifth Day on Raft
description: SEATTLE, Jan. 6 (AP) - Four persons who spent more than four days aboard covered life raft after their crab boat sank in the Gulf of Alaska were rescued yesterday by the crew of a tugboat, the Coast Guard said. Their survival suits and the sheltered life raft probably saved them, a spokesman said.

title: Invisible Man
description: Edited by Herbert Aptheker. Vol. 111: Selections 19441963. 483 pp. Amherst, Mass.: University of Massachusetts Press. $22.50.

title: Other World Events
description: France took over the rotating presidency of the Common Market last week, just in time to supervise this year's first direct elections to the European Parliament and to give French politicians a new focus for attacks on their Government  and each other. Jacques Chirac, whose neoGaullist party is a member of the ruling coalition, has accused President Valery Giscard d'Estaing of undermining French independence through his support for the European elections and the new European Monetary System. Mr. Chirac's virulence has made some of his followers squirm but, significantly, is supported by the Communists. The Communists, in turn, have incurred the wrath of Moscow, which supports the elections, for rejecting proletarian internationalism.

title: Barnum Would Still Have a Few Things to Hail in Bridgeport
description: At first view from the elevated Connecticut Turnpike, which slices through the heart of downtown at eye level with the upper floors and rooftops of seemingly endless rows of old red brick factory buildings, Bridgeport is not exactly inspiring. As a place to stop and visit it is an improbable destination - improbable but deceptive..

title: ART
description: HUNTINGTON

title: By Covered Wagon Through Burgenland
description: Tourists tend to trust in illusions when they go abroad  and can learn painfully that some such notions are more threadbare than the Emperor's New Clothes. A United States passport used to be considered better armor than a bulletproof vest: now, after enough of us have muddled into war: and terrorism where our American identity can make us prime targets, WE know better. But another myth per sists: that any kind of packaged tour ism has a builtin guarantee of safety, particularly when it is under hostcountry auspices. I have to confess I be lieved this until I treated my family tc a Saturday and Sunday traveling by horsedrawn covered wagon through Burgenland, the main agricultural province of Austria.

title: Disclosure Plan Irks UsedCar Dealers
description: He feels that some are good for him and that some he can live with. And then there are some like a recent Federal Trade Commission proposal calling for dealers to label defects in their vehicles and be responsible for any undisclosed faults.

title: AirSea Hunt Is Pressed for Tugboat and Crew of
description: Coast Guard, Navy and Air Force rescue units yesterday searched the chill seas off Atlantic City for a 70foot tugboat and its crew of four who were last heard from five days ago.

title: Government vs. the Publics Richt to Know
description: ACONSTITUTIONAL battle affecting every American has been fought in the New Jersey courts. The issue: Does the public have the right to know the truth through a free press, or shall the press be Governmentcontrolled?

title: U.S. and Filipinos Sign Agreement On the Use of Air and Navy Bases
description: MANILA, Jan. 7  After three years of talks and some lastminute skirmishing over phraseology, the United States and Philippine Governments reached agreement today on treaty amendments that assure United States forces unhampered use of sophisticated air and naval installations here until 1983.

title: Movie Filmed at Pratt Not Quite Educational
description: A new pornographic movie filmed partly on the campus of Brooklyn's Pratt Institute has embarrassed officials of the institute, who originally thought it was going to be an educational film, they said yesterday.

title: Peking Throng Pays Homage to Chou
description: PEKING, Jan. 7  Crowds of Chinese trooped to Tien An Men Square today bearing wreaths and flowers to pay homage to Chou Enlai on the third anniversary of his death.

title: Fairchild Industries Diversifies
description: Fairchild Industries plans to purchase a 20.7 percent interest in the Bunker Ramo Corporation and desires to explore the possibility of mutually beneficial business connections with Bunker Ramo, Fairchild announced over the weekend.

title: Weekly Lotto Numbers Drawn
description: The winning numbers selected Saturday in the weekly New York State Lotto drawing were 22, 24, 13, 36, 8 and 19. The supplemental number was 16.

title: ALGERIAN MINORITY MAY POSE PROBLEMS
description: AIT FRAM, Algeria  O, cher monsieur! We have suffered a lot, said the old man, his gray eyes suddenly giving life to a stony face beneath a woolen cap. They burned everything, even the olive groves. They killed the sheep, the buffaloes. He paused. Let's not talk about it any more.

title: Companies
description: BUSINESS Digest

title: World News Briefs
description: HAVANA, Jan. 7 (Reuters)  President Fidel Castro of. Cuba suggested today that the trade embargo imposed by the United States should be at least partially lifted to improve relations, a Congressional group visiting from the United States reported.

title: Obituary 3 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Legal Education Debate Focuses On Theoretical vs. Practical Skill
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 5  It does not happen often these days, but a group of law professors cheered a Federal judge who was talking about legal education. In fact, more than 1,000 law professors, deans and administrators gave a sustained standing ovation to Judge Carl McGowan of the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia.

title: Housing Subsidy to Young Couples Draws Big Demand in Connecticut
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Jan. 7  State officials heaved a sigh of relief Friday after completing their first week of operating a new housing agency and administering a new program of lending young couples with moderate incomes the down payments for houses costing up to $60.000.

title: Ballet: The Grandeur Of Balanchine's Barocco
description: INSIDE the soul of any true admirer of George Balanchine's work, there lurks Concerto Barocco. If any ballet conveys the ineffability of art, this is the one.

title: Paula Robison, Flutist, Begins Series at Tully
description: THE flute certainly has become extraordinarily popular with audiences these days, and, judging from a packed Alice Tully Hall on Saturday afternoon, Paula Robison is one of the instrument's most popular practitioners. This was the first in a series of three Paula and... concerts this season, a Baroque program devoted to the music of Bach and Couperin in which Miss Robison shared performing duties with the harpsichordist Anthony Newman.

title: COMPTROLLER VOIDS CAREY'S APPOINTEES UNDER RECESS RULES
description: ALBANY, Jan. 7  State Comptroller Edward V. Regan said today that he would remove from the state payroll the 68 officials whose appointment by Governor Carey is under challenge by the Republicancontrolled State Senate, as well as the people they replaced.

title: Nets Triumph
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Jan. 7  Coach Kevin Loughery kept his cool and Bernard King got hot tonight as the New Jersey Nets beat the Phoenix Suns, 117112, under a new command alignment designed to help Loughery stay out of trouble.

title: Assemblyman Is Facing Arrest In Hasidic Clash
description: Assemblyman Samuel Hirsch, Democrat of Brooklyn, and four other men were to be arrested today on charges growing out of the violent clash last month between Hasidic demonstrators and police officers at a precinct station in the Borough Park section of Brooklyn.

title: Bridge:
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., Jan. 7  Two dramatic slam deals turned an apparently easy victory into a fierce battle at the American Contract Bridge League's international team trials final here this afternoon.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Though he drifted wide in the stretch, Jerry Frankel's Go Forth gained the first stakes victory of his career yesterday by capturing the $52,450 Assault Handicap before 12,206 damp fans at Aqueduct.

title: Carter at Summit Talks: A Gain in Stature
description: ST.FRANOIS, Guadeloupe, Jan. 7 Before sitting down to lunch at a luxurious villa near here Friday, President Carter and the leaders of France, West Germany and Britain strolled around the garden exchanging jokes and banter. At

title: Islanders Add Punch, Seek Champagne
description: COOLLY, feet planted and bent slightly, Bryan Trottier leans over the faceoff circle as the referee is poised to drop the puck on a power play for the New York Islanders. It is the opening minutes of a game against the Vancouver Canucks at the Nassau Coliseum. It is going to be a blowout. The Islanders will win, 90.

title: Sherlock Holmes's 125th Birthday Observed by Fans
description: Sherlock Holmes showed up at his 125th birthday party the other night at the Regency Hotel in Manhattan. His disguise was so clever that even in a roomful of the Baker Street Irregulars, a club whose members are selftaught to observe what others overlook, the immortal detective was not spotted.

title: Sports World Specials
description: Can Broadway Joe be returning to the scene of his greatest triumphs?

title: U.S. to Release Utah Fallout Report
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 7  The Government intends to release tomorrow an unpublished Federal study showing that an unusually high number of leukemia deaths were occurring among Utah residents who were exposed to radioactive fallout from atomic bomb tests, a spokesman for the Department of Health, Education and Welfare said tonight.

title: Sportsystems Acquisition
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 7 (AP)  The Sportsystems Corporation has acquired the Pennsylvania Steel Foundry and Machine Company, a producer of carbon and alloy steel castings, officials of Sixirtsystem have announced. No terms were disclosed.

title: Andy Gustafson Dies; Former Coach at Miami
description: MIAMI, Jan. 7 (AP)  Andy Gustafson, formerly head football coach at the University of Miami and a backfield coach at the United States Military Academy when Army was a national power, died today at age 74, a month after he suffered a stroke following kidneystone surgery.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 7 (AP)  John Wayne Gacy had been linked to five alleged sexual assaults or disappearance cases dating to August 1975 before a sixth case led police to the first of 27 skeletal remains at his home last month, according to law enforcement officials.

title: US. Company Irks Australians
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Jan. 7  According to a recent survey made for the United States Government, the most unpopular multinational company in Australia is Utah International Inc., the San Franciscobased mining company. The Utah Development Company, its affiliate in Australia, is that country's biggest profit earner. Spokesmen for Utah say it is criticized by Australians because it is a very successful company.

title: Marshall Brickman Directs First Film
description: LOS ANGELES MARSHALL BRICKMAN, who shared a 1977 Academy Award with Woody Allen for the screenplay of Annie Hall, will begin directing his first movie, Simon, on Feb. 26 in New York.

title: Fresh Street Violence Greets New Iranian Regime
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 7  Iran's new civilian Government encountered serious problems today, and its first 24 hours produced no sign of an end to political and economic strife.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Deaths
description: GREENBAUM  Bertha Eleanor, beloved wife of the late Sylvan Greenbaum. loving mother of Joanne, Carol and Lynn. Devoted grandmother of Lisa, Lauren, Lesley, Randl, Nanci, Jonathan, Todd and Sage. Her kindness will long be remembered. Funeral services Friday, 9:45 AM, January 12, at Schwartz Brothers Memorial Chanel, 11403 Queens Blvd., Forest Hills. Please confirm after Wednesday.

title: Schlesinger Says Iran Oil Strikes Are Likely to Increase Gas Prices
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 8 (UPI) Energy Secretary James R. Schlesinger said today that gasoline prices are likely to rise 6 cents or 7 cents this year and indicated the Iranian oil stoppage could lead to rationing or government allocations if it lasts longer than three months.

title: Experts Tell How Antarctic's Ice Could Cause Widespread Floods
description: HOUSTON  If the West Antarctic ice sheet slips into the sea, as some glaciologists believe is possible, boats could be launched from the bottom steps of the Capitol in Washington and a third of Florida would be under water, a climate specialist said today.

title: Dr. James Bordley 3d, A Hospital Director, 78
description: Dr. James Bordley 3d, a former director of the Mary Imogene Bassett Hospital, in Cooperstown, N.Y., died Saturday at the hospital following a long illness. He was 78 years old and a resident of Cooperstown.

description: Afternoon

title: Dozens of Candidates Lining Up For the New Hampshire Primary
description: CONCORD, N.H., Jan. 7 (AP)  Indian chiefs, poets, inventors and eccentrics are lining up for New Hampshire's Presidential primary.

title: Tentative Pact Set In German Steel Strike
description: BONN, Jan. 7  Negotiators reached a tentative settlement today designed to end the 41dayold West German steel strike that has idled 100,000 workers at 19 plants and threatened the country's long period of labor peace.

title: Machine Tools at Peak Capacity
description: On the heels of its best year, the machinetool industry is entering 1979 at peak capacity. Sustained by a full order book, almost openended demand from autos and aerospace and a substantial increase in export orders, the industry is likely to remain at capacity well into the early 1980's.

description: Working group on international negotiable instruments on trade  10 A.M. and 3 P.M.
