description: Jimmy Connors and John McEnroe provided a preview of coming attractions last night with impressive straightset victories in the Grand Prix Masters tournament at Madison Square Garden.

title: Late Goal by Woods Aids 55 Deadlock
description: DETROIT, Jan. 10  The Detroit Red Wings, criticized for much of the season for fading in the closing stages of their games, accounted for a surprising turnaround tonight as they tied the powerful New York Islanders, 55, at the Olympia.

title: Career Project Set at 5 Schools
description: The Board of Education will introduce a computerized career information system in five New York City high schools this spring. As part of a pilot project, computers will be installed at Hillcrest and Francis Lewis in Queens, Port Richmond on Staten Island, Abraham Lincoln in Brooklyn and Jane Addams in the Bronx. The program, financed by $150,000 Federal grant, will enable students to find out where and how to get training for a job and what openings are available in the metropolitan area.

title: Colombia Halts A.P. Operations
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, Jan. 10 (UP1)The Colombian Government has suspended operations of The Associated Press, accusing the news agency of failing to have the proper accreditation and transmitting frankly tendentious and inexact news. The presidential press office said today that A.P. had no representative registered with the Communications Ministry or any authorities, as required, and would be suspended omit it met the requirements.

title: Ski Reports
description: All ski areas are operating on very limited terrain. Figures in parentheses show total trails and number open at each area. Skiarea forecasts appear on the weather page. For information: New York, (212) 7558100; New Jersey, (609) 2928456 Thursdays and Fridays from 2 to 4 P.M.; Pennsylvania, (717) 4215791; New Hampshire, (603) 2242525; Vermont, (802) 2290531, and Massachusetts, (800) 6285030.

title: Sandgate Holds Acquisition Talks
description: The Sandgate Corporation disclosed that it was having preliminary discussions with an unrelated company listed on the New York Stock Exchange concerning the possible aquisition of Sandgate in exchange for shares of the other company.

title: About Smithtown
description: SMITHTOWN, L.I., Jan. 9  Pat Vecchio is cutting downfield on the Gracie Mansion lawn with a football under his arm and with John V. Lindsay blocking for him and ,still managing the smile that is the same in games as it is on posters.

title: CBS Strives to Regain TV Lead
description: Backe, at Helm 2 Years, Voices Determination

title: 0. T.B. Fails to Meet Revenue Goal And to Reduce Illegal Bookmaking
description: When the Of ft rack Betting Corporation opened for business in 1971, New York City officials predicted that in five years the public benefit corporation would provide at least $100 million a year in revenue to the city. OTB advocates also forecast that it would throttle illegal bookmakers. Today, neither goal is in sight.

title: American Home Overpayments
description: Stockholders of the American Home Products Corporation, responding to urgent pleas from the Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company, have voluntarily returned 98 percent of the $7.8 million that the bank's computer erroneously paid in dividends.

title: Bridge:
description: Most of the players who won the international team trials in Cherry Hill, N.J., last weekend, thus qualifying to play in the world championship in Brazil next October, are no strangers to international competition.

title: Boy Fleeing Mugger Saved on IND Tracks
description: With the sound of an approaching train in his ears, a Transit Authority policeman jumped to the tracks early yesterday morning, hopped over the third rail and scooped up a 14-year-old boy who had tumbled there when pursued by a mugger in a Brooklyn subway station.

title: Koch Asks More State Welfare Aid In First Such Request Since 1974
description: The administration of Mayor Koch wants the State Legislature to increase New York City's welfare grants for the first time since 1974 and to assume the full extra cost.

title: Newark Protest Fails To Get Trenton Pledge To Halt School Layoff
description: TRENTON, Jan. 10  Responding to the emotional pleas of 300 Newark teachers, parents and students who came here seeking to avert 1,100 scheduled layoffs in the city's deficitridden school system, the State Commissioner of Education today promised to assume increased control of the district's financial affairs, but said he had no power to rescind the layoffs set for Friday.

title: Earnings Listed for the Quarter
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock E xchange, (A 1 the American Stock Exchange and (0) over-thecounter.

title: Disks: Two Approaches to Debussy
description: ARTURO Benedetti Michelarigeli may never be heard again in person by the American public for various reasons concerned with the Italian pianist's eccentricities. It makes interest in him all that much greater and the release of any new recordings by him that much more welcome.

title: Rumania, in New Rift With Soviet, Attacks Hanoi's Role in Cambodia
description: VIENNA, Jan. 10 Rumania split with its Sovietbloc allies uxlay to assail the Sovietsupported Vietnamese intervention in Camtxxlia as a menace to peace.

title: Screen: Solzhenitsyn's Children
description: DO you think that maybe our opinions are so weak that we're convinced by everybody? asks the documentary film maker Mike Rubbo, having conducted his umpteenth interview with a Parisian Communist at odds with all his confreres. Jesus, it's con' fusing, admits LouisBernard Robitaille, a FrenchCanadian journalist who is both knowledgeable and wry. Mr. Robitaille is helping Mr. Rubbo investigate the complexities of the new French Left.

title: Hudson Pulp Deal
description: The Hudson Pulp and Paper Corporation announced that the closing of the merger of Hudson with a subsidiary of the GeorgiaPacific Corporation had been postponed, pending the clarification of certain tax matters relating to the merger. The closing had been scheduled for yesterday. Hudson added that the closing of the merger was expected to take place shortly.

title: Deaths
description: AUSTERRose. Yeshiva University Women's Organization and its Brooklyn Division express heartfelt sympathy to Frieda Katz, Helen Kwestel, & Nathan Hausman on the Passing of their beloved sister. May the bereaved be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem.

title: CAMBODIAN FORCES REPORTED IN FLIGHT FROM ANGKOR AREA; U.N. TO MEET TODAY ON CRISIS Battles Said to Be Going On Near  Famed Temple and in Regions Taken in Vietnam's Drive
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 10  Vietnamese troops driving westward in Cambodia were fighting in the town of Siem Reap, near the temple complex at Angkor. Western analysts reported today.

title: U.S. Decides Chinese Leader's Trip Must Not Eclipse Visit by Brezhnev
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10  The visit to the United States by China's senior Deputy Prime Minister, Teng Hsiaoping, may become a test of the Carter Administration's declared policy of evenhandedness toward the Soviet ilnion and China.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: Toyota Plans China Entry
description: TOKYO, Jan. 10  The Toyota organization expects to sign a contract to assemble twoton trucks in Peking and thus become the first foreign automobile manufacturer to enter the new China market, Seishi Kato, president of Toyota Motor Sales, said today.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: YOU have your fantasy of Lauren Baca11 and I have mine, and heaven forbid that they be tampered with; it's so rare that interesting people come to call at the sound of a whistle. But let us agree that our Lauren Bacalls share a certain tough sexiness. This brings us at once to the biggest surprise of her autobiography, By Herself  unless you happen to count that she wrote the book by herself or that she writes with energy and intelligence. (I don't: My Lauren Bacall always had that in her.) No, the big surprise of By Myself is that when the author first went to Hollywood and made To Have and Have Not, at the age of 19, she was a dreamy stagestruck innocent, a nice Jewish girl, as she keeps calling herself, with about as much sexual experience - outside of her imagination, at leastas fluff of thistledown.

title: Big Board Issues Insider Reports
description: The New York Stock Exchange issued yesterday its latest report of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchange.

title: Prudence Reigns At China and Glass Show
description: ATLANTIC CITY

title: Billy Carter Attributes Libyans Snub to Jews
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 10 (UPI)  Billy Carter, touring Georgia with a group of visiting Libyan diplomats, accused Atlanta's Jewish community today of putting pressure on Mayor Maynard Jackson after the Mayor canceled a meeting with the Libyan dignitaries.

title: Kodak Stops Making Sound Films Camera
description: ROCHESTER, Jan. 10 (AP) - The Eastman Kodak Company has halted the production and marketing of sound movie cameras.

title: Morgan Operating. Earnings Up
description: J.P. Morgan & Company, parent of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, yesterday announced a 21.9 percent jump in fourthquarter operating earnings and a 22.2 percent gain for 1978.

title: Challenged Appointees Resubmitted by Carey
description: ALBANY, Jan. 10 Governor Carey officially resubmitted his 68 challenged appointees to the State Senate today, and a spokesman for the majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, Republican of Binghamton, said the first might reach the Senate floor for confirmation early next week.

title: EARNINGS
description: Colt Industries earnings increased 20.6 percent in the fourth quarter and 25 percent for all 1978, mostly as a result of strong performances by fluid control systems, industrial seals and components.

title: 2 Analyses Find Jews Concerned Over Threat by U.S. Nazi Groups
description: Two analyses of Individual Freedom and Jewish Security in the United States have found that Jews in the United States are more concerned about the threat of American Nazis than with any other issue, even though open antiJewish hostility in the nation is at a relatively low ebb.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 354.3900 UNTIL 5:30 PM IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9.00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (2011 MARKET 33900, WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAUCO (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516)6691000, CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767

title: Rules on Chemical Risks
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10  The Environmental Protection Agency proposed new rules today to require chemical manufacturers to notify the agency 90 days before putting any new substance on the market.

title: Deaths
description: CRESCENZI  Katharine L.. M.D. (nee Friedmann.) The Westchester Heart Assoc. was deeply saddened by the loss of Dr. Katharine L. Friedmann. She was a dearly loved and respected member of the medical community who served on the Heart Association's Board of Directors and Research Committee. She will be long remembered and deeply missed. The Westchester Heart Assoc wishes to express its sympathy to her family, patients and friends.

title: Bargain Hunting At Rockefeller's New Store
description: IT'S always been my perverse pleasure, before throwing out gift catalogues at the holidays end, to thumb through them for a last time, rejoicing at the gifts I didn't get the ones that, thank God, nobody had the will or the money to bestow upon me.

title: Notes on People
description: Vladimir Horowitz, the pianist, has canceled or postponed all his concerts through February to have time to insure his absolutely complete recovery, his physician said, from what was disclosed yesterday to be a routine surgical procedure for removal of the prostate gland. The 74-year-old concert artist plans to return to performing in Sarasota, Fla., on March 11 and keep dates in Atlanta on March 18 and Miami Beach on March 25. The performances he will miss because of his recovery were scheduled for the West Coast in February.

title: Home Improvement
description: URETHANE foams are by now quite familiar to most energyconscious homeowners because the insulating properties of urethane foam have been widely advertised in the last few years. Pumped into the walls of an uninsulated home, this material can reduce heat loss and lower fuel bills.

title: Suspect Pleads Not Guilty to 7 Murder Counts at Hearing on Sex Attacks
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 10John Wayne Gacy stood quietly in a heavily guarded Cook County courtroom here today as his lawyer entered a not guilty plea for him in seven murder indictments.

title: Talking Business with Sawhill on energy policies
description: Fuel Prices And Allocation

description: PARIS

title: White House Declines To Say Whether U.S. Shifts Policy on Shah
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10  Jody Powell, the White House spokesman, declined under persistent questioning today to discuss whether the United States had changed its policy toward the Shah of Iran, saying the matter is not appropriate for public comment and discussion.

title: S.E.C. Investigating Firestone Disclosure
description: AKRON, Ohio, Jan. 10  The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating whether the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company adequately informed stockholders of product liability problems with its steelbelted radial tires in 1976 and 1977.

title: New Washington Post Publisher
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10  From patrolman in a crimeridden precinct in the capital to publisher of The Washington Post seemed a natural progression for Donald Edward Graham. From his youth, he was destined one

title: U.S. REBUFF STALLS OIL CONTRACT TALKS
description: DENVER, Jan. 10 Government rejection of a proposed settlement as an industry pattern stalled contract talks today between the oil companies and the Oil, Chemical and Atomic Workers Union.

title: ABROAD AT HOME The Cambodian Symbol
description: The instant transformation of Prince Norodom Sihanouk from prisoner to international spokesman is one of the most amazing events on the world scene in a long time. There he suddenly was, in Peking, as voluble and candid as ever, speaking for the collapsed Pol Pot regime at a fivehour press conference but condemning the cruelties it had visited on his people.

title: Jersey Abortion Rule Is Overturned
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Jan. 10 (AP)  The State of New Jersey was ordered yesterday to pay for medically necessary abortions for boor women.

title: Article 4 -- No Title
description: Jack Nicklaus watching his try for a birdie putt on the 11th green go astray during play in Desert Classic yesterday.

title: Rgine Brings Glitter Back to London
description: LONDON, Jan. 10  The city swung last night at a nonstop party that raised a few pence for UNICEF, marked the opening of Rgine's spectacular rooftop club in the West End and, for a few hours, recaptured some of the mad extravagance reminiscent of the swinging 1960's. The town hadn't seen anything quite like it for a long time.

title: Hers
description: LATE 1978: Magazine assignment  positive approach to love in 1979. How foolishly perfect that 1 will miss the deadline because of him. But then what drives writing .forward if not obsession, and what better obsession than love? Except the obsession of this love is fighting, although when even tension becomes a ritual the glamour pales.

title: Deaths
description: GREENBAUMBertha. The Officers, Directors and members of the Pride of Judea mourn the sudden passing of Bertha Greenbaum, one of our esteemed Board members. She was generous, gentle and kind, loved and respected by all who knew tier. Our deepest sympathy is extended to her family.

title: Oppenheimer Censured
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 (AP)  An administrative law judge censured the Wall Street securities firm of Oppenheimer'& Company today, saying that it had failed to disclose its acquisition of more than 5 percent of the stock of Medcom Inc. in 1974.

title: Murdoch Returns In 53 Victory
description: DENVER, Colo., Jan. 10  The New York Rangers got highscoring Don Murdoch back in uniform for the first time this season tonight, then went out and proved they didn't need him  at least for one game.

title: Albany Fearful Of Census Error In a Mail Count
description: Legislators Studying Plan for Separate State Tally

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: Special to The New York Times SPRINGFIELD, III., Jan. 10  Plans to build a coal gasification demonstration plant, costing about $100 million, at Wood River, Ill., a St. Louis suburb, are to be announced tomorrow by Gov. James R. Thompson and the AllisChalmers Corporation of Milwaukee, state and corporate officials disclosed.

title: Advertising
description: Why Ayer Chose Mrs. Rosen

title: Deaths
description: MERRITTH. Houston, M.D. Montefiore Hospital & Medical Center notes with great sorrow the passing of H. Houston Merritt, M. D., distinguished consultant and former Chief of Neurology at our hospital. We extend our deepest sympathy to his wife, Mabel C. Merritt

title: China and Canada Set Grain Talk
description: PEKING, Jan. 10 (Reuters)  China has agreed to negotiate a longterm wheat purchase agreement with Canada that should be worth at least $1 billion (Canadian) over a threeyear period, Canada's Minister of Industry, Trade and Commerce, John M. Horner, said today.

title: GARDENING Books Subject Is Roses
description: TWO of the best books on growing roses, Robert Buist's The Rose Manual, written 135 years ago, and Roy E. Shepherd's The History of the Rose, written in 1954, have long been out of print, but now they and four other classic volumes on roses are available again, thanks to a New York couple and their fortunate trip to a county fair.

title: China Plant Contract To German Concern
description: BONN, Jan. 10  Lurgi Gesellschaften, a West German company that specializes in plant construction, said today that it had signed a contract worth about a billion marks, or the equivalent of $500 million, to build three chemical plants in China.

title: Brown's Political Strength
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 10 - If Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. decides to make run for the Democratic Presidential nomination next year, it appears that he can do it from a reasonably secure power base in California.

title: Debuts at the City Ballet
description: BLESSED are those who have seen Concerto Barocco and Raymonda Variations on the same program at the New York City Ballet. This was the case Tuesday night at the State Theater, where these two finest of Balanchine ballets offered the extra attraction of debuts in major roles.

title: India Accused Over Detainees
description: LONDON, Jan. 10 (UPI)  Amnesty International charged today that up to 100,000 political prisoners were held without trial in India during the emergency proclaimed by the Government of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and that as many as 1,000 may still have been imprisoned when the human rights organization undertook a mission to India last year. The Indian Government says 373 leftwing terrorists are still being held.

title: McGrawHill Up as Dow Drops
description: McGrawHill's common stock jumped 4 points to 30 yesterday in its initial response to the surprise takeover bid of $34 a share made two days ago by the American Express Company. McGrawHill led the volume list on the New York Stock Exchange with a turnover exceeding 750,000 shares.

title: Town Hall Plan Dropped
description: Contending that they were stymied by the nature and policies of the Landmarks Preservation Commission, officials of the Town Hall Theater Foundation said yesterday that they had abandoned plans to operate the historic hall as a facility for dance, drama and concerts.

title: Gulf Abandons Well Off Jersey
description: The Gulf Oil Corporation said yesterday that it was abandoning its first well off New Jersey after encountering no significant shows of oil or gas. The rig used to drill the hole will move to another location in the Baltimore Canyon area, the company said.

title: Dr. Clifford Barbour, At 82
description: Dr. Clifford Barbour, a former Moderator of the General Assembly of the Presbyterian Church in the United States, died yesterday at the University of Tennesee Hospital in Knoxville. He was 83 years old and had lived in Maryville, Tenn.

title: East German Tale of Tyranny
description: ROSENHEIM, West Germany  For the last few weeks, Renate Neufeld Spassov has been shaking the international sports establishment by telling about her life as a sprinter with Olympic hopes in East Germany, revealing a dark side of her former country's remarkable sports success.

title: NEW &
description: Have It Your Way

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: American Motors and Renault announced an agreement calling for Renault to sell A.M.C. Jeeps in Europe and South America and for American Motors to sell Renault cars in the United States. The immediate effect of the arrangement will be increased imports of the Renault R5, sold in the United States as Le Car. [Page D1.]

title: Alcoa Unit to Halt Certain Ad Claims
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 (AP) subsidiary of the Aluminum Company of America agreed today to stop making certain fuelsaving claims for its aluminum siding that the Federal Trade Commission said were deceptive.

title: Zale Turns Tables On I.R.S. Inauiry
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10  The Zale Corporation, the country's largest retail jeweler, is the subject of a widespread criminal tax investigation by the Internal Revenue Service, which says that the company and its subsidiaries may owe more than $100 million in back taxes. Recommendations

title: Orbiting Observatory Likely to Fall in March
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 10 (UPI)  The National Aeronautics and Space Administration's High Energy Astronomical Observatory has run out of control gas as expected and will fall back into the earth's atmosphere in late March, the space agency reported today.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Yesterday's Weather at 1 P.M.: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration/UPI A cloud system continues to spread eastward across Texas and into the western Gulf Mexico. Cirroforrn clouds are streaking across the eastern Gulf States and Florida on stream winds. A larger cloud system is heading across the PAcific Northwest and Rockies. Broken altostratus clouds are spreading across the Middle West.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Our house has hotwater heat with baseboard radiators in all rooms. The bottom of the covers on these baseboard radiators is only about an inch from the floor. When we had carpeting installed recently, it was run under these radiator covers, blocking the opening that had been under them. Will this reduce the efficiency of the radiators, and if so, what can be done to correct this? - F.D., Swarthmore, Pa.

description: Stocks, Bonds: Rating Yields
