title: Around the Nation
description: NASHVILLE, Jan. 22 (UPI) - Two days after he was replaced, former Gov. Ray Blanton called the State Corrections Commissioner from his home and, insisting that he was still Governor, sought the release of the prisoners whose sentences he had commuted, it was disclosed today.

title: Reagan Backers Decide to Meet Issue of Age Early and Head On
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Ronald Reagan, who will be 69 years old just before next year's New Hampshire Presidential primary, and his backers have decided to meet the age issue head on by bringing the subject up early and hoping the public will tire of it.

title: COMMODITIES Profit Taking Erases Most Gains in Futures
description: Commodity futures prices moved higher through the better part of yesterday's trading session until late profit taking erased most of the gains.

title: Research: A 12% Funds Increase To Invest in the Nation's Future
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - Citing the need to invest in the nation's future, President Carter today stressed his interest in basic research by increasing Federal funds for that purpose by 12 percent, to $4.3 billion, in the coming fiscal year.

title: Many Find Coercion in Cults Holds on Members
description: The following article is based on reporting by Nathaniel Sheppard Jr. and To Thomas. It was written by Mr. Sheppard.

title: EDUCATION State Test Uses A New Concept
description: ANEW type of reading test designed to provide a more accurate measure of how people actually read has been developed for the New York State Board of Regents as part its controversial competencytesting program.

title: George A. Witch Dies; Worked for Y.M.CA. In China for Decades
description: George Ashmore Fitch, secretary to the International Committee of the Young Men's Christian Association for 40 years and a resident of China from 1909 to 1946, died Sunday in a nursing home in Pomona, Calif. He was 95 years old and had been a resident of Pomona for the last 15 years.

title: Bookies, Bettors in A Mixup
description: A rare communications mixup at the Meadowlands has touched off a dispute between bookmakers and bettors over which horse won the 10th race at the track in East Rutherford, N.J., last Wednesday night.

title: New York Clergymen Protest Catholic Stand
description: Walking two by two down Park Avenue and then over to Fifth, their black and white and red vestments billowing in the cold wind, about three dozen Jewish and Protestant clergy led 300 men and women in a march on St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday to protest the antiabortion statements and actions of Roman Catholic church leaders.

title: 8% Return Equals 12 For Some Note Buyers
description: The scheduled 8 percent return on the city's new note issue is the equivalent of about 12 percent to investors in the 50 percent tax bracket and carries higher yield than anything of compitrabie maturity in the taxexempt matket.

title: Carnegie Unit Urges a Billion a Year for Public TV
description: A report by Carnegie Commission on the Future of Public Broadcasting, stressing the need for improved programming. will recommend that 11 billion a year be made available for noncommercial television and radio after 1981, according to sources close to the commission.

title: A PLEA FOR SACRIFICE
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - With a warning that real sacrifices must be made if we are to overcome inflation, President Carter today submitted to Congress a tight budget for the fiscal year 1980, a budget intended to slow the economic growth of the United States without precipitating a recession.

title: Chinese Shortage Of Capital Predicted
description: TOKYO, Jan. 22  China is about $200 billion short of the capital needed to fulfill an ambitious program to moderniie its economy by 1985, according to a report to be published here shortly.

title: GAG ORDER IS UPSET ON C.I.A. DOCUMENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 72  The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia has overturned a yearold gag order that prevented a group of antiwar activists from making public certain information about spying activities by the Central Intelligence Agency. The information was obtained as part of a $1 million lawsuit against the Government and a number of present and former officials.

title: Senate Will Vote On Carey Choice For Upstate Job
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22  The Republicanccatrolled Senate was scheduled to take up tomorrow the nomination of Allen E. Dekdebrun as chairman of the Niagara Frontier Transportation Authority, and there were clear signs he would be formally rejected.

title: Steel Output In 2.9% Drop
description: Steel production fell 2.9 percent in the week ended last Saturday to 2.418 million tons, from 2.491 million tons in the previous week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: SecurityCase Review Denied
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (AP)  The Supreme Court refused today to extend Federal securities laws to protect persons who unknowingly invest in highrisk investments.

title: About Education
description: WHEN the Mayor's Office of Management and Budget recently announced the need to cut New York's school budget, its proposals  even though they are not binding on the Board Education  placed into sharp focus the effect of fiscal austerity on children and on the public schools themselves. brief, the agency suggested the elimination of allday kinder- gartens as well as the newly Created transitional classes the special catchup programs for pupils who had not been promoted to the next grade. The suggested cuts would also wipe out plans to reduce class size in the early grades, a step educators consider crucial to bolstering achievement.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS Dollar Mixed Abroad; Gold Climbs Sharply
description: By The Associated Press

title: Harnischfeger Expects Net Loss
description: The Harnischfeger Corporation, maker of materialshandling equipment, said it expected to report a $2 million loss for its first fiscal quarter ending Jan. 31. In the yearbefore period, the company earned $4.8 million, or 55 cents a share.

title: First Women to Join New York City's Dockworkers.
description: As it must to all men, the imminent prospect of female fellowworkers came yesterday to the traditionally tough longshoremen of New York Harbor. The first women ever allowed to work on the piers here began registering with the Waterfront Commission. More than 100 are expected to be among 750 recipients of sixmonth permits to be issued this month, going into effect Feb. 5.

title: The Real Federal Budget Won't Emerge Till Later
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - President Carter's Federal budget, presented today in four pale green volumes, will bear no resemblance in form and only some similarity in substance to the real Federal budget for the year that begins Oct. 1.

title: Michelle Auriol, at Paris Home; Widow of French Leader Was 82
description: PARIS, Jan. 22 (Reuters)  Michelle Auriol, widow of the first President of the Fourth Republic, died in her Paris home today, her family reported.

title: Ramsey Clark Meets Khomeini and Relays A Plea to Washington
description: Ramsey Clark, the former United States Attorney General, just back from a meeting with Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini in France, said yesterday that the Iranian Moslem leader had told him that he hoped the United States would not intervene in Iran, but choose instead to let the nation determine its own fate.

title: The White Hyphen in Rhodesia
description: The small band of whites that still monopolizes power in Rhodesia naturally prefers a gradualist, moderate solution to the country's racial and political problems, which are more or less synonymous. tends, however, to confuse moderation with resistance to the changes that are vital to a workable multiracial state. The whites of Rhodesia more resemble men walking the last mile than gradualists moving slowly but voluntarily on a new path.

title: American Testifies He Has No Regrets About Assassiriating Letelier
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: From the frozen wastes of Chicago, Ralph N. Peters is holding out an olive branch to New York. That may seem like a badly mixed metaphor, but it is true nonetheless. Mr. Peters has just been elected chairman of the board of the Chicago Board of Trade, the nation's biggest commodity exchange. His first order of business: I want our fee structure changed, he said, so that the major wire houses will really want to do business with us.

title: Intention to Buy McGraw Affirmed
description: Directors of the American Express Company, following a regular monthly meeting yesterday, released a statement affirming their unanimous intention to proceed with their merger offer for McGrawHill Inc. andbacking the actions taken by their company's management in making the offer.

title: Events
description: STREETSONGS, onewoman revue with Geraldine Fitzgerald. Directed by Richard Maltby Jr. Presented by the Roundabout Theater, at Stage One, 333 West 23d Street, at 7:30.

title: Obituary 5 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: CocaCola Plans Shipment to China
description: ATLANTA, Jan. 22 (AP)  The first shipment of CocaCola to China will leave from Hong Kong on Wednesday, the CocaCola Company announced today.

title: Casinos Backed For Rockaway In New Report
description: Queens political and civic leaders said yesterday a new study established that the Rockaway Peninsula can sustain viable casino gambling and recreationresort development. They said such development would bring jobs and income to the declining oceanfront area and tax revenues to the city.

title: About New York
description: Prancing past the security guards, Mira H. is 16 years old and suddenly back at George Washington High School after 50 days of truancy. With her frosted hairdo, snug blouse and sloeeyed look of boredom, she doesn't seem a day over 21 and counting.

title: A Nixon Treasury Secretary Queried on $200,000 He Got From Sindona
description: David M. Kennedy, Secretary of the Treasury in the Administration of Richard M. Nixon, is under investigation by grand jury that has questioned him about ,000 he received from Michele Sindona, an Italian financier who gained control of the Franklin National Bank.

title: Probinsky Is Set To Tell Hearing About Resorts
description: WILDWOOD, N.J., Jan. 22 - David Probinsky, the publicrelations man whc stands to make $3 million from. Resorts. International if the company wins a per. manent casino license in Atlantic City under a contract that originally barred him from making adverse utterances about Resorts, said today that he knew nothing derogatory about the company's activities since he became a Resorts consultant in 1968. He also said he knew nothing about the company's earlier activities as the Mary Carter Paint Company.

title: Stein Assails Food in Schools
description: Borough President Andrew 3. Stein of Manhattan charged ytesterday that New York City schoolchildren were being served rotten, infested and chemically suspicious food, because, he said, only three of the Board of Education's food inspectors have adequate training. Elizabeth Cagan, administrator of the board's office of school food services, called the charges irresponsible and ridiculous. She defended the training of the food staff and added, We have never ever had a case a child getting ill from school lunch served.

title: Savings and Loans See Mortgage Rate Decline
description: Savings and loan associations expect mortgage rates to decline, a Federal housing economist reported yesterday after the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation bought only $32.9 million of home loans in its weekly purchase of residential mortgages.

title: Martina Navratilova Routs Miss Wade in Final
description: HOUSTON,Jan. 22 (AP) - Topseeded Martina Navratilova won 30 of 35 points on her serve to rout secondseeded Virgina Wade, 63, 62, tonight and win the $125,000 women's pro tennis tournament at Houston for the fourth straight year.

title: Iran's Tidal Wave
description: The Iranian revolution has not yet ended. No matter which way it goes and how it will ultimately affect the people of Iran, it is already shaping up as a sure plus for the Russians, big minus for the United States, major threat to the Saudis, a near-disaster to Israel - and a new imperative for EgyptianIsraeli peace.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: BOULDER, Colo., Jan. 22(AP) Boulder District Court judge today granted a motion by lawyers for the New England Patriots to submit to arbitration a contract dispute between the National Football League team and its head coach, Chuck Fairbanks.

title: Church Leaders to Quit California for a Haven
description: PASADENA, Calif., Jan. 21 (AP) Leadeis of the Worldwide Church of God, which is under investigation by the state, will leave California to seek a safe haven, a top aide said Sunday.

title: Obituary 3 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: VolkswagenEgypt Talks
description: WOLFSBURG, West Germany, Jan. 22 (UPI)  Volkswagenwerk A.G. is negotiating with Egypt on establishing an assembly plant to produce 10,000 automobiles annually, a company spokesman said today. He said that the negotiations were in the final stage.

title: China Vs. Vietnam
description: PARISAt the Langson Pass area, the practical Chinese invasian route into Vietnam, there is ample evidence of an internationalflashpoint situation.

title: IRAN ISLAMIC LEADER WARNS OF HOLY WAR IF ARMY TRIES COUP
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 22 - The Islamic leader in Teheran said today that the religious opposition was determined to supplant the Cabinet of Prime Minister Shahpur Bakhtiar and warned that the Iranian people might undertake a holy war against the army if it attempted a coup.

title: Few Bold New Programs Found in Spending Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - Change in the new Federal budget is principally incremental. There are few bold new initiatives; neither are there many major cutbacks, although some jobs and public works programs, enacted at a time of especially high unemployment and substantially bolstered only last year, have been trimmed or eliminated.

title: Texas Surpuls Gas Begins to Folw
description: HOUSTON, Jan. 22  The first effects of the nation's new naturalgas law, which went into effect Dec. 1, are now being felt: Surplus gas bottled up for months in Texas, Oklahoma and Louisiana is starting slowly to floW to the North, East, Middle West and Pacific Coast, regions that have been experiencing a chronic gas shortage.

title: Boat People Reach Los Angeles After 3 Months
description: Special toile New York Times

title: Report Says Economy of Canada Worries Public More Than Unity
description: Special tone New York Times

title: The Reilly Murder Case: 5 Years Old and Still a Mystery
description: CANAAN, Conn., Jan. 20 - Who killed Barbara Gibbons? For more than five years now that dark question has hung over this small community in rural northwestern Connecticut, the way the weekend's gray storm clouds clung close to the ridges the surrounding Berkshire hills.

title: Storms at Atlantic Resort Island, Madeira, Blamed for Deaths of
description: FUNCHAL, Madeira, Jan. 22 (Reuters) - Six persons have been killed by storms that battered the Atlantic resort island of Madeira during the last four days, the police said today.

title: AcademyInstitute to Elect Head
description: Barbara W. Tuchman, the historian, is expected to be elected president of the American Academy and Institute of Arts and Letters tomorrow at the organizations annual election at its headquarters on Audubon Terrace, a newly designated landmark on Washington Heights.

title: Officials Hail City Sale of Notes, But Warn Fiscal Crisis Isn't Over
description: New York City's. sale of $125 million of shortterm notes to the public is an important first step in the city's financial recovery, city officials said yesterday, but they pointed out that it did not mean the fiscal crisis was over.

title: Program on Student Aid: How One Item Survived
description: WASHJNGTON, Jan. 22 - The rumors started spreading in midNovember: President Carter's budget for 1980 would cut deeply into spending for higher education. By early December a copy of the budget had leaked out and the rumors were confirmed. One program, National Direct Student Loans, would be zeroed out, dropped I entirely.

title: OBSERVER
description: The country is awash in statistical studies that tell us what we already know.

title: Gardner To Merge Into Cooper
description: Cooper Industries and the GardnerDenver Company announced yesterday that they had entered into, and that the boards of both companies had- approved, a definitive agreement to merge GardnerDenver into Cooper.

title: Warns AROUND US What Optical Illusions Do to the Brain
description: BY looking at the illustrations accompanying this article, you can experience something that many brain researcherswould love to be able to understand fully.

title: After the Rain, the Cleanup
description: Flood waters spawned by a weekend of torrential rains receded from highways and lowlying homes across the New York metropolitan area yesterday as rail, air and other transportation systems returned to nearnormal schedules and hundreds of weary residents returned to evacuated homes to clean up damage.

title: California Chills Newcomers Expectation
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 22 - Laurie Banks, who moved here from Boston two years ago, went shopping for sweater this week.

title: Pistons, Led by Lanier, Defeat Nuggets, 121117
description: DENVER,Jan. 22 (AP) - Bob Lanier scored 30 points and teamed with Terry Tyler. a rookie, to lead Detroit to a 121117 victory over Denver tonight. It was only the Pistons fifth National Basketball Association road victory in 25 games this season.

title: GUERRILLA ACTIVITY SLOWED IN THAILAND
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Paper in Guyana Asks An Inquiry Into Cults
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Jan. 22 (UPI) - An opposition newspaper has called for Government investigation of cults in Guyana, particularly the House of Israel, which is led by a black American. David Hill.

title: Talks Resume On Wheat
description: GENEVA. Jan. 22  An accord reached last month by the United States and the European Economic Community paved the way for the resumption here today of an attempt by 70nation conference to conclude an international pact to stabilize the price of wheat.

title: Taxes &
description: THE Internal Revenue Service has been refining its tax forms over the years in an effort to reduce filing errors, but the forms are still far too complicated for some people. Year after year, addled taxpayers slow down the auditing process, often delaying refunds they have coming, by such lapses as failing to attach W2 wage forms to the return or inscribing a wrong Social Security number from memory. Both of these errors are among the most common the I.R.S. has to deal with.

title: Woes Seen For Arab Oil States
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Jan. 22 (Reuters)  Saudi Arabia and other wealthy oilproducing Arab countries could be spending themselves into trouble because their future oil income may not be large enough to cover

title: Carter's Budget in Brief
description: OVERALL: Spending for the year, which begins Oct. 1, would be $531.6 billion, an increase only slightly above the inflation rate, and revenues would total $502.6 billion. The deficit would be $29.0 billion, as against $37.4 billion for the current fiscal year.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, JANUARY 23, 1979

title: Spacecraft Provide First Comprehensive View of Mars
description: PASADENA. Calif.

title: West Germans Watch For Holocaust Boinbs
description: BONN, Jan. 22 (Reuters) - West German television stations and buildings used by Jewish groups were under guard today to prevent bomb attacks during the telecast of HoloCaust.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 72 - The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether the Federal Government has the authority to ban the use of laetrile, the controversial substance said by its proponAnts to be a cure for cancer.

title: Music: Two Voices in One
description: THE two most expensive singing properties of the day (as they say in the business) joined forces last night in Avery Fisher Hall before a soldout, rapturous audience. Joan Sutherland and Luciano Pavarotti have appeared together on the operatic stage, but joint recitals from artists of this calibre can- not be bought in every five-and-dime. They had an orchestra, expertly conducted by Richard Bonynge, to support them, and they went through a standard segment of the Italian and French literature, singing solos and duets.

title: Super Bet: Last Point Cost Many
description: MIAMI, Jan. 22 - When Roger Staubach completed a 4yard touchdown pass to Butch Johnson in the last minute of yesterday's Super Bowl, a lot of people became upset or disappointed.

title: 205 Pounds Later, the New Elaine Emerges
description: In a few hours the restaurant will be crowded with people, most of them talking loudly; but late afternoon it is quiet and empty, and the owner relaxes at a table. She sits, her legs crossed, and puffs meditatively on a cigarette. In the kitchen her minions labor over homemade pasta, and soon fettuccine Alfredo and linguine with clam sauce and a constant array of other excruciatingly caloric offerings will begin to issue forth. The restaurateur, however, is drinking black coffee, and looking rather pleased with herself.

title: Strike by City Employees Adds to British Labor Chaos
description: LONDON, Jan. 22 - Several hundred thousand municipal workers all over Britain stayed away from their jobs today in a 24hour strike that added greatly to the widespread disruption of the past two weeks.

title: Arts and Humanities Total Up, But Expected Inflation Is Higher
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - The proposed budget submitted to Congress today calls for slight increases in Federal spending for the arts and humanities, but the increases are less than the 6.3 percent rate of inflation anticipated for the next fiscal year.

title: Fire Reduces Radiation Aimed at U.S. Embassy
description: MOSCOW, Jan. 22 (Reuters) The microwave radiation monitored at the front of the United States Embassy here disappeared, American sources said today, after a weekend fire damaged the building across the street.

title: 6 Scientists Quit Panel in Dispute Over Livestock Drugs
description: SIX scientists, recruited by the Council for Agricultural Science and Technology to help produce a report on the use of antibiotics in animal feed, have resigned, charging that their findings were not presented accurately by the council. The council acts as an advisory group that prepares reports on various aspects of agriculture and distributes them to the media, government agencies and concerned Congressional committees.

title: The City
description: Ten communities were designated yesterday by the City Planning Commission as Neighborhood Strategy Areas eligible to receive extra Federal money for physical improvements later this year.

title: Chairman of Iran Regency Council Resigns in a Visit With Khomeini
description: NEAUPHLE-LE-CHATEAU, France, Jan. 22  The head of Iran's Regency Council, the highest authority in the country since the departure of the Shah six days ago, resigned today and, in a gesture of shifting allegiances, turned in his resignation to the Shah's most determined foe, Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.

title: Some Spending by U.S. Listed as Offbudget
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 22 Not every thing the Government spends is included in the Federal spending figures. Certain agencies, mainly lending agencies, are excluded by statute from the main budget and are counted in what is called the of (budget.

title: 2d Suspicious Fire Kills 7 In a Jersey City Tenement
description: JERSEY CITY, Jan. 22 - An earlymorning tenement fire, apparently deliberately set, took the lives of seven persons here today, including those of mother and her five children.

title: Cities Face Cutbacks In Jobs, Lunch Plans And Housing Grants
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - President Carter's proposed cuts in public service jobs could eliminate up to 7,000 workers from the New York City payroll and thousands more in cities around the country by Sept. 30, 1980, according to preliminary analyses by urban specialists.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: BEN STEIN's The View From Sunset Boulevard is a casual, unpretentious little study of where television is coming from, by a writer who, after practicing a bit of law, a bit of journalism, and a bit of Government service (in the Nixon Administration), has himself

title: Comments of Special Interest Groups
description: Following is the reaction to the Budget Message from spokesmen for special interest groups.

title: Economic Platform for 1980
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  President Carter stands a strong chance of protecting the ideas behind what Administration officials call his lean but merciful 1980 budget because it generally suits the Frugal mood of the new Congress. But even Congressional supporters of Mr. Carter's fiscal conservativism warned today that the Main challenge to his budget strategy might come late in the year from the American economy.

title: Net Loss For T.W.A. In Quarter
description: The Trans World Corporation, the holding company that owns Trans World Airlines, Hilton International and the Canteen Corporation, yesterday reported a surprising loss of $12.1 million on revenues of $869.7 million for the fourth quarter of last year.

title: BUSINESS_ Digest
description: Takeover bids for National Airlines by Pan Am and Texas International were challenged by the Justice Department, which advised the Civil Aeronautics Board to disapprove them. But the Transportation Department advised the board to approve both applications and let the applicants bid against each other. [Page D1.]

title: Report Criticizes Unit's Dealings With Coop City
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22  In a scorching rebuke to the State Division of Housing and Community Renewal for its handling of the contracting at Coop City in the Bronx, State Comptroller Edward V. Regan today charged the division with deficient supervision, inadequate auditing of contracts and failure to exercise even miniital control over construction costs.

title: Fords Lead at Monte Carlo
description: MONTE CARLO, Monaco, Jan. 22 (AP) - Ford Escorts driven by Hamm Mikkola of Finland and Bjorn Waldegaard of Sweden led the Monte Carlo Rally today as fewer than 200 of the 233 starters ended the first stage of the

title: Kennedy Offers Bill on Trucking Rates
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Senator Edward M. Kennedy stepped ahead of the Administration today when he introduced a bill to eliminate price-fixing, now legal in the trucking industry.

title: 2 Koch Officials Deny A Bellamy Contention On Lease Overpaying
description: In memos to Mayor Koch yesterday, the city's Acting General Services Commissioner, Jeremiah Walsh, and the city's Personnel Director, Thomas Roche, denied that they were paying exorbitant amounts to lease office space, as City Council President Carol Bellamy had suggested earlier that the city was doing.

title: CITY NOTES SELL OUT WITH INTEREST CUT TO 8% FROM 8.25%
description: Purchases of $125 Million Offering Viewed as Sign of Confidence in New York's Credibility

title: U.S. Says Envoy Makes Progress in Middle East
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (Reuters) The State Department said today that its special envoy for the Middle East, Alfred L. Atherton Jr., has made progress in negotiating a peace settlement between Israel and Egypt.

title: Banker Says He Told Rep. Flood In 1972 of Top Aide's Solicitation
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Representative Daniel J. Flood was told as early as 1972 that his top assistant was soliciting constituents for money for himself, according to a witness in the Congressman's bribery, conspiracy and perjury trial in Federal District Court today.

title: Court Delays Narco Mergers
description: A Federal district judge in Philadelphia blocked Narco Scientific Inc. yesterday from acting on either of two merger bids at least until next month.

title: Holy Cross, Iona Win Squeakers
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Jan. 22 - Iona and Holy Cross, two teams apparently headed for postseason tournaments, had more to handle than either bargained for tonight in a doubleheader at Nassau Coliseum. lona needed a shot atSYRACUSE, Jan. 22 (AP)  Marty Headd's 20 points helped rally Syracuse and Hal Cohen's clutch free throws preserved a 7165 victory over Rutgers tonight.

title: Isuzu Trucks for China
description: TOKYO, Jan. 22 (UPI)  The Isuzu Motor Company, an affiliate of the General Motors Corporation, said today that it planned to cooperate in the production of small trucks in China. Toshio Okamoto, president, said at a news conference . that his company would send a mission to China in February at the earliest to study a proposed plan. He said China planned to turn out about 10,000 1.5ton and 2.5ton trucks annually in Nanking.

description: THE convertible security has long appealed investors who want to have their cake and eat too. That is convertibles offer a degree of safety and income and also a chance to participate in stock market gains.

title: Stage: A New Beethoven
description: IN his new play, now being shown at the Manhattan Theater Club, David Rush writes about a vain and arrogant old man, physically deaf and psychologically impervious to the feelings about him, and surrounded by admirers who speak of him as the Master and are kicked for their pains.

description: The strongest and most prestigious invitational event in the world, the Sunday Times Pairs, ended in London Sunday in a triumph for South America and a relative failure for North America.

description: Special to The New York Times

title: Social Programs: Many Face Substantial Decreases
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  Administration officials tried to put the best face on it, but President Carter's 1980 budget proposals spell austerity for the broad array of social and educational programs that have become part of the fabric of American life.

title: Cabbie Is Accused of Abducting
description: As part of his new gettough campaign against lawless cab drivers, District Attorney John J. Santucci of Queens last night lodged a felony charge against driver who had originally been charged with a misdemeanor for allegedly speeding off with four visiting business executives and refusing to let them out during wild, terrorfilled ride last month.

title: Whale Is Freed From Net
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan 22 (Reuters) The crew of the United States lifeguard vessel Baywatch Cabrillo went to the aid of a giant pilot whale struggling to the surface for air in the Pacific off Los Angeles. The crew found that the whale was trapped in a fishing net. A crew member, Shelly Butler, put on his scuba gear, plunged into the ocean and cut the whale free with a diving knife. The whale was last seen heading back to its herd.

title: Changes Asked on Quarterly Tax
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 As part of an effort to manage the Government's cash more efficiently, about one million persons would be relieved of having to file quarterly estimated income tax returns starting in 1981 under a legislative proposal in the new Administration budget.

title: Reputed Planner Of Munich Raid Killed in Beirut
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 22  The Palestinian guerrilla leader who reputedly planned the attack on the Israeli Olympic team at Munich in 1972 was fatally wounded here today in the explosion of a remotecontrolled bomb.

title: Korchnoi to Play Chess for Israel After Assumption of Citizenship
description: TEL AVIV, Jan. 22 Viktor Korchnoi, threetime Soviet chess champion and runnerup in the world championship in Manila in October, announced on Israeli television tonight that he would acquire Israeli citizenship and represent Israel in international competition.

title: Agencies Differ on Air Merger
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22  The Justice Department advised the Civil Aeronautics Board today to disapprove two competing applications to acquire National Airlines. But the Transportation Department advised the C.A.B. to approve both of them and let the applicants bid against each other for National's stock.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: Some of my best friends are computers. I cite as an example Con Edison's resident computer, with whom I have been involved in a torrid affair. Her feelings for me are regularly expressed in loving footnotes to the monthly bill, like You have an excellent payment record. Thank you. Best wishes for a happy holiday season. This relationship makes me forget that she charges as much when the entire household is off on vacation as when weave cooking with gas.

description: IT was bound to happen and it has: An advertising writer has found the chutzpah to use gnu for new. And John Overaker is terribly pleased about it, probably because he has reached new heights in gnu abuse.

description: PEKING, Jan. 22 (Reuters)  Luxembourg's Prime Minister, Gaston Thorn, due to arrive in Peking tomorrow on fiveday trade visit:

title: For the Zulus, Famous Victory of 1879 Finds Echo Today
description: ISANDHLWANA, South Africa, Jan. 22 A hundred years ago today 20,000 Zulu warriors surprised a British expeditionary force on this undulating plateau and in two hours dealt it perhaps the most devastating defeat ever inflicted on modem imperial army by a primitively armed indigenous forge.

title: Carlos Jorge Videla, a Reporter On Long Island for Many Years
description: Carlos Jorge Videla, a reporter for The Southampton Press until he retired in 1970, died of cancer Sunday at St Charles Hospital, Port Jefferson, L.I. He was 75 years old and a resident of Southampton.

title: Glossary of Terms Used in the Budget Process
description: APPROPRIATIONS The authority Congress gives to a department or agency to make commitments spend money, generally the same as budget authority. Sometimes appropriations and the resulting outlays occur within a single fiscal year. Sometimes the outlays occur over a period of years, as when the Defense Department places an order for a warship.

title: CARTER BUDGET MESSAGE AND SOME PROPOSALS
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - Following is the text of President Carter's Budget Missage to ,Congress and excerpts of major budget proposals from his summary of the budget for the fiscal year 198 0:

title: World News Briefs
description: OTTAWA, Jan. 22 (Reuters) - Edward R. Schreyer took office today as the 22nd Governor General of Canada and appealed to the public to reject the separation of Quebec from the rest of the nation.

title: Judge Continues Knoetze Hearing
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Jan. 22 (AP) - United States District Judge Norman C. Roettger continued today the hearing of Caine Knoette, the South African boxer, giving attorneys four days to back up their contention that his visa was revoked because of political pressure.

title: Big Names Off N.B.A. AllStars
description: Dennis Johnson and Jack Sikma of the Seattle SuperSceics were named to the AllStar squad yesterday, but such perennial allstars as Rick Barry, Bob McAdoo; Dave Gowen and Bob Lanier were left off.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: UTICA, N.Y., Jan. 22 (AP)  The Justice Department has asked a Federal judge to order the United Technologies Corporation to hold the Carrier Corporation separate from the rest of its organization, pending the outcome of a full antitrust trial.

title: Fear of Increase In Use of Drugs By Police Cited
description: Concern over a suspected increase in the use of marijuana and cocaine by police officers during offduty hours has been voiced in a report by the New York City Police Department.

title: Carter Briefs House Democratic Chiefs
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - President Carter was host today to the House Democratic leadership at a White House briefing on his budget and legislative program and got a preview of some of the problems he may face on Capitol Hill.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Arapaho Petroleum Inc., Denver, has elected Guy W. Ewing 3d as president.

title: Carter Nominates Ambassadors For Posts in Tunisia and Bahrain
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 (Reuters) President Carter nominated two career foreign service officers today to be Ambassadors to Tunisia and Bahrain.

title: Letters
description: It is ironic that your balanced discussion of sex differences [Complex Process Delineates Sex, Dec. 19] was accompanied by a chart which, in the interest of preserving aesthetic perspective, distorted the psychological perspective rendered in the article. The larger circles and type in the foreground depicting the development of the male embryo compared to the smaller circles and type in the background showing the development of the female embryo are a perfect illustration of the preferential treatment of males which is implicitly accepted in our society.

title: HOUSTON TRIAL ENDS IN DEADLOCKED JURY
description: Special to The New York Times

title: Stores Try Theatrical Selling Techniques
description: Visual merchandising  the use of theatrical techniques to lure shoppers into impulse buying  has assumed great importance among major American retailers.

title: Con Ed Didn't Inflate Its Rate Bid, Luce Says
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 22 - Charles Luce, chairman of the Consolidated Edison Company, denied today that he had inflated a request for a 91/2 percent electricrate increase because the utility expected to get less than it asked for.

title: Crenshaw Wins by 1 In Phoenix
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan. 22 (AP) Ben Crenshaw salvaged a scrambling par  including two shots from the trees  on the final hole to preserve onestroke victory today in the weathershortened, 54hole Phoenix open golf tournament.

title: Islanders Defeat Hawks, 2 to 1, On Howatt Goal in Last Period
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 22. - The New York Islanders won another battle tonight, but the National Hockey League war is beginning to take its toll.BOSTON, Jan. 22 (AP) - Rick Middleton scored the tying goal, his 21st, and set up the goahead score in the second period tonight to send the Boston Bruins to a 31 victory over the Atlanta Flames.

title: EARNINGS Arco Quarterly Net Up 39. 1% to Peak
description: The Atlantic Richfield Compiny, a leading domestic integrated oil company, yesterday reported the highest quarterly earnings in its history for the three months ended Dec. 31. A 30.1 percent surge lifted Arco's net for the year to a new record as well, according to resalts released by the company's Los Angeles headquarters.

title: YanksRed Sox Hot Ticket
description: BOSTON, Jan. 22 (AP) The Boston Red Sax already have sold all reserved seats at Fenway Park for the first visit of the New York Yankees.

title: Defense: Up 3%, Stressing Arms in Europe
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - The proposed new Defense Department budget of $122.7 billion represents an increase of slightly more than 3 percent, adjusted for inflation, over that of the current fiscal year. it stresses combat readiness in Europe and modernizing of the nuclear forces.

title: Companies Report Earnings

title: More Worker Power
description: WASHINGTON - Unions that represent 3.8 million workers will negotiate new contracts this year and will go to the bargaining table with a precarious hold on power.

title: `The Concord Quartets
description: IN his notes on The. Concord Quartets, George Rochberg, the composer, says that he wanted to ensure maximum variety of gesture and texture and the broadest possible spectrum that he could command. He has certainly covered an extraordinarily large stylistic and emotional range, and done so with such skill that he has produced perhaps the most enjoyable chamber music to come this way in years.

title: ExWife Denied Share in Pension
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - The Supreme Court ruled today, 7 to 2, that worker's pension benefits under federally financed retirement are not a part of the worker's community property that must be shared with a divorced spouse.

title: Logan Hospital May Be Closed. By Week's End
description: State Medicaid funds that have kept the Arthur J. Logan Memorial Hospital open in West Harlem are expected to be cut so drastically today that the hospital may not survive the week.

title: Elizabeth Policeman In 2d Trial in Killing
description: TRENTON - An Elizabeth police officer who was charged with shooting and killing a bystander he had mistaken for a robbery suspect 10 years ago has been ordered to stand trial second Urns in connection with the incident. The Appellate Division of Superior Court reversed a hays finding that Officer William Schneider was not negligent in the fatal shooting of Lucius Harrell on Oct. 11, 1968.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Drastic Demographic Shifts Seen
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - The role of the Federal Government is likely to undergo some profound changes in another decade because of subtle but powerful shifts in the composition of the American population. There will be fewer children to educate, possibly more unemployment for a while, less crime and a swelling of retirement benefits.

title: Shah Delays Arrival in U.S. as Envoy Opposes Visit
description: Special the New York Times

title: Commerce: Small Increases And Deregulation Pressure
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - The Carter Administration promised in its budget presentation today to press Congress to lift regulations in the trucking, railroad and intercity bus industries in an effort to sour competition in those areas.

title: Science Watch
description: Experiments with rats have suggested that cholesterol in the diet can aid the development of cancers caused by other agents. According to a report in the British journal Nature, researchers at the University College Hospital Medical School in London found that after exposure to a cancercausing chemical, far more cancers developed in rats that were fed cholesterol than in rats not given this dietary substance.

title: Book Jackets: Other Readings
description: HOW little we know our fellow  man! A few weeks ago wrote a piece for these pages on the less-than-momentous issue of whether or not one should remove the dust jackets from books before placing the books on the shelf. At least I thought the matter less than momentous. I was wrong, so very wrong.

title: Is Clang of the Trolley 42d StreetBound?; Is Clang of Trolleys 42d StreetBound?
description: Trolley cars, which last clanged across 42d Street in 1946, should return to that busy midtown Manhattan street, a City Planning Commission study suggested yesterday.

title: Fiddling While the Mayor Juggles
description: Winter is always budgetjuggling season for a New York mayor; Mayor Koch must keep more Indian clubs flying than most of his predecessors. He has press his case for aid from Albany and Washington while simultaneously trying to win aooroval of his next operating budget from the City Council and Board Estimate. If his City Hall colleagues contend - as Comptroller Goldin and Council President Bellamy did separately last week - that he can get by with less than he is asking from Albany and Washington, then he will surely get less. If his budget assumes that he'll get all he is asking for, then what if he does not? The Council would balk at the necessary painful, lastminute cutscuts for which the voters would be unprepared.

title: Takeover Stocks Active as Dow Posts Small Gain
description: Corporate takeover stocks, which produced many of Wall Street's big winners last year, continued to shine yesterday, along with two prominent glamour issues. Elsewhere, the market generally showed small price changes in light trading.

title: Recruiting the Budget Against Inflation
description: Often, the annual Presidential budget offers a compelling and detailed look at an Administration's priorities. But President Carter's new $532billion budget offers no grand new scheme, no exciting initiative. Instead, Mr. Carter yesterday sent Congress what he correctly calls a lean and austere budget - a document of detours and stop signs for Federal policy, rather than tiirontinne

title: 9.85% Predicted for U.S. Notes
description: With the dollar firm in foreign-exchange trading yesterday, the credit markets staged a moderate advance in light volume. Dealers in Government securities said they expected the twoyear Treasury notes scheduled for sale this afternoon to yield about 9.85 percent.

description: OTTAWA, Jan. 2, (Reuters) Canada plans to borrow Japanese yen to help support the Canadian dollar, Finance Minister Jean Chretien said today.

description: At a lunch on Nov. 4,1977, Ellmore C. Patterson, then chairman of the Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, =ted a sterling silver cigar box to Ind McGraw, chairman of McGrawHill Inc., to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the company's relationship with the bank.

title: How New Strategic Arms Accord Is Expected to Be Judged by Congress and the Public
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 16 Administration supporters of the second treaty to limit strategic arms agree with its critics in Congress and the military establishment on one point: The treaty, when sinned, will provoke a bitter debate

title: Joseph LeRoy Hansen; Worked With Trotsky
description: Joseph LeRoy Hansen, who worked on the secretarial staff of Leon Trotsky and twice ran as a Trotskyist candidate for the United States Senate from New York, died last Thursday at Mount Sinai Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in New York City.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: City Calls On Regents To Allow Extra Dates For High School Test
description: ALBANY, Jan. 22  The New York City Board of Education asked the state today to give the basiccompetency test every six weeks from now through August so that more students would be able to pass it and get their high school diplomas.

title: Writing Test Is Also Innovative
description: j UST as the Regents new reading test is designed to reflect the way people actually read, so the writing component of the new statewide competency program contains a series of innovations aimed at measuring in a realistic way students ability to write.

title: Abortion Foes March in Capital on Anniversary of Legalization
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 22 - Chanting Life, Life, Life and No compromise, about 60,000 people opposed to abortion gathered here today on the sixth anniversary of the Supreme Court ruling that legalized abortion. Walking in a bitter winter wind from the White House to the Capitol in a March for Life, the demonstrators carried post- ers with pictures of babies and captions such as Thank God, Jesus Wasn't Aborted and I was adopted, Not Aborted, Thank God.

title: Antibody Research Intensifies
description: CLEVERLY contrived joint ventures between the cells of living animals and certain cancer cells grown in laboratory flasks are opening a whole new world of research on the body's natural defenses aeainst disease.

title: Gary Player, Faithful to South Africa, Is Bunkered Between Golf and Politics
description: COLESBERG, South Africa  Out here in the big sky country of rural South Africa, few people have difficulty recognizing the local rancher in suede Stetson and silverbuckle belt, nor inidentifying the trade that gained him the fortune needed to develop a 4,000acre spread for breeding thoroughbred race horses.

title: Money Funds Balloon in Size
description: One reason for stagnant moneysupply growth recently may be the booming success of moneymarket funds in early 1979.

title: Market Place
description: FOR several weeks Hart Schaffner & Marx, the manufacturer and retailer of premiumprice men's wear, has been a subject of merger rumors. The rumors were fanned last weekend by the announcement that three of the company's key executives had resigned to take other jobs.

description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., Jan. 23 (AP) - Ernest Graham and Larry Gibson combined for 14 points during a 226 secondhalf scoring spree tonight as Maryland defeated Navy, 8262.

title: Khomeini Said to Work on Panel
description: NEAUPHLE-LE-CHATEAU, France, Jan. 23  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, who plans to return to Iran Friday, was reported by aides today to be struggling to put together an alternative to the Government of Prime Minister Shahpur Bakhtiar.

title: TV Gets You Can't Take It With You
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 23- For over decade, numerous producers have tried to get the television rights to You Can't Take It With You. Warner Bros. Television has finally succeeded. Art Carney as Gramps and Jean Stapleton as his daughter will star in a television

description: The 1891 brownstone on Sixth Avenue in Brooklyn's Park Slope section was just what Joyce Jed had been looking for. A bargain price. Good value. And roots: A permanent stake in the com- munity as a member of the growing league of brownstone revivalists.

title: William Green, 64, Was Board Chairman Of the Clevepak Corp.

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: IT disturbs me to see how many cooks work hard in the kitchen but then diminish their achievement with the use of flattasting, preground spices. So far as I'm concerned, the best way to extract all the potency of a dried spice is to grind it yourself and use it soon after, or better yet, right away:

title: Ballet: Cast Shifts Create Alternate Four Seasons
description: IT isn't every night that a ballet has choreography different from its prior performance, but that seems to be the unusual present case with Jerome Robbins's latest work, The Four Seasons.

title: Modern Gets Munch Show
description: AS a result of a diplomatic coup that was as remarkable for speed as for dexterity, the Museum of Modem Art in New York will be able to show 2.3 major oil paintings from the Edyard Munch exhibition that is winning universal acclaim at the National Gallery of Art in Washington.

title: Head of G.S.A. Declares He'll Stay Temporarily
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI)  Jay Solomon, head of the General Services Administration, said yesterday that he would remain in the job until his invesii  gation of corruption in the agency was on a firm footing. But a spokesman said he would probably leave by spring.

title: Teamster Wage Talks Resumed; Prolonged Bargaining Expected
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23The Interna- tional Brotherhood of Teamsters and the nation's trucking industry today resumed negotiations on a wage contract that the Carter Administration deems critical to the success or failure of its antiinflation program.

title: Con Ed Raises Dividend 11%
description: The Consolidated Edison Company announced yesterday an 11 percent increase in its quarterly dividend, from 55 cents to 61 cents, despite lower profits for the fourth quarter and full year of 1978. The higher dividend is payable March 15 to shareholders of record Feb. 7.

title: White House Says Budget Cuts Are Opposed by Special Interests
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23  The White House suggested today that Congresssional outcries over President Carter's proposed cuts in social programs were a forerunner to, and possibly a smokescreen for, specialinterest efforts to retain $4.5 billion in programs marked for extinction.

title: Cauthen Stays on Coast, Tries New Agent
description: In a sudden change of mind, Steve Cauthen has decided to continue riding at Santa Anita instead of coming East for the nest of Aqueduct's winter meet- ing.

title: 'Blue Gene Tyranny
description: 'BLUE Gene Tyranny's solo concert at the Kitchen on Monday night was the third of four programs devoted to new music from the West Coast. But Mr. Tyranny, who lives in the Bay Area, is already very familiar to East Coast newmusic audiences because of his stint in the Carla Bley ensemble and his recording on the New Yorkbased Lovely Music label. Perhaps this is why be chose to perform works by four Bay Area composers as well as two pieces of his own on his electronic keyboard.

title: Beaths
description: GOODWINPhyllis K. On Jan 22, of Ridgewood, N.J. Wife of the late Fred II. Survived by a son. Phillip K. of Ridgewood, N.J., a sister Eleanor Roberts, Queens & 5 grandchildren. Funeral service will be held Fri. Jan 26, in Guelph, Ontario, Canada.

title: U.S. TRIES BALANCING MOSCOW AND PEKING
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23  President Carter has decided that even though the United States and China are entering a new and potentially close relationship, everything possible must be done to seek improvement at the same time in Ameri- can ties with the Soviet Union, Adminis- tration officials said today.

title: 'Immortals March to Show Fealty to Shah
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 23  More than 1,200 firstline troops marched in stiffkneed fashion across a slushy parade ground today in a show of devotion to the throne staged for foreign correspondents.

title: Koch, in an AboutFace, Reinstaiis Women's Pro'ram He Disbanded
description: Mayor Koch reversed himself yesterday and reinstated the Women's Advisory Program that he abolished last Friday

description: BOOKER L. CLAIBORNE. 3330 Bronx Blvd., the Bronx. Liabilities, 543.127; assets. none.

title: Middle-of-Road Plea Could Be a Theme for Carter in 1980
description: WASHINGTON,Jan. 23  With his deliberate emphasis on two broad issues the battle against inflation and the need for a strong national defense and international arms control  President Carter tonight laid out the major themes on which his advisers expect him to stand for reelection in 1980.

title: Mounting Labor Crisis in Britain Aggravated by Sudden Snowfall
description: LONDON, Jan. 23 (AP)  Snow aggravated the crisis in Britain today, where a 24hour railroad strike, a prolonged strike by truck drivers and walkouts by municipal workers had already produced the nation's most serious labor snarl of the last five years.

title: ELLEN T. BOGNER
description: Ellen T. Bogner, manager of scriptrouting in for the department American broadcast standards for the American Broadcast- ing Company, died Sunday at Roosevelt Hospital, following a long illness. She was 51 years old and a resident of Manhattan.

title: Shah Not Coming, but Rancho Mirage's Feelings Don't Seem Hurt
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., Jan. 23 This is a 10-square-mile town in the Coachella Valley, one of eight in the valley, which is 110 miles southeast of Los Angeles. About 700 millionaires live in the valley, and they avail themselves of 37 golf courses and 7,000 tennis courts. Someone lost track of the number of swimming pools.

title: CBS Won't Cut Ads for Children
description: CBS has no intention of going along with ABC's plan to drop two commercial minutes an hour during weekend children's TV programming, James H. Rosenfield, president of the. CBS Television Network, announced yesterday.

title: Beauty Treatments In the Paris Salons
description: An extravagant potpourri of exotic, sensual and occasionally bizarre beauty treatments awaits the woman who explores the salons and instituts de beauty of Paris. These establishments, always on the lookout for imaginative ways of keeping their clients youthful and radiant, offer treatments that can be as simple as a manicure or as elaborate as the ritual performed to relieve varicose veins. It uses compressed air and bloodcooling fluids.

title: The City Cracks Down on Unit Pricing
description: The Wesson Oil unit prices were posted under the Crisco Oil. Unit prices for salt were under the Wesson Oil. There were no unit prices for peanut butter and none for canned soda. How was a consumer to compare brands? Such was the state of affairs at Sloan's supermarket on Lexington Avenue and 92d. Street, one of 235 stores inspected recently by New York City's . Department of Consumer Affairs for compliance with unit pricing regulations over the last four months. During this series of inspections, the department issued 469 notices of violation, an average of two violations for each store inspected. That was an improvement over the results of a briefer sweep in July, which produced an average of 2.5 violations per store.

title: Ted Cassidy, Lurch in TV Series
description: Ted Cassidy, an actor who played the sinisterlooking, sepuchralvoiced butler Lurch in the comedy television series The Addams Family, died Jan. 16 in Los Angeles of complications following openheart surgery for a nonmalignant tumor. He was 46 years old.

title: Ullman: No Social Security Cuts
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23(AP). President Carter's drive to reduce SOcial Security benefits by $600 million received in almost certain death blow today when the chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee said he did not favor the move in 1979.

title: Beaths
description: EDELSTEIN--EliaS Alex, of New Rochelle on January 23, 1979. Be loved husband of the late Florence, devoted father of Lester Edelstein of Miami Florida and Alfred EdelMen of Harrison NY. Also survived by six grandchildren and eight great grandchildren. Funeral Servi. ces will be private

title: Best Buys
description: QUICK, what was your total food bill in 1978? Although most of us would be hard pressed even to pull a figure from the air, the City of New York Department of Consumer Affairs reports that a typical family of four spent $4,252.28 on groceries last year. That's 10.8 percent above 1977 costs, with only two items actually going down in price: carrots and coffee.

title: ABCTV Tops Nielsen Ratings
description: After a slight postholiday slump, ABCTV roared back in the audiencepopularity ratings last week, scoring huge victory over its rivals with schedule consisting essentially of its regular weekly series. ABC's ratings average for the week was 23.5, compared with 18.5 for CBS and 18.4 for NBC.

title: Macchiarola Proposal Would End Minority Schools Hiring Teachers
description: Schools Chancellor Frank J. Macchia- rola intends to abolish a hiring system that enables local publicschool districts in poor and minority neighborhoods to hire their own teachers.

title: Profit Up For Quarter At Xerox
description: The Xerox Corporation, the world's largest maker of copying/duplicating equipment, reported yesterday profit increases of 16.7 percent for the fourth quarter and 18 percent for the full year.

title: Wine Talk
description: Frank J. Prial

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Yields on new issues of shortterm securities declined yesterday in the credit markets as bond traders continued to grow somewhat more optimistic about the nearterm outlook.

title: Mobile Homes as Art
description: POWELL, Wyo.  Little serious thought has been given to the mobile home as an architectural form despite much talk about low-cost-housing designs and renewed studies of massproduced housing in the 19th century.

title: City Considering a New Note Sale
description: With its $125 million in shortterm notes spoken for almost as soon as they were offered, the city informed financial un- derwriters yesterday that it was contem- plating another note sale within 30 days.

title: Capitol Hill's Reaction to Speech Ranges From Restrained to Cool
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 - Congressional reaction tonight to President Carter's State of the Union Message generally ranged from restrained to unenthusiastic, with occasional praise for his remarks on negotiations to limit strategic arms.

title: Vietnam, Still Beim Attacked, Said to Achieve Main Goals
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 23  Vietnam, with its army strongly established throughout Cambodia though still under attack, appears to have achieved its principal military and political goals there and to have embarked on a period of consolidation, Western and Asian diplomats and analysts said here today.

description: Following is a transcript of President Carter's State of the Union address to a pint session of Congress last night, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: Chorus Sings Mennin
description: THE Newark Boys Chorus is not just an excellent performing group. It is also active in commissioning new works of a substantial nature. Last year, the policy produced Gian Carlo Menotti's Trial of a Gypsy. This year, the new piece is Peter Mennin's Reflections of Emily, and it was given its premiere in the chorus's concert in Alice Tully Hall on Thursday night.

title: Talmadge Admitted to Hospital For Fatigue and Alcohol Abuse
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI)  Senator Herman E. Talmadge, Democrat of Georgia, under investigation by the Senate ethics committee for financial improprieties, was hospitalized last night for alcohol abuse and exhaustion, his office said today.

title: Stage: Raisin in the Sun Revived by'  New Federal
description: THERE has been so much written in recent years about the new black middle class that it is instructive to see once again Lorraine Hansberry's Raisin in the Sun, first performed 20 years ago and now in sturdy revival by the New Federal Theater company at the PilIPTIM Theater on East Third Street-

title: 3 FORMER OFFICIALS OF FRANKLIN BANK CONVICTED OF FRAUD
description: Three former top officials of the Frank- lin National Bank were convicted yetter- day on charges that they had falsified financial records to conceal the bank's loss of millions of dollars.

title: Stenmark Captures 5th Straight Slalom
description: SCHRUNSTSCHAGGUNS, Austria, Jan. 23 (UPI)  Ingemar Stenmark staged one of his patented secondheat comebacks at nearby Steinach today and won his fifth straight World Cup giant slalom.

title: Connors 64, 63 Victor; 3 Seeded Players Lose
description: PHILADELPHIA., Jan. 23 Jimmy Connors was extended tonight by a late replacement, young Van Winitsky of Lauderhill, Fla., before advancing to the second round in the defense of his title in the $250,000 United States Pro indoor championships. Connors won by 64, 63 at the Spectrum before 8,392 fans.

title: 2 Pro Bowl Replacements
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 23 (AP) Ezra Johnsop, a Green Bay Packer end, and Doug English, a Detroit Lion tackle, were named today to replace two injured Dallas defensive players, Harvey Martin and Randy White, on the National Football Conference squad for the Pro Bowl. Martin suf- fered a torn hamstring muscle Sunday in the Cowboys Super Bowl loss to Pittsburgh.

title: Beaths
description: BIRNKRANT - Beatrice. Devoted wife of the late Maxim. Beloved mother of Gladys Ellenbogen and Marjorie Solomon. Deer grand- mother of Benjamin Ellenbogen, M.D. and Elaine Solomon. Services Wednesday Mt Pleasant Cemetery, Hawthorne, NY at 11AM.

title: Battle Reported in Afghanistan
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan, Jan. 23 (Reuters)  Afghan dissidents said here today that hundreds of soldiers and demonstrators were slain in central Afghanistan when the Communist Government of Prime Minister Noor Mohammad Taraki tried to crush a revolt by Moslem insurgents. The dissidents said that more than 700 soldiers and 162 guerrillas were killed, and that 15,000 people had fled into the mountains.

title: Liberals in House Gain Influence On Ways and Means Committee
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 - Liberals on the House Ways and Means Committee, one of the most powerful and closely divided legislative panels on Capitol Hill, gained new strength today as the House Democratic Caucus worked toward com- pleting the lineup of committees for the 96th Congress.

title: Joseph G. Kane, a Vice President Of the Bakery and Tobacco Union
description: Joseph G. Kane, executive vice president of the Bakery, Confectionery and Tobacco Workers International Union, with headquarters in Washington, died of a heart attack Monday at his home in Silver Spring, Md. He was 64 years old.

title: Yanks Object as Kuhn Restricts Carew Deals
description: Commissioner Bowie Kuhn, who has not been pleased with the Yankees pursuit of free agents, stepped into their pursuit of Rod Carew yesterday, and now the Yankees are not pleased.

title: Merchants of Jerusalem Live in Fear of Bombing
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 23  Beny Mordethai was arranging oranges at his end of the vegetable-and-fruit stall when the bomb exploded a few feet away, right where his father was stand- ing.

title: WASHINGTON The State of Confusion
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23  A President who has to deal with his partners in the Congress and his adversaries overseas has to choose his words with utmost care. This was President Carter's dilemma in drafting his State of the Union Message.

title: Rep. Flood Took Bribe, A 4th Witness Testifies
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (UPI)  A West Coast businessman testified today that he had given $5,000 to Representative Daniel J. Flood, Democrat of Pennsylvania, in 1972 as prepayment for the Representative's influence in awarding contract for temporary housing for hurricane victims.

title: Gromyko Meets Italian Officials
description: ROME, Jan. 23 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Andrei A. Gromyko of the Soviet Union met with Italian officials today for talks expected to bring about agreements on scientific, cultural and legal cooperation between Italy and the Soviet Union.
