title: Where to Find Salvaged Treasure
description: EVERYWHERE, fine, old buildings are being demolished  but, thankfully, not all are buried alive with their architectural treasures and costly building materials. Antique gargoyles, fireplace mantels, Gothic archways, stained glass, parquet flooring and other, more prosaic building materials can still be bought at prices far below their replacement value. The noblem, however, is locating the treasures before wrecking contractors start swinging their oneton balls.

title: Bullets 128, Celtics 106
description: BOSTON, Jan. 24 (AP)  Charlie Johnson, Larry Wright and Greg Ballard combined for 78 points, each hitting seasonhigh totals tonight, to lead the Washington Bullets to a 128106 rout of the Boston Celtics.

title: Solar Heating Is Taught on L.I.
description: BROOKVILLE.L.I.

title: British Labor: Ranks Revolt
description: LONDON, Jan. 29  When several hundred thousand municipal workers stayed away from their jobs all over Britain last Monday, their strike was supposed to have lasted only one day, a symbolic show of strength as new contract negotiations got under way.

title: China Oilfield Talks Reported
description: TOKYO. Jan. 24 (AP)  Negotiations are under way among China. Japan and the United States on a Sl billion project to develop jointly an oilfield in western China, probably bigger than the major fields in Taching and Shengli, the Kyodo News Service of Japan has reported from Peking.

title: NEW &
description: If you like designer furniture but not its price tag, or you can't resist a bargain, consider a trip to 11th Avenue and 48th Street for the Warehouse Sale. From tomorrow until Jan. 31, designer furniture will sell for 40 to 70 percent less than it would fetch in the decorator showrooms where it is usually sold. Be warned, though: Some items are damaged or soiled. Decorative Trade Services, which is running the sale, is a furniture warehouse. It is using its main floor to display more than $250,000 worth of merchandise. Although most of the furniture is from showrooms and manufacturers who do custom work for decorators, there is also overstock from a wellknown retail store, including chrome and leather chairs for $65 and $80 that sold originally for as much as $179. Most of the items are more expensive. A fivepiece sectional sofa with bamboo frame and white duck cushions is selling for $600; a threesection wooden wall storage unit, at $500, is one of many discontinued wall units. Marbletopped dining tables from Italy, originally $1,200, are $450 and $500. It's a cash-and-carry sale (personal checks accepted), but deliveries can be arranged. The Warehouse Sale is at 655 1 lth Avenue and will be open every day including Sunfrom 10 A.M. to 6 P.M.

title: Rand Freed From Dollar
description: CAPE TOWN, Jan. 24 (UPI) South Africa has decided to free its currency, the rand, from the United States dollar and to ease foreignexchange controls, Foreign Minister Owen Horwood said today. The new monetary policy is designed to encourage foreigners to invest in South Africa.

title: Hers
description: DURING my undergraduate years, we lived literary characters and period sensibility. One week it was Lady Brett and Jake Barnes, the next, young Werther and his sorrows. Every Ivy campus had its Nietzschean Ubermensch, or Harry the Rat, since those beyond good and evil don't take precautions. And everyone played Outsider, Camusstyle, or according to Colin Wilson.

title: Highly Decorated Veteran Ousted; U.S. Denies His Charge of a Purge
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  Amid conflicting explanations over the action, the Labor Department has removed one of the most decorated veterans of the Vietnam War from his consultancy post of finding jobs for veterans.

title: Burroughs Dividend
description: Directors. of the Burroughs Corporation raised the quarterly dividend from 40 cents a share to 50 cents, payable May 7 to shareholders of record on April 4. The company noted that this was the fifth dividend increase on its common shares since January 1977 when the dividend was 17 cents a share

title: Israel Protests to U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 24 (Reuters)  Israel protested in a letter to the president of the Security Council tonight over what it called repeated and indiscriminate shelling of civilian targets by terrorists operating from Lebanese territory.

title: Atkins Sets Up Securities Firm
description: What does one do for an encore after going through the University of North Carolina in two years, being a Marshall Scholar at the London School of Economics and spending a year researching foreign exchange rates as a Fellow of the Brookings Institution?

title: Vatican Replies on Archbishop
description: ROME, Jan. 24 (AP)  The Vatican said today that Archbishop Hilarion Capudji, who was jailed for three years in Israel for smuggling arms to Palestinian guerrillas, flew to Damascus, Syria, on Sunday without authorization from the

title: AYATOLLAH DEFIANT
description: NEAUPHLE-LE-CHATEAU, France, Thursday, Jan. 25  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini defiantly reaffirmed yesterday his intention to return to Iran on Friday and to lead his supporters to victory in their struggle to set up an Islamic republic, despite the closing of Teheran's airport yesterday morning.

title: HOWARD T. FISHER
description: Howard T. Fisher, director emeritus of the Laboratory for Computer Graphics I and Spatial Analysis at Harvard University's School of Design, died yesterday at the Exeter Hospital in Exeter, N.H. He was 75 years old.

title: Tax Seminar Audits Some Fine Points
description: They studied the bible  Publication 17 of the Internal Revenue Serviceand concluded that living in sin could often be wiser than filing joint tax returns.

title: Rehearsal Club Closing in June
description: The board of the 66-year-old Re- hearsal Club, a lowcost residence for young women aspiring to careers in the performing arts, will close the club in June rather than fight the city over the loss of its propertytax exemption.

title: Snow Farming Fills Needs of Ski Areas
description: This has been a winter for the snow farmer. Abrupt weather changes in the East have caused skimountain maintenance crews to spend more time farming snow than making it.

title: United Telecom Link
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Jan. 24 (UPI) United Telecommunications Inc. announced today the affiliation of the Hillsborough and Montgomery Telephone Company, with headquarters in Bell Mead, NJ., and the United Telecommunications system.

title: Foster Care Linked to Jones Cult
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 24 (UPI)  The Rev. Jim Jones of the People's Temple cult had an estimated 150 foster children under his care, and at least one of them died at his Guyana camp, a Senate subcommittee was told today.

title: Swiss Lift Franc Curb
description: GENEVA, Jan. 24 - The Swiss Government showed confidence in the growing stability of exchange rates by revoking today some of the measures taken last February to curb upward pressure on the value of the Swiss franc.

title: Radio
description: 8:159 A.M., WQXR. Violin Concer- to, Lalo: Raymooda Grand Waltz, Glaztosov.

title: Insider Reports
description: NEW YORK EXCHANGE

title: Letters
description: Washington, Jan. 17,1979 The writer is professor of economics at Georgetown University.

title: Shelling Across Lebanese Border Ended by Truce
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Jan. 24  Southern Lebanon was quiet today after a ceasefire had been arranged by United Nations representatives . between Israeli forces and Palestinian euerrillas.

title: Television
description: 6:00(4)The Lessons of History (5)New Zoo Revue (13)Captioned ABC News

title: Citicorp Forms A New Unit
description: Citicorp announced yesterday the formation of a nationwide subsidiary to conduct all of the assetbased financing activities, such as equipment leasing and factoring, that had been carried out by Citibank and other subsidiaries of the big bankholding company.

title: ESSAY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  In the very first words of his previous appearance before a joint session of Congress, Jimmy Carter made a mistake: He addressed the man sitting above and behind him as Vice President. But on such occasions, Walter Mon- dale sits there in his constitutional role as President of the Senate, and the proper salutation from the U.S. Presi- dent is Mr. President.

title: Senators Clashing on Truck Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  Senator Edward M. Kennedy and Senator Howard W. Cannon are locked in a bitter dispute over the new Kennedy measure to halt pricefixing in truck freight hauling.

title: Carter's Address Draws a Barrage Of Criticism From G.O.P. Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  National leaders of the Republican. Party responded today to President Carter's State of the Union Message with a barrage of political criticism that covered virtually every aspect of the nationally televised address.

title: RecordSetting Auction Stars of 1978
description: BY now it is clear that 1978 will be remembered by auction watchers as the year of the object  be a doll house or a decoy, a 12thcentury candlestick or a 20thcentury clock. Such wares brought record prices at public sales, overshadowing the less spectacular price increases in painting and sculpture.

title: News Summary
description: Iran's Prime Minister offered to resign and to let the people decide whether they wanted a monarchy or a republic if, in return, Ayatollah Khomeini would delay his return to Iran and make other concessions. But in a move that seemed to undercut the peace offer before the Ayatollah  could respond, Iran's Na- tional Security Council ordered the closing of Teheran's international air- port until Sunday. The exiled Moslem leader had planned to return tomor- row. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: U.S. Utility Turns To Foreign Banks
description: DETROIT, Jan. 24  In an unusual deal, the Detroit Edison Company has financed a $90 million purchase of nuclear fuel through a syndicate of five foreign banks. It is the first time a utility In this country has made such a purchase with entirely foreign financing.

title: Knicks Fall to Warriors, 126123
description: OAKLAND, Calif. Jan. 29 - One team had to end its losing streak tonight at the Oakland Coliseum Arena and, unfortunately for New York rooters, it wasn't the Knicks.

title: At Midterm, Tests Await a Stronger Carter
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24  Midway through his term, Jimmy Carter can point to a number of solid achievements be has engineered as President. Yet as a leader, his closest associates concede, he remains precariously vulnerable and must prove himself in the year ahead.

title: Retail Chains Sales Up 10.6%
description: December sales at 32 of the nation's largest retail chains rose an average of 10.6 percent from the December 1977 level, according to Chain Store Age, a trade publication.

title: Contributions Flow In as Fund For Neediest Nears Final Month
description: Belated contributors to the 67th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund are turning up in greater numbers as the campaign heads toward its final month. The drive, which began Dec. 3, will conclude at the end of Febru- ary.

title: Home Improvement
description: IN the cold winter months tremen- dous amounts of heat escpe from your home or apartment through the doors, walls, roof and win- doivs. Proper insulation and storm win- dows can cut down this heat loss, but leaks still occur around doors and win- dows ana even tfunugn wail outlets ana your home clothes dryer. There are several new products now available to help you plug these leaks and reduce your fuel bills.

title: Quebec Premier to Seek U.S. Neutrality on Separatism During Visit
description: MONTREAL, Jan. 24  Premier Rene Levesque of Quebec, who wants his largely Frenchspeaking province to become a sovereign nation, says he expects Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau and the Liberal Party to lose the coming federal elections.

title: Four Oil Producers Cite Mixed Results in Quarter
description: Mixed earnings were reported yesterday by four of the nation's leading oil producers for the quarter that ended Dec. 31.

title: Syracuse Edges Temple, 7876, in Overtime; Are Teams TourneyBound?; Cohen Sets Scoring Pace
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 29  No matter how bad things appear to be for Syracuse when it plays at the Palestra, the Orange have a knack for winning in this den of Philadelphia basketball. But tonight's victory was a hardearned one, as the Orange came from behind and then, in a thrilling overtime period, defeated Temple, 7876.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Prices of silver for futures delivery soared to record levels yesterday, with most deliveries closing less than a cent below the daily permissible limit of 20 cents an ounce.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Article 1 -- No Title

title: Sears Sues U.S. Over Job Bias Laws
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 24 - Sears, Roebuck & Company filed suit against 10 Federal agencies today, saying that it could not follow their directives on equal-employment opportunities. It charged that Government laws, regulations, interpreta-

title: United Energy Outlay
description: United Energy Resources Inc. announced yesterday that its subsidiaries planned capital expenditures of approximately $215 million this year as compared with about S154 million in 1978. The company's subsidiaries are engaged in natural gas transmission, oil and gas exploration, production and contract drilling, and other primarily energyrelated activities.

title: Violo Solos by the Boston Symphony
description: GREAT violinists are often drawn to the viola just as great actors are often drawn to play- ing second leads. lago can be a more interesting part, for instance, than Othello, who is all figure and no ground. Like lago, however, the viola is an instrument of texture and dark sub- tleties, and it is no wonder that when Mozart played chamber music he chose the viola as his instrument. No wonder, either, that when the Boston Symphony Orchestra performed two works last night at Carnegie Ball with important solo viola part's, there was Pinches Zukerman with the big fiddle under his bearded chin.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
description: REMEMBER THE NEEDIEST!

description: 6 :00(4)Tlie Lessons of History

title: Knicks Holzman Finds Silver Lining; A Positive Loss; Came Back Three Times; Knicks Box Score; WEDNESDAY NIGHT; KNICKS (123); GOLDEN STATE(126)
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Jan. 25 - Red Holzman, the Knicks coach, was not entirely unhappy after last night's 126123 loss here to the Warriors, who had lost their six previous games. In fact, he found a silver lining after the pa me against Golden State.

title: Military Budget. Focus on Europe Worries Some Experts
description: A key question arising from the new Pentagon budget is whether United States military planners, in their effort to strengthen Western Europe against any expansion of Soviet forces, are jeopardizing American ability to operate effec-

title: Fed Data On Money Reviewed
description: The Federal Reserve Board is re-examining, the way it measures the money supply and considering a sweeping change in the definition of the monetary aggregates, Nancy Teeters, a Fed governor, said yesterday.

title: Abbott Wins, Hebert Bows In MatchPlay Title Golf
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Jan. 23 (AP) - Bryan Abbott, the defending champion, defeated Rocky Nelson of Galena, Ohio, 4 and 3, today in secondround play of the Professional Golfers Association national matchplay championship.

title: Botanical Garden Honoring Five
description: Cecil D. Andrus, the Secretary of the Interior, will receive the New York Botanical Garden's Green World award in a ceremony in the Enid Haupt Conservatory at the garden on Feb. 8. Four other environmental awards will be given at the same ceremony.

title: China Rehabilitates Business Class Degraded in the Cultural Revolution
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 25  Property seized from China's former capitalists during the Cultural Revolution will be returned in an effort to enlist them in the national quest for modernization, the press agency Hsinhua reported today.

title: 64 Legislators to Study Real New York City
description: ALBANY, Jan. 25  James L. Emery, the Assembly minority leader, said yesterday that all 64 upstate Republican Assemblymen would make factfinding trip to New York. City feb 22)

title: Governor Favors State Operation Of Any Casinos
description: Issue Has Divided Albany First Public Remarks

title: U.S. Wins Right to See Data on Cigarette Ads
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP) - The Government won a court ruling today on access to voluminous information from the tobacco industry that could lead to new regulation of cigarette advertising.

title: The Pop Life
description: WALK into most bookstores these days, wend your way to the music section, and chances are what you'll see, along with the classicalmusic books and other esoterica, are'rock fan books and song books. Name a pop star, and you'll prooamy rim some ui relevant book, and quite likely a collection of his or her songs in simple piano arrangements, with rudimentary guitar chords, as well.

title: Fundamentalist Schools Fight Controls
description: An estimated 5,000 Christian fundamentalist schools that have sprung up in the past few years are claiming the right to keep the state completely out of their affairs, and some have won the support of the courts.

title: Kennedy Says He Will End Veto Of U.S. Judges by Their Senators
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (UPI) - Senator Edward M. Kennedy, the new chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee, served notice today that he was ending the traditional system allowing a senator to veto any prospective Federal judgeship nominee from his state.

title: Is Holmes Too Good a Boxer?; Undefeated, Unemployed; Not a Household Word; The Champion Holmes: Is He Too Good a Boxer?; Opponents Are Scarce; Bottom Line: Ratings
description: It was, said the baddest heavyweight champion of the world, like being in the middle of a rainbow knowing that at the end there's a pot of money waiting.

title: At the Movies
description: JOHN HUSTON, fully recovered from major surgery, began shooting his first film since The Man Who Would Be King earlier this week in what has been for him until now terra incognita. He is down in Macon, Ga., directing Wise Blood, adapted from the novel of the same title by the late Flannery O'Connor.

title: New York Turns Into a Winter Antiques Festival as 67th Street Armory Show Begins
description: This weekend, as on the last weekend of every January, New York is transformed into an eventpacked. 10day antiques festival. The variety and quality of the activities attract collectors and dealers by the thousands from Hoboken to Hawaii, who congregate here primarily to shop at the poshest fair of other people's discards on the North American Continent. But while they're here, they  and you  can also drop in at the auctions and galleries, confer with experts at seminars, attend a forum on taxation, recession and appraisals and hear former Vice President Rockefeller defend selling his art and antiques reproductions. The major activities include:

title: Raiders Supportive Of Denial by Stabler
description: Ken Stabler was defended by his teammates on the Oakland Raiders yesterday after the bearded lefthanded quarterback had denied any role in setting up the cocaine arrest of a California sportswriter.

title: Music: Meredith Monk
description: MEREDITH MONK'S music concerts at the Kitchen, which began Wednesday night and continue through tomorrow night, are attracting big crowds. That's no doubt becouse of her dance reputation, but music lovers should find these concerts of great worth, as well. For in them Miss Monk is confirming that she has become one of the more fascinating experimental composers of the day.

title: Khomeini, His Return Forestalled, Asks Supporters in Iran to Be Calm
description: NEAUPHLE-LE-CHATEAU, France, Jan. 25 - Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini acknowledged today that the Iranian Government's decision to close all airports had blocked his immediate return, and he called on his followers to remain calm and avoid provoking any interven tion by the army.

title: Japan Predicts 6.3% Growth
description: TOKYO. Jan. 25 (AP)  Japan's real economic growth will be 6.3 percent in the fiscal year 1979, which begins April 1, while the annual inflation rate will be 4.9 percent, the Government said today.

title: Giants: Waiting Game
description: Admitting that the differences existing between himself and his uncle were nothing that can't be resolved, Tim Mara said yesterday that the Giants could not be expected to name a director of operations until after Monday night's Pro Bowl game.

title: Advertising
description: Philip H. Dougherty

title: Dance: East Meets West
description: INDIAN classical dance is perhaps the most codified, precise and complex of all national dance forms. A lifetime of study and practice and intimate familiarity with the culture are necessary ineredientc for performance. one expected little, then, from a concert of Bharata Nat- yam pieces by Ari Darom on Thursday at the Theater of the Open Eye. Mr. Darom is a young American.

title: 11 Accused of Plot to Take Over Homosexual Baks
description: Eleven persons, including a Long Island high school teacher and a city architect, were indicted yesterday in connection with an alleged underworld conspiracy involving counterfeiting, loansharking and an attempt to take over afterhours homosexual bars in Greenwich Village.

title: Stage: Julius Caesar at Public Theater
description: TO mount a production of Julius Caesar that system- atically includes only black and Hispanic actors seems on the face of it as arbitrary as to put one on that systematically excludes them.

title: Dividends
description: THURSDAY, JAN 25.1979

title: Sports News Briefs
description: CHARLESTON, W.Va., Jan. 25 (AP) - West Virginia University officials say that the Mountaineers football coach, Frank Cignetti, seriously ill until two weeks ago, has had a sudden turn for the better in his health.NEW DELHI, Jan. 25, (Reuters) India totalled 523 runs for six wickets in its first innings at the end of the second day of the fifth test against the West Indies today.

title: Men's Styles for the Real World
description: Not too long ago, insecure Male models tried to indicate how comfort- able they felt on the runways, as they showed new clothes, by puffing fero- ciously on ciaarettes.

title: uraup
description: ALDRICH--Dr.Henry R., IrPMiddletown, Conn., of 74 Maple Shade Road, Middletown, Conn. and former Leonia, N.J.resident. Former Secretary of Geology Society of America for 27 years. Husband of Helen(Buttum)Aldrich. Services at the Doolittle Funeral Home, 14 Church St., Middletown, Conn. January 26Th at 2PM. No calling hours.

title: UAL Profit Off in Quarter
description: UAL Inc., the holding company that owns United Airlines and Western International Hotels, reported yesterday that its earnings for the fourth quarter of last year declined to $16.5 million, or 63 cents a share, from $.14.2 million, or $1.77 a share, a year earlier.

title: Carey Says Tuition Increase Was State University's Idea
description: ALBANY, Jan. 25 - Governor Carey said today that he did not initiate a proposed $100 tuition rise at the State University for the system's 340,000 students, and later in the day the university chancellor conceded that the idea had orginated with the school. University officials had suggested earlier. that the Governor orginated the elan_

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The Braniff International. Corpora- tion disclosed that it had purchased four 727201) jet aircraft from the Boe- ing Company for $60.7 million. The new planes will be delivered in 1981.

title: Bombs Explode in Rome Suburbs As Political Violence Continues
description: ROME, Jan. 25 (UPI) - Three bombs exploded in suburban areas of Rome tonight and early today in a continuing wave of political violence that has claimed four lives this year. There were no injuries and damage was slight.

title: Are You Now Moves To the Century Theater
description: The Eric Bentley drama Are You Now or Have You Ever Been moved from the Promenade Theater last night to the Century Theater, at 235 West 46th Street, because recent snow and rain resulted in severe leaks inside the Promenade.

title: Depleted Islanders Triumph, 42, As Resch Stops 28 Bruins Shots
description: BOSTON, Jan. 25 - The Islanders showed the Boston Bruins tonight that persistence does not always pay off. The Islanders beat the Bruins, 42, in rough game in which the home team outshot New York, 3017.

title: U.S. Report Predicts. TradeDeficit Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25  For the first time since 1975, economic growth abroad is expected to exceed growth in the United States this year and this should have a marked effect in reducing the deficits in the American trade and balance-of-payments accounts, President Carter's annual Economic Report to Congress said today.

title: About Real Estate
description: Fresh from a rental success in a commercial building on East 12th Street that he converted to apartments, Harvey P. Katz is moving into the luxury coop market with another conversion, this time on the East Side.

title: Coop City Withholds $1 Million, Due on Its Mortgage, for Repairs
description: The board of directors of Coop City decided yesterday to withhold the housing complex's monthly mortgage payments of more than $1 million from New York State and to use the money for repair work.

title: Brat
description: DEVNEY--Brian E. on Jan 12,1979 o Kingston, Ontario, Canada (former IY of Pelham Manor NY) belovec husband of Betty Olsen Devney. Sor of Edward J. Devney, stepson Hildur Devney, brother of Lleut Comdr. Anne M. Devney, USN anc Sean Devney. Reposing Pelham Funeral Home, 64 Lincoln Ave. Pet ham, NY. Mass Our Lady of Perpe tual Help Church, Pelham Manor, NY on Saturday at 10:00 AM. Visit ing hours Thurs. & Fri. only, 79PM.

title: Electricity Plant Using Westchester's Wastes Proposed for Peekskill
description: WHITE PLAINS, Jan. 25 Officials of Westchester County and of Peekskill proposed today that the county construct in the city a plant to burn all the county's solid waste and up to 60,000 tons a year of sewage sludge to produce cheap electricity.

title: A Merry Old Benefit for Shakespeare
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - Revelers clad in black tie and Elizabethan garb took the Bard of Avon's words at face value this evening as they rolled up in limousines and taxis and paraded into the scarlet and white striped tent thrown up like a battle encampment on the terrace of the Folger Shakespeare Library.

title: Federal Reserve
description: Rrevised *over $100,000 seasonally adjusted Latest week may not refer to the same period n.a.--not available; data not comparable because of change in series

title: Flood Withdraws as Chairman of Key Panel in House
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (UPI)  Representative Daniel J. Flood, the Pennsylvania Democrat who is on trial in Washington on bribery, conspiracy and perjury charges, has decided not to seek reappointment as chairman of a key appropriations subcommittee, a spokesman said today.

title: U. S. Oil and the Embargo on Rhodesia
description: DURHAM, N.C.  For two and half years, five Western oil companies have been named in a series of charges and disclosures as the direct and indirect suppliers of almost all of Rhodesia's oetroleum products during the last 12 years, in defiance of a United Nations embargo. They are British Petroleum; Shell International Pe- troleum Co., based in London; Mobil, Caltex and the Compagnie Francaise des Petroles, the French Government oil concern. Now, the Treasury Department has confirmed the reopening of its 1976 investigation, which it called inconclusive, into possible sanctions violations by American firms.

title: The City
description: A 23-year-old Brooklyn man who was quoted yesterday as saying that he was responsible for slashing 112 tires on 49 Police Department tow trucks on Wednesday has recanted his statement.

title: TV Weekend
description: THE schedule is stuffed with new series, but at least one other curiosity is worth noting  briefly. Night Flight, a halfhour drama being carried on WCBSTV tonight at 7:30, has been adapted from a novel by Antoine de Samt Lxupery. Presented by the Singer Company, the syndicated program stars none other than that fine actor Trevor Howard and, on the whole, is one of the stranger pieces to be seen floating around major stations these days.

title: Chinatown Dining, a Selection
description: In addition to the many special New Year's banquets being held in Chinatown restaurants this weekend a number of establishments will be offering their regular menus, all in the usual nofrills setting typical of the area and at

title: U.S. Envoy Opens Talks in Cairo On Issues Thwarting Israel Pact
description: CAIRO, Jan. 25  Alfred L. Atherton Jr., the special American envoy for Middle East peace negotiations, opened talks with Egyptian officials today on treaty proposals he had discussed for more than a week in Israel

title: Bashka Paeff, Sculptor Of Boy and Bird, 85
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. (UPI)  Bashka Paeff, a sculptor, died Wednesday at her home at the age of 85.

title: Bridge:
description: Amateur Players Getting Chance to Vie With Pros

title: Otto Guth, 67, Teacher at Curtis, Head of Marines Opera Workshop
description: Otto Guth, former head of the opera workshop at the Matures College of Music and a faculty member of the Curtis Institute of Music in Philadelphia, died at Mount Sinai Hospital yesterday. He was 67 years old.

title: Test to Check Fetus Is Called Safe
description: BOSTON, Jan. 25 (AP)  The largest study ever conducted on women who take a genetic test to check the health of their fetuses has concluded that the examination, called amniocentesis, is safe, hiphlv reliable and extremely accurate.

title: Connors, Gerulaitis Are Tested, But Gain U.S. Pro Quarterfinals
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 25 - I opseeded Jimmy Connors, the defender, and fourthseeded Vitas Gerulaitis triumphed in exciting matches tonight to reach the quarterfinal round of the $250,000 United States pro indoor tennis championship at the Spectrum.

title: Kennedy Invited to Teng Dinner
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (UPI) - President Carter overruled objections from some aides sent an invitation today to Senator Edward M. Kennedy, Democrat of Massachussetts to attend the state dinner next Monday in honor of Deputy Prime Minister Teng HsiaoPing of China.

title: Michigan Upsets Michigan State
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Jan. 25 (AP) Keith Smith, a freshman, took two deep breaths, then sank a free throw with no time left tonight to give Michigan a 4948 upset Big Ten basketball victory over Michigan State, ranked fourth in the sportswriters poll.CHAPEL HILL, N.C., Jan. 25 (AP)  Secondranked North Carolina, playing with a healthy lineup for the first time in two weeks, defeated Wake Forest, 7669, tonight led by Al Wood with 23 points and Mike O'Koren with 19.COLUMBUS, Ohio, Jan. 25 (AP) Kelvin Ransey's 17 points led Ohio State to a 7361 victory over Northwestern tonight, helping the Buckeyes protect their twogame lead in the Big Ten Conference.RUTHERFORD, N.J., Jan. 25 Andre Gaddy, a 6-foot-10-inch soph- more center from Brooklyn, scored 25 points tonight to spark George Mason University of Virginia to a 7167 victory over Fairleigh Dickinson University.HEMPSTEAD, N.Y., Jan. 25  St. Joseph's rallied from a 7point deficit early in the second half to pull out 5756 victory over Hofstra in an East Coast Conference game tonight.IOWA CITY, Jan. 25 (UPI)  Ronnie Lester scored 17 points tonight as Iowa stunned Illinois, 5852, to move into sole possession of second place in the Big Ten.

title: Animal House Cutup Finds a World of Deltas
description: ANYONE could be forgiven for thinking that Tim Matheson, the goodlooking frathouse womanizer with the furlined lair, brought more than a little reallife experience to his role in National Lampoon's Animal House, that spectacularly popular cinematic satire on campus life in the early 1960's. He concedes quite cheerfully that he knows a lot of ladies  he's even played Romeo on the stage in California  and he managed to get beaten up by a few genuine, beersodden fraternity brothers while on location at Oregon State University during the making of Animal House.

title: Antismoking Drive Keeps Gaining, But Impetus Seems to Have Slowed
description: The world of the American smoker is shrinking, but not nearly as fast as most antismoking crusaders would like it to. And there are indications that the antismoking movement may have lost some of its impetus since it blossomed in the early years of this decade.

title: MoneySupply Growth Is Continuing to Slow
description: Growth of the nation's money supply is continuing to slow, according to figures released by the Federal Reserve yesterday.

title: Bonwit Teller Building to Be Sold
description: The building that has housed Bonwit Teller's Fifth Avenue store for nearly five decades is scheduled to be sold in move that apparently paves the way for the closing of the troubled store, possibly by midJuly:

title: Canadians Urged by. Ottawa Panel To Accept Quebec's SpeckMature
description: OTTAWA. Jan. 25 - A special government commission, which for 18 months has been studying how to keep Canada from disintegrating, called on the Canadian people today to recognize the distinctive nature of Frenchspeaking Quebec or risk its secession from the federation.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 800- Worker Chicken Concern in South Bronx Decides to Stay After All
description: A south Bronx poultry processor who had decided to move to Maryland because of delays by city agencies on his requests to rent larger quarters is staying in the city after all. He expects to sign lease with Mayor Koch on ti bigger building on Wednesday.

title: The Meaning of Being Radically American
description: BALTIMORE  American radicalism can be divided into two general camps: indigenous and imitative. The imitators of foreign radicalism, and those who interpret American movements by foreign terms, are the most widely recognized in this culture, but they are in fact the least culturally significant. While it is true that American dissidents have been a resounding failure by applying the usual categories of mass parties, class consciousness and popular use of the stereotyped vocabulary of the left, such concepts are usually irrelevant to American conditions.

title: Books: Inspector Alleyn Caper
description: GRAVE MISTAKE. By Ngaio Marsh. 252 pages. Little. Braun $8.95.

title: Congress Questioning Mergers
description: The American Express Company's proposed takeover of McGrawHill Inc. is raising questions in Congress about the propriety of that acquisition and of mergers in general.

title: Excerpts From the President's Annual Report to Congress on U.S. Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - Following are excerpts from President Carter's Economic Report, submitted to Con- gress today:

title: Elicker Uses Art Shows At SCM
description: Many of the nation's conglomerates are running into the problem of how to publicize the parent company, even though one of its subsidiary's products might be well known.

title: Pope With a style All His Own
description: ROME, Jan. 25 - Weeks before Pope John Paul II set out for his trip to Santo Domingo and MexiCo, he started learning Spanish, getting up an hour early, at 5 A.M., to find the necessary time.

title: 2 Boys, 14, Face Trial, as Adults In Fire Fatal to 7
description: Two 14-year-old boys were arraigned as adults in the Bronx yesterday after grand jury handed up indictments that accused them of demonstrating a depraved indifference to human life and charged them with the murder of seven .persons who died in a fire the boys allegedly set last November.

title: Integrity of N.Y. Horse Racing Is Under Study on Two Fronts
description: While a State legislative task force pondered yesterday the question of racetrack integrity at a hearing in Manhattan, a Federal grand jury in Brooklyn was quietly calling witnesses to testify on allegations that some of New York's leading jockeys, including Angel Cordero, had accepted bribes to keep their horses out of the money in races involving betting on triples.

title: Carter Will Meet Press At White House Today
description: President Carter will hold a news conference in the White House at P.M. today.

title: Play: Interior Drama. At Negro Ensemble
description: THE Negro Ensemble began its current season of new plays with Steve Carter's moving naturalistic drama, Nevis Mountain Dew. Since then, the company has been tediously talking in circles - with Daughters of the Mock, Plays from Africa and last night A Season to Unravel by Alexis De Veaux.

title: Dance: Marcus Schulkind Patterns
description: ARCUS SCHULKIND is young moderndance choreographer who produces uneven work. He is at his best in solos and in his use of popular music. He is dull, even sterile, in group pieces that are set to Classical music.

title: Northeast Ski Areas Get Big Snow Bonus
description: Many ski areas in central Vermont and New Hampshire were digging out yesterday after snowstorms buried al- most the entire Northeast ski country.

title: for Children
description: WINTER WOODLAND WALK, through the Bartlett Arboretum, 151 Brookdale Road, Stamford, Conn, led by Oscar P. Stone. an arborist and horticulturist , on Sunday at 2 P.M., 151 Brookdale Road, Stamford, Conn. Free. Sponsored by the Arboretum and the College of Agriculture and Natural Resources of the University of Connecticut. Call (203) 3226071.

title: F.C.C. Ends Telegram Monopoly
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - The Federal Communications Commission abolished Western Union's monopoly over the telegram business today and declared that any competitors might enter the business.

title: New York Group Formed to Fight Phone Rate Rise
description: Formation of a coalition of statewide organizations to protest against the New York Telephone Company's proposed $290 million rate increase was announced yesterday by Rosemary Pooler, executive director of the State Cnsumer Protection Board. The request for the rate increase is before the Public Service Cornmission

title: Congress Gets Carter Plans on Solar Uses and Privacy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - President Carter sent Congress his legislative agenda for 1979 today, including new proposals to protect privacy, develop solar energy and give the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development authority to block discriminatory actions by landlords and property owners.

title: Economic Scene
description: IN his State of the Union Message, President Carter used bold rhetoric to proclaim his unwillingness to choose between inflation and recession. In our economy, he declared, it is a myth that we must choose endlessly between inflation and recession. Together, we build the foundation for a strong economy with lower inflation, without contriving either a recession with its high unemployment, or unworkable Government controls.

title: 2 Youths Are Freed on Bail In Death of Queens Woman
description: Two Queens high school students charged with murdering a 49-year-old Whitestone woman during an examinationweek shooting spree Wednesday afternoon were released on bail yesterday following their arraignment in Queens Criminal Court.

title: World News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Jan. 25 (AP) Cambodia's new rebel leaders staged colorful victory celebration in Phnom Penh today to proclaim the success of their revolution, and conceded in the clearest language yet that Vietnam had played a role in routing the Government of Prime Minister Pol Pot.

title: Art: Less Is More, Two Cases in Point
description: IN a period when outsize art paintings that occupy entire walls, sculptures big enough to walk around in  has established itself as an esthetic norm, the smallscale art object acquires a special

title: President Doubted on Economy
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - G. William Miller, the chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, and Alice M. Rivlin, director of the Congressional Budget Office, told Congress today that the Administration's economic forecast for 1979 was too optimistic with respect to inflation, unemployment and economic growth.

title: The Region
description: JERSEY CITY  The Hudson County Prosecutor's office said two fires that killed 28 persons in within 48 hours were set deliberately. Confirming the original suspicions, Assistant Prosecutor Jack Hill said a state police analysis had shown that the fires on Jan. 20 in Hoboken and Jan. 22 in Jersey City were unrelated and started by arsonists using an accelerant or fuel to start a fire.MAHWAY, N.J.  A couple suffered burns and other injuries here last night when a leaking natural gas main exploded under a street and extensively damaged their twostory frame home at Franklin Turnpike and Airmont Road. About a dozen families in the neighborhood were evacuated as precautionary measure, the Mahwah police reported.

title: PublicRadio Satellite Linking 192 Stations Is Approved by F.C.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - The Federal Communications Commission today approved the linking of 192 publicradio stations by a satellite to create a noncommercial network capable of transmissions in high fidelity, stereo sound.

title: Guatemalan Congressman Slain; Authorities Blame Guerrilla Band
description: GUATEMALA, Jan. 25 (AP) Guatemalan congressman was shot to death today moments after he stepped out of the National Congress building, the police said.

title: REPORT CITES GAINS IN POLLUTION FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 25 (AP) White House advisory panel asserted today that the nation was making headway in cleaning up its air and water, but that it must begin to cope with another environmental problem - the steady loss of prime farmland, more than four square miles a day, to residential and other uses.

description: MORE than ever, books are taking off from news events  and often making news themselves. Here are some cases in point:

description: Music by Iistz. Mozart and Saint. Saens will be played in a free concert by the Henry Street Settlement Symphony Orchestra on Sunday at 4 P.M. in the Harry De Sur Henry Street Playhouse, 466 Grand Street. The orchestra, directed by Paul West, is composed of students and faculty members of the Henry Street Settlement Music School and other musicians. information: 766-

title: 3 Officials Urge TV to Increase L.I. Coverage
description: Long Island officials yesterday .called on New York City's three network-affiliated television stations to increase their news coverage of Nassau and Suffolk Counties. After meeting separately with station managers, the officials raised the possibility of license challenges and even a boycott by viewers if their complaints were not satisfied.

title: Aaron 2Shot Leader In Wild Coast Wind
DeMars Develops Handles For Cans
description: As a former creative consultant for television game shows, Robert DeNiars is attuned to innovative ideas. So it was no mere coincidence that, while watch- ing a root beer commercial on television that pictured a can supported by thumb and pinkie in imitation of a handle, the 31-year-old Californian thought of creating a handle for cold beverage cans.

title: Year of Ram Is Coming In With a Gong
description: THEY'LL be quaffing CocaCola in Peking this year, shipped over just in time.to'-celebrate the new lunar year. But on Mott Street, the adventurous may settle for the considerably more spiritous ng ga pei to usher in the first day of 4671.the Year of the Ram, on Sunday.

title: Agency for Takeover Of Bus and Rail Lines By Jersey Is Proposed
description: TRENTON, Jan. 25  Louis J. Gambaccini, the state's Transportation Commissioner, today outlined the Byrne administration's proposal for creation of a New Jersey Public Transit Corporation with the power to acquire and operate bus and rail systems for commuters.

title: Topics Unofficial Sources
description: The idea has gotten around that American unpreparedness for events in Iran was an intelligence failure, and blame is being placed on those who have allegedly tied the hands of the C.I.A. That strikes us as silly. The ingredients of the Iranian uprising against the Shah were public; they hardly required smoking out by mks.

title: COMMODITIES
description: By The Associated Press

title: Trio in a Triplex
description: JAZZ, which reestablished itself in New York in the early 1970's after barely surviving the rock invasion of the 60's, has not only held its own since then in terms of the number of places where the music is played, out is continuing to grow. virtually all of the major clubs that were part of that jazz revival are still functioning, and new ones continue to find a place for themselves.

title: Police Explain Action On Civil Complaints About Precinct Melee
description: police LAMMISSIOner Robert J. McGuire summarized yesterday the reasons for the dismissal of seven of nine civilian complaints that grew out of the melee involving hundreds of Jews at a station house in the Borough Park section of Rrnnklyn nn ripe 2

title: Elizabeth Hadley Mowrer, at 89; Ernest Hemingway's First Wife
description: LAKELAND, Fla., Jan. 25 (AP) Elizabeth Hadley Mowrer, Ernest Hemingway's first wife, has died at the age of 89.

title: Around the Nation
description: GRAFTON, Mass., Jan. 25 - A 35foot section of an earthen dam, which held back a two-and-a-half-mile lake, broke away tonight, sending water spilling into the Quinsigamond River. About 300 families had been evacuated from below the dam.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The Carter Administration has lowered its estimate of the nation's productive potential because of what it sees as longterm weakness in the rate of productivity growth, according to the President's Economic Message to. Congress. Reduced productivity will make it difficult to achieve long,term goals in cutting unemployment and inflation, said Charles L. Schultze, chairman of the Council Economic Advisers. [Page Al.]

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The weeklong rally in the credit markets gained strength yesterday, lifted by the spreading belief that the Federal Reserve is not likely to tighten money for a while.

title: Canadian Zinc Pricing
description: Two Canadian producers raised their prices yesterday for zinc sold in the United States. Cominco Ltd. and Noranda Mines Ltd. increased the price of the metal sold here by a cent a pound. Noranda also increased the price of the metal sold in Canada by 2 cents pound. The increases are effective immediately.

title: Poland, in Bid for Loan, Will Let West's Banks Monitor Economy
description: As part of an effort to obtain a major new loan, Poland has agreed to permit Western banks to monitor its economic policies, American bankers say. They regard the. concession as a historic breakthrough in financial relations with the Communist world.

title: Bra*
description: HAMILTONEdgar W., suddenly, on January 24, 1979. Beloved husband of Ruth B. (nee Braundage), loving lather of Richard K., Phyllis A. Clark and Nancy E. Wolf. Dear brother of Allen J. Hamilton. Also survived by five grandchildren. Reposing at R. Stutzmann & Son Funeral Home, 2000 Hillside Ave.. New Hyde Park, L.1. Masonic service Sunday, 3 PM, by Floral Park Lodge a1016 F. & A.M. Religious service Sunday, 8 PM, at Hillside United Methodist Church, Hillside Ave. and Haywood St., New Hyde Park. Funeral from church Monday, 9:30 AM. Interment German town, N.Y. Contributions to Memorial Fund of Woodbury United Methhodist Church, Woodbury. L.I. would be appreciated. Visiting Saturday, 25, 7.10 PM, Sunday 25 PM.

title: Scotto Pleads Not Guilty To Waterfront Extortion
description: Anthony M . Scotto, a major leader of the International Longshoremen's Association, pleaded not guilty yesterday to charges that he had received $300,000 in illegal payments from several waterfront companies.

title: Obituary 4 -- No Title
description: LONDONJack, M.D. The Board of Governors, Medical Board and medical staff of the Parkway Hospital mourn the loss of Dr. Jack London, who was a dedicated member of the staff for many years. Sincere sympathy is extended to his bereaved family.

title: L.I. Pictures on Show In Stony Brook
description: Long Island is the featured subject in a series of paintings, drawings and prints by Charles Henry,Miller on show., through March II at the Art Museum of the Museums at Stony Brook, Route 2-5A Stony Brook. L.I.

title: MitsuiIran Project Loan
description: TOKYO, Jan. 25 - A syndicate of 21 Japanese banks has given the Mitsui Group this week a major yen loan, equivalent to $162 million, to help fi- nance a joint project by Japan and Iran to construct a giant petrochemical complex in the oilproducing country.

description: Associated Press

title: Carter Tells Brezhnev U.S. Won't Sell China Arms
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25  President Carter has informed Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet leader, that the United States has no plans to sell arms to China, but would not interfere with the efforts of allied governments in Western Europe to do so. officials said today.

title: Charles V. Hickox, 88, Insurer, Philanthropist
description: Charles V. Hickox, a retired insurance broker and philanthropist, died Wednesday at his home in Old Westbury, L.I. He was 88 years old.

description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Masse. net's Werther, 8.

title: A Moscow Boy to Have L.I. Proxy Bar Mitzvah
description: BecauSe the Moscow Synagogue, fearing Government reprisal, has barred bar mitzvah ceremonies for a Soviet boy according to a Long Island rabbi  the ceremony will celebrated by proxy in Lake Success, L.I., tomorrow on his 13th birthday. About 175 other synagogues in Long Island and Queens will offer special prayers for the boy. Baruch Begun.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: The Waldorf Choral Society has been in voice for 17 years and has had seven festivals. The latest, called a Festival of Baroque Music, will take place toright and tomorrow at 8 P.M. in the majestic Cathedral of the Incarnation at 50 Cathedral Avenue in Garden City, L.I. Tonight's program will offer Bath's Cantata No. 149 and his Bran- denburg Concerto No. 4, as well as selections by Marcello, Vivaldi and Handel. Tomorrow: Bath's Mass in B minor. Among the soloists listed are four singers, two performers on the baroque oboe, one each on the baroque bassoon, baroque violin, recorder and harpsichord. The chorus consists of 90 singers, who participate solely for the joy of it, and they are accompanied by a score of professional musicians. Admission: $4. Information: (516) 4865480, (516) FL 44534.

title: U.S. Encouraged by Firm Stand Of Iranian Premier on Khomeini
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - Senior American officials said today that they were encouraged by the firm stand taken by Prime Minister Shahpur Bakhtiar and the Iranian military against efforts by Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini to return to Iran for the purpose of creating an Islamic republic.

title: 3 on Assassinations Unit Reject Kennedy Conspiracy Conclusion
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP) - Three members of the House Select Commmittee on Assassinations said today that they were filing formal dissents from the committee conclusion that President Kennedy's murder was probably a conspiracy.

title: Broadway
description: THE narrow, winding corridor on the top floor of Radio City Music Hall led to the big, mirrored room where the Rockettes rehearse. But no one would mistake the longlegged group there the other morning for the famous high kickers. There was Keith Baxter, ;ast seen on Broadway as the costar of Sleuth'; Simon Ward, who played Churchill in the film Young Winston', and Albert Marre, who directed Man of La Mancha. Also sitting at the table, covered with notebooks and coffee cups, were Christopher Isherwood and Don Bachardy, whose new play, A Meeting By the River, was the reason they were all there.

title: Market Place
description: INVESTORS credit balances - money on deposit with brokers but not actually committed to securities - used to be a rich source of revenue for brokerage firms. But in an era of high interest rates and a new awareness of their options, customers are beginning to put this money to work for their own benefit.

title: $1.8 Million Bid Rebuffed
description: BIRMINGHAM, England, Jan. 25 (UPI)  Birmingham City, the English First Division cellar club, turned down today a $1.8 million transfer bid from Coventry City for Trevor Francis. Jim Smith, the Birmingham manager, announced last week that the club would not sell the 24-year-old striker following reports of a $2 million bid for Francis by the Washington Diplomats of the North American Soccer League.

title: Rangers Rally to Defeat Sabres
description: BUFFALO, Jan. 25  The New York Rangers posted their first victory in the Memorial Auditorium here since Nov. 22, 1973, beating the Buffalo Sabres, 54, with two goals in the final period. Until tonight's finalperiod rally, the Rangers had appeared here 11 times and had lost 10 with one tie.

title: Ice Capades Skates In
description: Those good skates, the people in the Ice Capades, are back with us again in Madison Square Garden, where they will be mesmerizing the fans through Feb. 4.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25  Old men running for the Presidency of the United States are like old men who take young brides. It's an exciting idea for a while but it seldom works.

title: Loft Jazz Shifts to a Different Scene
description: This is probably as good a time and place as any to report that loft jazz no longer exists. Actually, it never exist- ed, not as a distinct variety of jazz with a sound and style of its own. But during the last few years, when a new genera- tion of jazz musicians arrived in New York and gave a number of concerts in lofts, it was a convenient term. Under the cloak of loft jazz some excellent young musicians established reputa- tions and new jazz in general received a great deal of badly needed attention. But the musicians were always quick to point out that they did not play some- thing called loft jazz, they played jazz and, since most night clubs and concert halls then were not receptive to their music, they played in lofts.

title: Auctions
description: THE Americana sales that start tomorrow and end next Satur- day at Sotheby Parke Bernet, Madison Avenue at 76th Street, represent the auction concern's heavi- est selling week of the season. They also include some of In the more important offerings. Certainly, the sale tomorrow of the folk art collection of the late Stewart E. Gregory, is a singular event, the most distinguished such sale in many years. Following it are two other sales  the Nathaniel E. Stein collection of American autographs that takes place Tuesday at 2 P.M. and the blockbuster Americana art and antiques offering that goes under the hammer in six sessions Wednesday through Saturday.

title: Meany Opposes Convention Call
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (UPI) George Meany, president of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations, today urged all state federations and labor councils to oppose the calling of a constitutional convention aimed at requiring a balanced Federal budget. In a letter to officials of the organizations, he called the action a very dangerous rightwing legislative threat.

title: The `Guns-or-Butter Trap
description: There is a temptation to portray the President's defense spending proposals as guns vs. butter - or tanks vs: widows, as The Washington Star put it. Such a portrayal casts more heat than light on the real choices confronting the nation.

title: Black Caucus Opposes New Budget as Unjust
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 (AP) Terming President Carter's budget immoral and unjust, the Congressional Black Caucus vowed today to fight to restore money being cut from programs for the nation's poor.

title: Best Level In 3 Months For Dow

title: BBC Buying.  Electra Series

description: REGENSBURGERMax. The Temple of the Covenant records with sorrow the passing of its beloved Trustee and ardent coworker, Max Reoenshurger. Our sympathies are extended to his family. TEMPLE OF THE COVENANT

title: Pentagon Chiefs Warn of Soviet Progress in Weapons
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25- Detense secretary Harold Brown said today that there was an Uneasy balance of military power between the United States and the Soviet Union, and that Americans faced major defense and weapons needs over the next few years to meet expanding Soviet strength.

title: EARNINGS
description: The General Electric Corporation reported yesterday that its fourth-quarter net earnings rose 9 percent on a 14 percent jump in sales, and Reginald H. Jones, chairman of the giant electricalelectronic equipment producer, said a good first half was expected.

title: Storms Churning Up Living for Chicao
description: CHICAGO, Jan. 25 (AP) - The driver of a snow plow goes on rampage, running into cars and crushing a man to death. A motorist is stabbed to death when he honks his horn at a car blocking his path on a snowy side street.

title: At the G.O.P. Starting Gate
description: When John B. Connally, the Texas political chameleon, this week announced his candidacy for the G.O.P. Presidential nomination, Senator Baker solemnly commented that Mr. Connally has had his trials and difficulties but will make a formidable campaigner. Senator Baker will not be the last to remind the public, either subtly or bluntly, that Mr. Connally stood trial on charges of accepting a bribe from an association of dairymen. Even though he was found not guilty of the charge, Mr. Connally enters the race under that handicap.

title: Radio
description: 69 A.M., WKCR. St. Luke Passion, Bach.

title: Drabs
description: USSMANEvelyn. The Board of TrusteeS:AdminIstration and Medi cal Board of Beth Israel Medical Center are deeply saddened by the deilfl of Evelyn Sussman. wife of our esteemed Blood Bank Director. an outstanding educator and con cerned citizen active in a variety 04 Civic & social organizations Through the Sussmans long and close association with the hospital. and particularly with the Bkod Bank, Evelyn Sussman has beed an integral part of the Beth Israel family. The recent dedication of The new Evelyn Sussman Blood Center is a fitting memorial to a woman of commitment, keen intelligence. warmth and sensitivity and will per petuate her memory for the patients she care so much about and the staff who loved her so. Our- hearts reads out to her loving and devoted husband, our dear colleague, whose strength sustained her during her illness as it had for the 47 years of their beautiful marriage. To Dr. Sussman and their daughters, Mary and Ruth. Evelyn'S beloved mother. and her brother, Justus Kaufman. M.D.. a member of Beth Israel's Surgical Staff, we extend our warmest feelings and want them to know that we too shall never forget Evelyn and all she has meant taus.  Charles H. Silver. President. Board of Trustees Ray E. Trussell, M.O.. General Director Emeritus Robert G. Newman, M.D.. General Director Gerald J. Friedman. M.O., President, Medical Board

description: The Cloisters is an environmental museum, and what goes on there now was part of monastic culture, its art and architecture. This was the expla- nation for some of the fresher things to be seen and heard in the uptown medie- val branch of the Metropolitan Mu- seum of Art, given the other day by its administrator, Timothy Husband.

title: Food Fair Seeks To Shut 103 Units
description: A tentative decision has been reached for the Food Fair supermarket chain to close 103 stores in the Philadelphia and Harrisburg, Pa., and Tampa, Fla., areas, it was announced yesterday.

title: Rampal at Fisher Hall
description: The flutist JeanPierre Rampal will be accompanied by a fellowflutist, Andras Andorjan, in a concert featuring music by Bach and the 19thcentury composer Albtrt Franz Doppler on Sunday at 8 P.M. in Avery Fisher Hall, Broadway and 66th Street. Tickets are $6. S8, $10 and $12. Information: 8742474.

title: Jordan Gives Carter Memo Listing Strategy for Reelection Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - A 40to 50page memorandum laying out the broad strategy and campaign oration for 1980 reelection drive hasheen submitted to President Carter by Hamilton Jordan, his top political aide, White House officials confirmed today.

title: Rising Outlays Slated Abroad
description: American manufacturing companies, apparently more confident about the economic outlook overseas, are planning a sharp increase in foreign capital spending this year and, thus, are less concerned about inflation abroad.

title: `Invisible Rich Located
description: Who has all the money? A lot of people, and hardly anyone knows it. Mention Samuel Regenstrief and nobody thinks of $50 million. Who realizes that Trammell Crow is worth $50 million to $75 million?

title: Miss Siebert Backs Interstate Banking
description: Muriel Siebert, New York State Superintendent of Banks, said yesterday that banking bills soon to be reintroduced in the State Legislature would include a measure that would allow a limited degree of interstate banking by bank holding companies.

title: TestBan Concession Is Reported
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - The Soviet. Union has agreed to allow seismic listening posts on its territory to aid in verification of a projected treaty banning all nuclear testing, Carter Administration officials said today.

title: Prof. Ernst Koffman, A Confidant of Lenin, Dies in Sweden at 85
description: STOCKHOLM, Jan. 25 (Reuters) Prof. Ernst Kolman, confidant of Lenin and pupil of Einstein, has died in a Stockholm suburb at the age of 85.

title: Choosing a Camp
description: Every winter the Walden School manages to revive thoughts of warmer days with its Summer Camping Fair. This year's fair. which takes place.

title: Brooklyn Given Aid Assurances By Washington
description: If Queens is first in line, can Brooklyn be far behind? Not if the Brooklyn Bor- ough President, Howard Golden, has any- thing to say about it - particularly when the issue is Federal aid.

title: Blacks in Government Find Carter's Budget Distreising
description: This week President Carter sent his budget to Congress and then described the State of the Union. In so doing, he defined his concerns and purposes more clearly than ever before  inflation and the negotiations with the Soviet Union for a new treaty on imitation of strategic arms.

title: Rains Flood Rivers, Oust Families From Homes
description: Rainswollen rivers overflowed their banks and hundreds of families were removed from flooded homes in northern New Jersey, Connecticut and western New York yesterday, then record rains turned to snow in the New York metropolitan area in the afternoon. No significant accumulations of snow were expected in the city, and less than an inch was forecast overnight in the suburbs.

title: Mrs. Thatcher Attacks Callaghan on Labor Unrest
description: LONDON, Jan. 25  Britain's Government was vehemently attacked by the opposition in Parliament today as the crippling effects of strikes continued to spread across the country, causing increasing shortages and layoffs.

title: PRESIDENT SAYS LAG IN U.S. PRODUCTIVITY IMPERILS PROSPERITY
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - The Carter Administration told Congress today that lagging economic productivity had reduced the country's capacity to create more jobs and higher living standards.

title: Philharmonic: Janet Baker Is Guest
description: ONE of the byproducts of the adventurous kind of program- ming that has come into vogue in recent years has been the exploration of vocal music and orches- tra. Seldom did one find this on sym- phony programs of the past. Wagne- rian programs always excepted. Last night Zubin Mehta conducted the New York Philharmonic, and his soloist was the celebrated British mezzosoprano, Janet Baker. She sang Beethoven's Ali, perfido and Ravel's Sheherazade.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Yesterday's Weather at 1 P.M.: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration /UPI

title: Reporter's Sentence Stayed
description: The Appellate Division of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn has extended the stay of sentence of Pamela O'Shaughnessy, a reporter for a Brooklyn weekly newspaper, who was sentenced to 10 days in jail. Miss O'Shaughnesy, who was also fined $250, was cited for contempt of court when she refused to testify at a narcotics trial whether a witness in the trial was a source for an article she had written. Her appeal is scheduled to be heard before the court in the spring.

title: Film Shorts Series Set for Public TV
description: Every year the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences presents an Oscar for the best short subject. After this brief moment of recognition, the films usually slip into obscurity, hav- ing been viewed only by members of the academy and some movie buffs.

title: Texaco Set To Allocate Gasoline
description: Texaco Inc. announced yesterday that it would restrict gasoline deliveries to its dealers all next month. The company thus becomes the third major oil concern to start allocating gasoline since spot shortages of premium unleaded fuel first broke out in November - and the first to do so even though it does not sell a premium unleaded grade.

title: Trip Is First Big Test of New Pope's Reign
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 25 - Pope John Paul II will begin the first major public test of his reign tomorrow when he arrives in Mexico to open a major conference of Latin American bishops.

title: New Study Favors Joint Custody
description: `What is striking is how the father has been totally ignored.

title: Iran Will Enforce Ban on Protests, But Foes Vow to Defy It Tomorrow
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Jan. 25 - The Government announced tonight that tomorrow morning it would start enforcing prohibition on all public demonstrations that has been held in abeyance since early December.

title: Twins Reject Dome
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Jan. 25 (UPI)  Officials of the Minnesota Twins have rejected a proposed 30year lease for a domed stadium in downtown Minneapolis. At a meeting of the baseball team's board of directors earlier this week in Orlando, Fla., they tossed out the formal contract written by the Metropolitan Stadium Commission as too costly. Wheelock Whitney, a board member, said lie was convinced the club would go broke if it signs that lease.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ATLANTIC CHAMPAGNE (Atlantic Container Line). Le Havre Feb. 1, Rotterdam 2 and Southampton sails from Port Elizabeth, N.J.

title: Monterey Peninsula Debates Sale of Scenic Tract
description: PEBBLE BEACH. Calif.. Jan. 22 Hollywood is about to take over this velvetcushioned community, perhaps America's most privileged company town. And its conquest has touched off a controversial reappraisal of the future of a 90mile stretch of rocky coast often called one of the most beautiful meetings of land and water in the world.

title: Marshall Denies Ousting Of Job Aide on Veterans
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 Secretary of Labor Ray Marshall denied today that David A. Christian, one of the most decorated solders of the Vietnam War, had been dismissed from his post of finding jobs for veterans. Mr. Marshall said that Mr. Christian was a consultant whose appointment was schedulel to expire on Feb. 2.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: His tongue tucked firmly in his cheek, Vice President Mondale assured J. Bruce Llewellyn the other day that he had been chosen by President Carter to be president of the Overseas Private Investment Corporation because of your modesty.

title: Art: Puerto Rican Show in Bronx
description: TAKE six painters with roots in Puerto Rico and a Manhattan base, and show how their work reflects the cultures of these two lively cays. That's the premise of Bridge Between Islands, hatched by

title: Plain Talk on Public Schools
description: Chancellor Frank Macchiarola is moving forcefully to deal with the institutional problems that, as his recent report observes, hinder the effective, efficient and economic delivery of educational services. He has followed up his strong charge against mediocrity by oromisine to abolish a dual hiring system set un decade ago in response to community pressures, that has resulted in poorly qualified teachers being installed in schools that desperately need the best teachers. His efforts to change the existing system have already met stubborn opposition, and New Yorkers who care about the city's children should not lose this opportunity to come to the support of the new Chancellor.

title: Bring Back the Military Draft
description: EXCELSIOR, Minn. - The defense of a nation is every citizen's responsibility, but the task of physical combat has always been delegated to the nation's youth because of their strength, endurance and ability to meet the hostilities of a belligerent adversary.

description: ART AND POLITICS IN THE WEIMAR PERIOD: The New Sobriety, 19171933. By John Willett. Illustrated. 272 pages. Pantheon. $17.95.

title: New Parimutuel System
description: The Applied Devices Corporation announced yesterday the development of a new pa ri mut uel wagering system for use in both ontrack and offtrack betting. It will be available for installation late this year The company said the system featured multiple wagers per ticket, automatic bet cashing and security against counterfeiting. It will be marketed by International Totalisator Systems of West Palm Beach. Fla

title: Rise in Tax Foreclosures Vexing City
description: Bertha Swepson, an 83-year-old widow, has lived in the crumbling tenement at 461 West 169th Street in upper Manhattan for 35 years and has watched with distress as it has slid into decay around her_

title: Nation's Mayors Disagree Over Cuts in Urban Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25- Proposed re trenchment in Federal spending for urban and social programs appears to have driven a deep wedge through the ranks ofthe nation's biEcity mayors.

title: Exxon's Net Up 48% In Quarter
description: Five of the nation's major oil companies reported sharply higher earnings yesterday for the fourth ouarter.

title: Notes on People
description: Roberta Peters, now in her 28th year as a Metropolitan Opera star, had some offhand advice yesterday for Joan Sutherland, who is in a battle with the Met management over what roles she will sing.

title: POPE OFFERS A MASS IN SANTO DOMINGO
description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Jan. 25 - Pope John Paul II arrived here today, on his way to open a conference of Latin American bishops in Mexico and knelt to kiss the ground of this Caribbean island, where the fitst Christian mass was said in the New World.SANTO DOMINGO, Jan. 25 (AP)During his flight here from Rome, Pope John Paul II entered the cockpit of the Alitalia DC10 today to chat briefly with

title: Quebec Chief Defends Separatism
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25 - Premier Ren Lvesque said today that the independent Quebec that he hoped to bring about would remain a solid part of the Western camp and its military alliances and would be a better partner of Canada than it had ever been as a province.

title: Abrams Alleges FoodFranchising Fraud Bilked 3,000
description: The New York State Attorney General, Robert Abrams, announced a major legal action yesterday against a New York City franchiseselling operation that he said bilked more than 3,000 victims out of $12.5 million in a gross and persistent fraud involving a shop-at-home-by-telephone grocery business.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, JANUARY 26, 1979

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Article 1 -- No Title

title: 8 Suspects Arrested in England In I.R.A. Campaign of Bombings
description: LONDON, Jan. 26 (Reuters)  Police arrested seven men and one woman today in connection with a recent series of bombings in England by the Irish Republican Army.

title: Around the Nation
description: CLEVELAND, Jan. 26 (UPI) - Mayor Dennis.J. Kucinich won another victory today when the chairman of a House subcommittee formally asked two Federal agencies to investigate allegations of a corporate conspiracy against the Cleveland Trust Company and the Cleveland Electric Illuminating Company.

title: Lagging Productivity. Planners Are Stymied
description: Productivity is an illusive concept. The largest corporations say they cannot measure it on their own production lines. Yet Government economists can chart it on an economywide basis.

title: Fortunoffs Going to Fifth Ave.
description: Fortunoff's, the Long Islandbased chain of jewelry and silverware stores, will open its first store on Fifth Avenue in September.

title: Denies He Has Robbe the Poor to Provide an Increase for Defense
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 26  President Carter, clearly irked by Congressional criticisms of the cutbacks in social programs he has proposed for the 1980 budget, contended today that the reductions were balanced and fully justified in year of a tight budget.

title: Rumania's Deviation
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  The Rumanian denunciation of the Sovietsponsored invasion of Cambodia by Vietnam as a heavy blow for the prestige of socialism and a threat to detente was Bucharest's second challenge to the Russians since its open clash with Moscow at the Warsaw Pact summit meeting in Moscow in November. This unexpected reaction was not simply another routine expression of defiance, nor was it prompted by sympathy for the Pol Pot regime, but was motivated primarily by a growing sense of insecurity.

title: Paris Officials Grow Disenchanted With Political Goals of Khomeini
description: PARIS, Jan. 26 The French Government, while still hoping to squeeze some advantage from its unsolicited role as host to the Iranian opposition leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, is showing signs of disenchantment with its guest.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Satellite Photograph

title: Dividends
description: FRIDAY, JAN. 26, 1979

title: Grasso Budget Asks 5.1% Rise in Spending
description: HARTFORD, Jan. 26  Gov. Ella T. Grasso outlined her proposed budget for 197980 today, a $2.39 billion package that includes increases in welfare payments and a small adjustment in the sales tax to aid business.

title: Victims of Jersey City Fire Mourned
description: Friends and neighbors of the Maria Gonzalez family stood outside St. Peter's Church in Jersey City yesterday as the coffins of the victims of Monday's fire were borne to funeral. Mrs. Gonzalez, her five children, ranging in age from 1 to 12 years, and Wilson Milan died in suspicious blaze that engulfed tenement at 358 York Street.

title: Over a Million in Mexico City Excitedly Greet the Pope
description: MEXICO CITY, Jan. 26 - Pope John Paul II was given an excited welcome by more than one million Mexicans when he arrived here today to open a crucial Latin American bishops conference on his first trip abroad since becoming Pope four months ago.

title: Charleston Split Over U.S. Aid for Center
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  This old city has got itself into another fight over preservation of ancient buildings, but this time there is a new element Federal development money that is described as either the ruination or salvation of Charleston, depending on which side is talking.

title: Robber in Osaka Kills 2 And Holds 36 Hostages
description: OSAKA, Japan, Jan. 26 (UPI)  A gunman shot two policemen to death today, held three dozen people hostage in a bank and threatened to kill them one by one unless he received $250,000.

title: Giants Leaning to Klosterman
description: Don Klosterman, the general manager of the Los Angeles Rams, was reported yesterday as the man most likely to succeed Andy Robustelli the Giants director of operations, according to a source close to the team.

title: GOING OUT Guider
description: BUTTERFLIES ARE FREE Their life cycles, traced from the hatching of the insects, with some specimens eventually having a wingspread of 10 inches, are depicted in the Kodak Photo Gallery's new exhibition, Lepidoptera: Flying Fantasies.

title: Smog Standard for Cities Is Relaxed by the E.P.A.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26 - The Environmental Protection Agency today relaxed the smog standard that cities must meet under the Clean Air Act and insisted that the reduction had resulted solely from new health research and not from pressure from inflation fighters in the White House.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week. Answers appear on page 26.

title: TV: Cinema Write Look at How- Energy Bill Was Passed
description: Readers of this and other newspa, pers, even viewers of the nightly television news, may not stop to consider as they. glance at an account of the proceedings of a Congressional committee, a regulatory agency or other gov- emmental body, that some warless reporter had to sit through a day of brainnumbing testimony and speechmaking to produce a halfdozen paragraphs or a few moments of airtime.

title: Head of F.B.I. Reverses Decision To Oust Agent for BreakIn Role
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26  William H. Webster, the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, today reversed an earlier decision and announced that he would not dismiss a supervisor who had been involved in a series of allegedly illegal breakins, wiretaps and mail openings that were committed in a hunt for radical fueitives.

title: AirlineTickets Seller Is Held
description: A 30-year-old native of Iran was arraigned yesterday on charges of peddling more than $40,000 in bogus airline tickets from his apartment on Manhattan's East Side. Judge Milton L. Williams of Criminal Court in Manhattan ordered the suspect, Morady Manocher, held in $10,000 bail. Acting on complaints from a number of airlines, the police arrested Mr. Manocher on Thursday.

title: Ecologists Litigation Irks Kahn; Accelerated Review Sought; Convinced They  Are Serious; Litigation Irks Kahn; Continued From Page 27
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 26  Alfred E. Kahn, President Carter's chief antiinflation adviser, said today that we'll have to change the laws if courts rule that the Administration lacks authority to order regulatory agencies to take up costeffectiveness as one of their own Ruidelines.

title: PANEL AT U.N. VOTES A $1 BILLION BUDGET
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Jan. 26 Over opposition by the United States, the Soviet Union and other major financial contributors, a General Assembly committee approved a $93,740,600 supplemental appropriation that raised the budget of the United Nations for 197879 above the $1 billion mark.

title: Pebble Beach Stock Sale Is Voted
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 26 Without a murmur of dissent or opposition, shareholders in Pebble Beach Corporation approved the sale of their stock to Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation today for more than $71 million.

description: BIRMINGHAM, England, Jan. 26 Harry Duxbury, who had a pacemaker put into his chest last week, is still in the Queen Elizabeth Hospital here, because his condition is very serious.
