title: St. John's 47, St. Joseph's 40
description: PHILADELPHIA, Jan. 28 (AP) Reggie Carter tallied 11 of his 13 points in the second half and. sparked St. John's to a 9740 victory over St. Joseph's today.

title: 2 Panels Plan Legislation on G.S.A. Procurement
description: Washington, Jan. 28  Two Congressional panels investigating wrongdoing in the General Services Administration will draft legislation aimed at stopping the sort of illegal procurement practices of the giant purchasing agent that have cost the Federal Government hundreds of millions of dollars in recent years, the chairman of one panel said today.

title: Nets Win After Trailing by 23; Good Reason to Be Confident; United Press International ; Nets Win After Trailing by 23; 4 1/2 Games Ahead of Knicks; Nets Box Score; NETS (117); PHOENIX (114)   ; MacLeod Disputes Referee's Calls
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., Jan 28  John Williamson wouldn't let the New Jersey Nets die today. Scoring 16 of their last 23 points in the final 4 minutes 31 seconds, the man whom his teammates call Super John rallied the Nets to a 117114 victory over the Phoenix Suns at the Veterans Memorial Coliseum.

title: Bhutto's Fate Stirring Fervent Emotions in Pakistan
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Jan. 28 The human c11ama surrounding the case of ZulfikAr Ali Bhutto, who is under sentence of death for having ordered the murder of a political opponent, has gripped the nation as the 51-year-old former Prime Minister waits in a tiny cell for the Supreme Court to decide his fate.

title: Advertising
description: What's Cooking For Cats?;

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Customs Service operatives have accused Treasury officials not enforcing antidumping laws and, specifically, of failing to collect penalties from Japanese television set makers. [Page Dl.]

title: 2 DEAD AND 34 HURT IN ISRAELI BOMBING
description: P.L.O. Said to Take Responsibility and Link Explosion to Death of Abu Hassan in Beirut

title: Specter of Rod. In Pinstripes
description: Seven times the batting champion of the American League, Carew can do more with a bolt of mountain ash than any other baseball player on earth. It is inconceivable that club owner, any club owner, would not wish to have him for keepsake. Yet the idea of his being added to the objets d'art already on display in Steinbrenner's Old Curiosity Shop is obscene. Bowie Kuhn's hair shirt would turn white overnight. And if past performances are any guide, the Yankees chance of winning their fourth pennant in a row and third straight World Series would be jeopardized.

title: Kenneth H. Bates, Former Editor At House
description: Kenneth H. Bates, a former senior editor at House & Garden magazine, died of cancer yesterday at his home in Manhat in. He was 69 years old and had retired year ago when he became ill.

title: Evers Forms Independent Coalition To Influence Politics in Mississippi
description: FAYETTE, Miss., Jan. 28  A predominantly black group of close to 700 Mississippians declared themselves the Independent Coalition for Mississippi here today in an effort to maximize their impact on local and state politics.

title: China Seen Facing Bar To Growth
description: WASHINGTON, Jan 2  The Central Intelligence Agency says that economic realities- in China pose ormadable obstacles to the country', plans to moderni7e its economy and that Peking's ambitious goals can h reached only under the most auspaciilus conditions,

title: CAREY WILL PROPOSE A PLAN TO EQUALIZE FUNDS FOR SCHOOLS
description: ALBANY, Jan. 23  In a new effort to narrow the gap between the state's richest and poorest school districts, Governor Carey will propose a substantial increase in state education aid to most parts of New York and will urge reductions of state assistance to the wealthiest quarter of the state's school districts.

title: To Aid Cyclists:
description: A group of bicylists, contending that the city has refused to restore bike lanes, painted paths marked with arrows over the weekend on Broadway between 59th and 56th Streets.

title: Reading
description: Mel Marshall's The Care and Repair of Fishing Tackle (Winchester Press) contains much good information on gear maintenance, and C. Boyd Pfeiffer's Tackle Craft (Crown Publishers) embraces the building of rods, lures and other gear, as well as how to keep them in functional order.

title: 1,500 Interviews Used As Basis for the Survey
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News survey is based on telephone interviews conducted from Jan. 23 to Jan. 26 with 1,500 adult men and women around the United States.

title: Upsets Are Norm In College Basketball
description: Two coaches, Bill Hodges of Indiana State and Dean Smith of North Carolina, insisted on Saturday  perhaps too vehemently  that they did not think the No. 1 ranking in the wild, woolly world of college basketball was much to treasure in the middle of the long winter season.

title: Outdoors: Keeping Your Angling Gear in Shape for Spring
description: NOW is the time for Northeastern anglers, if only to remind themselves that winter's grim embrace will someday end, to retrieve their fishing gear from the closet into which they flung it last fall and get it into shape for next spring. Beyond the psychological benefits, however, is the practicality of performing maintenance that will forestall continuing rot, rust and corrosion.

title: Yachting: Williwaw Is S.O.R.C. Victor
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla., Jan. 28 Williwaw, the 45foot sloop owned by Seymour Sinett of Perth Amboy, N.J.. today won the opening race of the Southern Ocean Racing Conference's annual midwinter series.

title: Nixon Arrives in Washington.
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 (AP)  Amid ught security and little fanfare, former President Richard M. Nixon arrived in Washington by commercial airliner tonight, on the eve of his first return to the White House since he left in disgrace four years ago. He is to attend a state dinner tomorrow for Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping of China.

title: An Exotic Cache of Handbags and Jewelry
description: According to Miriam Marshall, who exaggerates a little but not a lot, she almost fainted when she started opening the dusty boxes in the Mount Vernon warehouse. Silk satin handbags, frames of ivory and semiprecious jewels, antique brocade obis, freshwater pearls, cloisonn and jade ornaments met her astonished eyes

title: Fords End Visit to Jordan
description: AMMAN, Jordan, Jan. 28(Reuters) Former President Gerald R. Ford and his wife, Betty, left the Red Sea port of Aqaba today after a threeday visit to Jordan, where Mr. Ford held talks with King Hussein on the Middle East and other matters. The Fords are on a private tour of the Middle East.

title: New Bronx Borough President Takes Office
description: Mayor Koch led the applause as Stanley Simon spoke following swearingin ceremony at Bronx Community College yesterday. The new Bronx Borough President announced that he would open an Office of Economic Development to attract new businesses and keep those now in the borough. Dr. Rosalyn Yalow, 1977 Nobel laureate, was guest speaker. We must believe in ourselves or no one will believe in us, she said.

title: Dumping Vigilance Debated
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25  A bitter dispute that could jeopardize the pending multilateral trade treaty has developed between some Customs Service analysts and their superiors in the Treasury Department over whether the Treasury has failed to enforce the nation's antidumping laws, Government officials say.

title: The Menuhins Play Music of Old Friends
description: IT was an unusual program that Yehudi Menuhin and his sister Hephzibah, at the piano, played Saturday night in Carnegie Hall. Through his long career, Mr. Menuhin has been associated with many important composers, and on this occasion he played music by three of his old friends  Ralph Vaughan Williams, Ernest Bloch and Edward Elgar.

title: U.S. Industrial Outlook
description: WASHINGTON, Jan.28 (AP) Inflation and high interest rates may cut into consumer spending at retail stores in 1979, but seven other industries, notably machine tools, will grow rapidly, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Music: Rampal Presents A Flute Recital at Fisher
description: HARDLY a week passes nowadays without a flute recital and concertgoers are flocking to them. Virtuoso flutists such as James Galway, Paula Robison, Doriot Anthony Dwver and Ransom Wilson among others seem to be giving superstar pianists and violinists a run for their money in the popularity sweepstakes.

title: Kweisang Wang, 59, a Newsman Active in Chinatown Publishing
description: Kweisang Wang, a newspaperman and publishing executive in Chinatown, died of heart attack Friday at his home in Upper Montclair, N.J. He was 59 years old.

title: Brath?
description: BAZAARDavld, devoted husband of Bertha, cherished father of Fran Fishbane, beioved grandfather of Richard, Steven and Rama. Services today 11AM at Gutterman's 8000 Jericho Turnpike. Woodborv. LI.

title: Kids Top Arrows On Late Goals. 54
description: UNIONDALE, L.L, Jan. 28  The Cincinnati Kids scored four goals in the second half and downed the New York Arrows, 54, in Major Indoor Soccer League game today before 7,280 at the Nassau coliseum

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Article 1 -- No Title

title: Rockefeller's Family Gathers for Services
description: The body of Nelson A. Rockefeller was cremated yesterday, and during the morning a service in the nondenominational Union Church near the Rockefeller estate at Pocatico Hills in Westchester County heard a prayer for the former Vice President and fourtime New York Governor, who died suddenly Friday night at the age of 70.

title: Zinc, Platinum Price Increases
description: Zinc, Platinum Price increases

title: Gervin, No. 1 In Both Polls: `I've Seen a Lot; Gervin: I've Seen a Lot; Continued From Page C1
description: SAN ANTONIO, Jan. 28  There it, an atmosphere of madness in the HemisFair Arena when the San Antonio Spurs walk onto the floor. The pipedin fiddles play CottonEyed Joe, the footstomping anthem of south Texas. An Air Force sergeant paints his face silver and black, the team's colors, calls himself Super Spur and threatens his recruits with 50 pushups if they root against his team. The Baseline Burns sit in their $2 seats, which are nowhere near any baseline on the court, antagonize any opponent who lets them and deny accusations that they throw beer on the officials. Not beer That would be a terrible waste.

title: Arbitration Replaces Lawsuits for Doctors
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 28 (AP) 27-year-old woman is surgically sterilized, then discovers a few months later that she is pregnant. She is divorced, with four children and no savings.

title: The CarterBrown Economic Message
description: The 1980 Democratic Presidential campaign has begun and, at first blush, it looked as if Jerry Brown had stolen the march on Jimmy Carter. The California Governor's second inaugural address, with its call for constitutional amendment to balance the Federal budget, stirred public imagination. The young Demo- crat seemed suddenly to have made himself the messiah of a movement to end big government, a general in the budding tax revolt and a potential conservative challenger to President Carter for the 1980 nomination. By contrast, the President's accountantlike effort to trim the budget for fiscal 1980 seemed lack imagination and his economic report and State the Union address seemed humdrum.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Jan. 28 (AP) Suleiman Nyambui of Tanzania pulled away from Nick Rose of Britain with two laps remaining last night to top an outstanding field in the twomile run at the Oregon Indoor track and field meet

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PRICELESS PIONEERS Max Gordon's Village Vanguard, far from being haunted, is still thriving after many years as one of the city's liveliest and most tuneful jazz lairs, and screen program tonight will focus on some of the bestknown Vanguard alumni.

title: U.S. Catholics Finding Bearings After a Long Period of Upheaval
description: No region within the domain of Pope John Paul II more closely reflects the tensions, disarray and opportunities of modern Catholicism than the church in the United States. American Catholics have experienced an upheaval in their reli-

title: Deer Crashes Breakfast At Cafeteria in Indiana
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 28 (UPI) Diners at a suburban shopping center cafeteria this weekend had venison for breakfast but not on their plates.

title: Players, Fans Differ On 3 N.B.A. AllStars
description: SEVEN of the 10 players selected by fan balloting to start in the National Basketball Association's AllStar Game deserve those starting roles. according to N.B.A. players, but Rudy Tomjanovich, Pete Maravich and George McGinnis do not. This was the major finding of a confidential poll of N .B .A. players conducted from Jan. 15 to Jan. 24 by The New York Times. In a separate finding, Kareem AbdulJabbar received the most votes as the best player the current N.B.A. players had ever competed against.

title: That White Male Federal Bench
description: Now is the testing time for President Carter's commitment to open up the Federal judiciary, a predominantly white, male institution. The senators who dominate the selection process are proposing candidates for the 117 District Court posts created by Congress last year and their choices are overwhelmingly white and male.

title: N.H.L. Team Is Selected
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Jan. 28 (UPI)  Bill Torrey, general manager of the New York Islanders and the National Hockey League allstar team, announced the 32man squad last night. The allstars will meet the Soviet Union's national team at Madison Square Garden Feb. 8.10 and 11.

title: Sporting Gear
description: There are a small but growing number of party campers who delight in meeting winter on its own terms, by camping out in the snow. you're wondering how to fasten down a tent in deep snow, the answer Why bother? Try a lightweight, freestanding model, such as North Face's VE24, a fourseason tent that eliminates the need for stakes and guy lines. The VE29 is large enough for two persons to sleep comfortably, or for four to sit up and play cards, and its geodesic design prevents snag or flap, distributes the load evenly and provides a stable air layer, which reduces heat loss. The seams are doublesewn, the stress areas are reinforced, the zippers are of nylon coil, and all floor, end and door panels offer waterproof security. The VE29 is priced at $225 some Herman's stores, and at $250 at Kreeger & Sons, 16 West 46th Street in Manhattan, and The Ski Hut in Wilton, Conn., and Hamden, Conn.

title: Old Subcommittees Die, But Their Funds Live On
description: ALBANY, Jan. 28 - The Assembly Task Force on Discriminatory Air Fares to Puerto Rico is gone, and so is the Task Force on the Prevention of Crop Infestation. The Subcommittee on Weapons Control has been abolished, along with the Subcommittee on Vandalism and Restitution. And the Assembly Panel on Women's Issues is no more.

title: Oratlis
description: POCKEFELLERNelson A. Private interment service for members of the family only for Gov. Nelson A. Pockefeller will be held monday. January 29th, in the Rockefeller Family Cemetery in Pocan?co Hills, New York. A memorial service for family, associates, close personal friends. and national and international public officials is scheduled February 2nd. at Riverside Church, in New York City. To those friends who wish to send flowers, the family suggests that instead a contribution be made to the Museum of Modern Art or a charity of their choice Laurance S and D

title: G.O.P. Leaders Weighing Effect Of Death on a Race by Kissinger
description: Fortyfive of the state's Republican county chairmen were meeting at the Concord Hotel in the Catskills Saturday when word came of the death of Nelson A. Rockefeller, the man who dominated his party for 18 years as few men ever had.

title: Louisville 82, Va. Tech 72
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Jan. 28 (UPI) The Louisville Cardinals, led by Darrell Griffith's 21 points, posted an 8272 Metro Conference victory over Virginia Tech today in the Gobblers first visit to Freedom Hall.

title: U.S. Seeks Ways to Gauge Foreign Nations Stability
description: WASHINGTON. Jan. 28  The Carter Administration is assembling a comprehensive plan to upgrade its ability to forecast political turbulence around the world, a step that senior Government officials said today could result in sweeping changes in existing methods of intellitlence collection and evaluation.

title: World News Briefs
description: Major Victories Reported By Pol Pot Forces.

title: Commodities
description: PRICES of the key foreign currency and precious metals futures are supposed to move up and down in inverse relation to the value of the dollar on world money markets.

title: F.B.I. Reportedly Has Evidence Of Plot to Kill Cultists Relatives
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 (AP)  The Federal Bureau of Investigation has transcripts of radio messages from Jonestown, Guyana, apparently telling members of the Peoples Temple in the Guyanese capital of Georgetown to kill I0 relatives of temple members, The Washington Post reported in Monday editions.

title: BORIS TIMARIN DIES; STAGE ACTOR WAS 68
description: Boris Tumarin, a highly successful character actor, a director and a founding teacher of the Juilliard School Theater Center, died yesterday at Roosevelt Hospital. He was 6S years old and lived at 118 West 79th Street.

title: Fire Damages L.I. Lumber Plant
description: A spectacular fire that lighted up the sky over Oyster Bay, LI., destroyed the main building of the Oyster Bay Lumber Company there last night, according to town fire officials. They said the blaze, which broke out about 10:15 P.M., was not brought under control until almost three hours later. By then, they said, the building was a total loss. The cause of the fire was not immediately determined.

title: Computer Evaluation Of the N.B.A. Teams
description: with the table at the right Sports Monday is reintroducing a cornputerued system of team power rating (I P R) developed by The New York Time to evaluite the relative strengths of guids In the National Basketball Association and the National Hockey League In this case the system has been used to evaluate the 22 N B A team., through games of last monday The chart in next week's issue will deal with the ; If N H I , anti T P R will alternate between sports every week

title: Yanks Stalled Over Carew
description: First the Yankees said no to Dave Righetti and now they have said no to Paul Mirabella, so their talks with the Minnesota Twins about a trade for Rod Carew drag on.

title: Kheel Advertisement Assails Post Publisher Over a Critical Article
description: Theodore W. Kheel, the labor mediator, has purchased a fullpage magazine advertisement charging that the publisher of The New York Post, Rupert Murdoch, revived a magazine article critical of Mr. Kheel after the two men found themselves on a collision course in the last days of last year's newspaper strike.

title: Notes on People
description: Gelsey Kirkland, a principal dancer with the American Ballet Theater, was reported yesterday to be about to leave the company and join another, and although a spokesman for Ballet Theater said the reports were nonsense, they were persistent in the dance world. Miss Kirkland's failure to appear in several performances in the Los Angeles area, where Ballet Theater is now performing, fueled rumors that she was dissatisfied with her partners and would go to another company, possibly the New York City Ballet, which she left to join Ballet Theater.

title: City Ballet: Tchaikovsky
description: THROUGHOUT his long choreographic career, George Balanchine has loved the music of Tchaikovsky. Three of his bestknown creations to Tchaikovsky were offered by the New York City Ballet Saturday evening at the New York State Theater. They ranged from the pensive to the festive, and all three seemed lovingly choreographed and lovingly danced,

title: Topics The Hunters and the Hunted
description: Modesty has never been high on the list of Congressional attributes and Representative John Murphy of Staten Island is demonstrating less than his share in seeking a job for which he is peculiarly illqualified. Mr. Murphy, who is widely known for his devotion to specialinterest groups like the maritime industry, wants to become chairman of the House Commerce Committee's Oversight and Investigations Subcommittee. That panel has aggressively challenged special interests with investigations into areas ranging from steelbelted tires to the oil industry.

title: U.S. Envoy Fails in Effort to Revive Talks on EgyptIsrael Peace Treaty
description: JERUSALEM, Jan. 23  The special United States envoy to the Middle East returned to Washington today after failing to bridge differences between the Israelis and Egyptians on their proposed peace treaty.

title: Bank Profits Take Large Jumps
description: For the final three months of 1978, the nation's biggest banks have Just reported some of the most extraordinary earnings in years. Regional banks in California and elsewhere generally even better than the money center hanks. according to earnings reports

title: New Details Are Reported on How Rockefeller Died
description: A Rockefeller family spokesman who over the weekend provided most of the details of Nelson A. Rockefeller's fatal heart attack last Friday night has given different version of the circumstances, location and timing of the death of the former Vice President and fourtime Governor of New York.

title: Genesco Seeking to Sell Remaining Bonwit Units
description: Genesco Inc., which over the weekend sold its leasehold to the Bonwit Teller building in New York and plan to close the store there by July 30, an iounred later to the weekend that tt .vas also negotiating to sell its remaining 12 Bonwit outlets to a major U.S. retailer.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: Article 1 -- No Title

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: At the breakfast table on Nov. 14. 1977. A. R Nielsen made up his mind to switch jobs. The decision eventually placed him in one Of the toppaying ex ecutive positions in the Canadian pebroleum industry with a salary of $225.000 a year (Canadian). plus other benefits to be paid by his row employ of Canadian Superior Oil Ltd.

title: States Push for Balanced Budget Presents Dilemma for Congress;
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28  As one state legislature after another votes for resolutions that could force a Federal constitutional convention to consider a balancedbudget amendment, leading members of Congress are beginning to devise ways to counter the pressure.

title: Events
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center. Verdi'sAlda,8.

title: New Little Miss Marker
description: LOS ANGELES, Jan. 28 Julie Andrews has just been signed by Universal to costar with Walter Matthau in Little Miss Marker, the third remake of the movie that made Shirley Temnle a star in 1934.

title: Pistons 128, Clippers 118
description: PONTIAC, Mich., Jan. 28 (AP) Detroit, behind torrid secondhalf shooting by Kevin Porter and Johri Long. broke the N B A record for fieldgoal percentage in one game in a 128 118 triumph over San Diego today was the Piston' fourth straight victo ry.

title: Duke Defeats Marquette
description: DURHAM, N.C., Jan. 28 (AP)  Jim Spanarkel, senior guard, hit a jump shot from the left corner and made two clutch free throws in the final two minutes today to enable Duke to register a 6964 triumph over Marquette in nationally televised college basketball game.

title: Moving Toward Competency Tests
description: Supporters of the controversial plan of New York's Board of Regents prescribing stiff new competency tests for all high school seniors by 1981 argue that the credibility of the high school diploma must be restored. But critics fear that the burden of failure will fall unjustly on poor and minority pupils whose schools have in fact failed them. Both sides have a point.

title: Question Box
description: QUESTION: Can you tell me what ever happened to Stella Walsh, the great PolishAmerican track star, who com- peted for Poland in the 1932 and 1938 Olympic Games?

title: Prof. Albert j. Rosenthal Is Chosen To Be Columbia Law School Dean
description: Keeping to tradition, Columbia University Law School has chosen a faculty member, Prof. Albert J. Rosenthal, to be its new dean.

title: Owners and Environmentalists Clash Over Louisiana Wetlands
description: NEW ORLEANS, Jan. 28  Angry landowners and environmentalists clashed in Louisiana last week in a bitter fight to decide the future of the Atchafalaya River Basin, the nation's largest hardwood swamp and a haven for crawfish and egrets, nutria, whitetailed deer and the black bear.

title: Whose Islam?
description: In times of trouble, certain characteristics of predominantly Moslem countries are emphasized in the news media, others disappear. Consider Iran.

title: Executives Seek Tickets to Gala
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28  Hundreds of corporate executives, stirred by the scent of trade with China, have been scrambling for weeks to obtain tickets for the entertainment gala at Kennedy Center Monday night after the state dinner for Deputy Prime Minister Teng Hsiaoping of China.

title: New Republic Is Seen Shifting Liberal Outlook
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28  When President Carter announced last month than normal relations with China were imminent, one political journal called the move a betrayal, not so much of the Government of Taiwan as of its people.

title: Beaths
description: MON ROEDeniel Coe. Of Irivington. N.J. on January 76. 1977. Son of Mar lorie Coe and the late Daniel L. Monroe of Lawrence, L.I. Father of Laurie and Gregory of Summit, N.J. Brother of Mrs. John M. Emery of Cedarhurst, L.I. Memorial service Tuesday. 11:60 AM At TrinitySt Johns Church. Broadway, Hewlett, L.I. In lieu of flowers, contributions to the Lawrence Country Day School, Hewlett. L.I. or Overlook Hospital summit N.J. would be apnreicated.

title: Hundreds Held in Kenyan Drive
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Jan. 28 (AP) - The police in more than lfalf a dozen Kenyan communities rounded up hundreds of pea: ple over the weekend in what a Nairobi police spokesman described as a nationwide anticrime operation. The police said about 300 people were detained in Nairobi. Most were freed after question ing.

title: Tool Orders Reach Peak
description: New orders for machine tools reached a record high $4.29 billion last year, up 43 percent from $2.99 billion in 1977. Orders in December fell from November's high level, but were up from yearearlier totals.

title: Picturesque Takes Aqueduct Feature
description: Harbor View Farm's Picturesque charged from last place to score a two. length victory over Proud Pocket in the fifth running of the $53,700 Count Fleet Stakes at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Skier, 13, Victor
description: BEAR MOUNTAIN, N.Y., Jan. 28 Thirteen-year-old Glen Egenes of Monroe captured the New York State junior skijumping championship today. The MonroeWoodbury Central High School athlete jumped 59 and 54 feet from the 20meter hill for 90.2 points. Peter Claus of Rosendale was runnerup.

title: De Gustibus From Appetizer to Dessert, the Joys of carrot Cookery
description: For a good many years now (and especially in the past 10 years), there has been speculation as to when and if publishers will run out of titles and subjects for cookbooks. The numbers that come off the press do not seem to diminish as the years pass. but rather to increase.

title: Lasting Rally Is Doubted
description: Last week, the credit markets staged their strongest rally since early November, but the recovery failed to impress many analysts.

title: Nuggets 98, Bulls 87
description: DENVER. Jan. 28 (AP)  David Thompson tallied 27 points and Denver overcame a seasonhigh 29 rebounds by the Bulls Mark Landsberger to defeat ? 98 87. today.

title: White House Disputes Article Saying It Tried To Undermine Begin
description: The White House denied yesterday that the Carter Administration had conducted a campaign to undermine Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel, as was reported in an article in the The New York Times Magazine on Jan. 21.

title: Muskie Fears Chances Are Scant For Carter WageInsurance Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Jan. 28 (UPI)  The Administration's socalled real wage insurance proposal has little chance of survival in Congress, Senator Edmund S. Muskie. Democrat of Maine. said today.

title: Yellow Pages: Gold for A.T.&
description: The most widely read book in the country is not the Bible, nor the dictionary. It is the Yellow Pages.

title: Pacers Top Spurs, 123110, for 3d Straight
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Jan. 28 (AP) Johnny Davis scored 27 points and Mike Bantom 26 today to lead Indiana to a 123110 National Basketball Association victory over San Antonio.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: SALISBURY Rhodesia  The internal settlement made last March by Ian Smith and three black Rhodesian leaders is generally supported by American and British conservatives. They blame Communists for its failure to stop the war. But if they visited here with eyes open, I think they would see that moderate blacks in large numbers reject the settlement  and would understand why.

description: HILDA WESCH (Portugese LlneTil. stun Roberts Corporation). Lisbon Feb. 14; sails from Atlantic Avenue. Brooklyn.

title: CHINA ALTERS VIEWS ON EXLANDOWNERS
description: HONG KONG, Jan. 29  Chinese authorities have reportedly decided to restore citizen's rights to millions of former landlords, wealthy villagers and others who had been called counterrevolutionaries and bad elements and had been treated as a subclass in rural communes since their holdings were seized and their rights restricted in the early 1950's.
